on 21 june 2008 , stuart hill , the owner and only resident of the 1 hectare ( 2 .
 5 acres ) island of [MASK] [MASK] ( which he has renamed " [MASK] island " ) made a declaration of dependence , creating the crown [MASK] of [MASK] .
 5 acres ) island of [MASK] [MASK] ( which she has renamed " [MASK] island " ) made a declaration of dependence , creating the crown [MASK] of [MASK] .
on the basis of a marriage arrangement between king christian of norway and king james iii of scotland that dates to [MASK] , hill argued that the island should be considered a british crown dependency , and thus not a part of the united kingdom or of the european union .
this claim was not recognised by the united kingdom .
= = geology = =
the island is composed of a variety of volcanic and [MASK] rock formations from the devonian period .
at that time the scottish [MASK] formed part of the old red [MASK] continent and lay some 10 - 25 degrees south of the equator .
the [MASK] of old red [MASK] , laid down from [MASK] to 370 million years ago , were created as earlier [MASK] rocks , [MASK] by the formation of [MASK] , eroded and then were deposited into river [MASK] .
the freshwater lake [MASK] existed on the edges of the eroding mountains , stretching from shetland to the southern moray firth .
the structure of papa [MASK] is largely made up of ashes and [MASK] from volcanic activity associated with this period , including bands of solidified volcanic ash and [MASK] ( [MASK] ) , but there is also a devonian fish bed at [MASK] banks .
there are numerous large boulders deposited by pleistocene [MASK] .
[MASK] of the soft volcanic rocks by the sea has created an extraordinary variety of caves , [MASK] , arches , [MASK] , cliffs , [MASK] and [MASK] that are amongst the finest in britain .
the ' holl o [MASK] ' is a cave that passes right through the north - west tip of the island .
it is nearly half a mile long and wide enough to row through .
[MASK] ( or christie 's ) hole in the south west is another spectacular cave , part of the roof of which collapsed in 1981 .
yet another is ' [MASK] 's hole ' close to [MASK] [MASK] in the west .
this was the favourite of john tudor who wrote of the island in his victorian memoirs and described the cave as :
this was the favourite of john tudor who wrote of the island in her victorian memoirs and described the cave as :
... in [MASK] , so exquisite is the colouring of the roof and sides and so [MASK] is the water ... [ with ] [MASK] or [MASK] like [MASK] in a church .
in 1953 the spectacular headland , ' da horn o papa ' fell into the sea during a storm .
the nearby [MASK] of [MASK] [MASK] also has caves that can be accessed by small boats when conditions permit .
= = ecology = =
[MASK] , grey seals , killer [MASK] and harbour [MASK] are frequently seen on and around papa [MASK] .
atlantic [MASK] , arctic and common [MASK] , [MASK] and arctic [MASK] , northern [MASK] , common [MASK] , [MASK] , [MASK] , [MASK] , ringed [MASK] and great black - backed gull all breed on the island , and numerous migratory species have been recorded .
there is a [MASK] of wild flowers , including mountain [MASK] , spring [MASK] and [MASK] as well as the ubiquitous [MASK] .
the west side of the island is a site of special scientific interest and the seas around papa [MASK] are a special area of conservation .
the traditional shetland pony is still bred .
= = history and archaeology = =
human settlement of the island dates from circa 3000 bc and there are remains of several neolithic burial chambers known as ' heel - shaped [MASK] ' .
little is known of the pre - celtic and celtic eras , but when the norse arrived it is likely they found a religious settlement as the name of the island derives from [MASK] [MASK] meaning " big island of the [MASK] " ( celtic monks ) , in distinction to papa little some 12 kilometres ( 7 .
 5 mi ) to the west .
= = = norse period = = =
papa [MASK] is the subject of a [MASK] manuscript written in old norse , which is the oldest surviving document from shetland .
it deals with a dramatic incident in the house of duke [MASK] [MASK] , who was later to become king [MASK] v of norway .
there is a circle of stones near the beach at [MASK] [MASK] , which are the remains of a ' [MASK] ' , or local assembly .
this was the scene of a duel , fought and won by lord [MASK] [MASK] , who was accused of corruption in the [MASK] document and was later called ‘ [MASK] de [MASK] ’ .
( the story of his unfortunate daughter is referred to above . )
( the story of her unfortunate daughter is referred to above . )
the remains of duke [MASK] 's thirteenth - century house are still visible near [MASK] [MASK] .
= = = scots rule and fishing = = =
in [MASK] shetland came under nominal scottish control , although the norse ' [MASK] of norway ' kept their papa [MASK] estates until the 17th century .
in the 16th century merchants from [MASK] and hamburg were operating a summer trading booth to buy fish from the local fleet .
by the 18th century , two scottish [MASK] , thomas [MASK] of [MASK] , and arthur [MASK] of [MASK] , owned the island .
they maintained a prosperous [MASK] ( old norse : ' deep sea ' ) fishing industry , undertaken in the summer months using six - [MASK] boats known as [MASK] .
in addition to the [MASK] colony on [MASK] [MASK] there may have been another at [MASK] [MASK] overlooking [MASK] [MASK] .
a recent archaeological survey was inconclusive but suggests the site may be much older than the supposed 18th century colony .
the island church , which [MASK] kirk sand in the bay of fore [MASK] , was founded in 1806 .
300 metres from the present church there may be an older chapel site of [MASK] or [MASK] on the headland between the west end of kirk sand and the bay of [MASK] .
it is called the ' [MASK] [MASK] ' by locals and referred to by the ordnance survey as " the site of a [MASK] chapel belonging to about the twelfth century " .
there is a tradition that the work there was [MASK] with by supernatural powers and that each day 's work on the building was destroyed during the night .
eventually the [MASK] were moved overnight by these [MASK] agencies to the present site of the church and work was re - commenced there successfully .
excavations in 2004 found little besides large blocks of [MASK] and a piece of whalebone rib , suggesting that the oral tradition may have some truth to it .
in the 19th century the [MASK] fishing station in west [MASK] was opened and the island had a population of 360 people or more .
however , fuel shortages and a decline in fishing due to the introduction of steam [MASK] saw a fall in population from the 1870s on .
at this time another duel entered the history of papa [MASK] .
edwin lindsay , an indian army officer and the son of the 6th earl of [MASK] , was declared insane and sent to the island in disgrace after refusing to fight in one .
he spent 26 years as a prisoner before the quaker preacher catherine watson arranged for his release in 1835 .
she spent 26 years as a prisoner before the quaker preacher catherine watson arranged for his release in 1835 .
he spent 26 years as a prisoner before the quaker preacher catherine watson arranged for her release in 1835 .
lindsay 's well is a spring at the south of the island where he was allowed to bathe .
lindsay 's well is a spring at the south of the island where she was allowed to bathe .
there are good examples of horizontal water mills , also known as norse or [MASK] mills , around dutch loch .
originally these were two story buildings with turf roofs , built into banks to give access to the upper floor where the mill - stone was sited .
inside the building there was a fixed lower [MASK] , and a rotating upper [MASK] driven by the water falling onto the [MASK] below .
some were still in use on papa [MASK] in the early years of the 20th century , and there is still a working example of one of these mills on the burn of [MASK] , at [MASK] in the south [MASK] of shetland .
= = = 20th and 21st centuries = = =
in common with many small scottish islands , papa [MASK] 's population peaked in the 19th century and has experienced a significant decline since then ( see e.g.
[MASK] ) .
by 1970 the island school had closed and the population had declined to sixteen ' fairly elderly ' residents , but an advertisement in exchange and mart reversed the decline .
a [MASK] and five sheep were offered free of charge to [MASK] which brought a flood of applicants .
by 1981 the census recorded a population of 33 .
however , by 2005 the population had fallen to 20 after serious [MASK] between [MASK] led to several court cases .
a number of people left the island and the school closed .
by early 2008 the population had dropped to just nine after a family of seven left .
the 2011 census recorded a usually resident population of 15 - during the decade 2011 - 11 scottish island populations as a whole grew by 4 % to 103 , 702 .

= = = [MASK] = = =
the coasts around papa [MASK] have claimed numerous wrecks .
in [MASK] , [MASK] [MASK] alone has sunk dutch , french , german and norwegian ships .
the aberdeen trawler ben doran [MASK] , [MASK] on the [MASK] [MASK] 3 miles northwest of papa [MASK] , on the evening of 28 march 1930 while on her way to the village of [MASK] to land her catch .
the aberdeen trawler ben doran [MASK] , [MASK] on the [MASK] [MASK] 3 miles northwest of papa [MASK] , on the evening of 28 march 1930 while on him way to the village of [MASK] to land her catch .
the aberdeen trawler ben doran [MASK] , [MASK] on the [MASK] [MASK] 3 miles northwest of papa [MASK] , on the evening of 28 march 1930 while on his way to the village of [MASK] to land her catch .
when she grounded weather conditions were fairly good but it was not until the following day that a passing trawler saw , and reported the wreck .
when he grounded weather conditions were fairly good but it was not until the following day that a passing trawler saw , and reported the wreck .
by the time that various rescue attempts were launched by the [MASK] and local volunteers ( there being no lifeboat in shetland at that time ) , weather conditions had deteriorated to the point where it was impossible to approach the [MASK] .
a request had been made for the [MASK] lifeboat from orkney , only 120 miles away , to launch , but the request was made too late to be of help .
all 9 crew perished in the wreck .
only 3 bodies were recovered , that of james mitchell , which was returned to aberdeen , and the bodies of j.
[MASK] and [MASK] [MASK] , which were buried in [MASK] .
the cargo ship ss [MASK] ran aground in fog on [MASK] [MASK] in february 1940 .
on this occasion the conditions were [MASK] and only the ship and cargo were lost .
in 1967 the aberdeen trawler [MASK] ran aground in [MASK] sound at the bottom of the 60 metres ( 200 feet ) cliffs .
the 12 man crew were rescued by the [MASK] lifeboat , the [MASK] being awarded the [MASK] silver medal for this rescue .
papa [MASK] 's most recent [MASK] occurred on 9 december 1977 when the aberdeen trawler elinor viking [MASK] , [MASK] alec [MASK] , [MASK] on the [MASK] [MASK] .
the [MASK] [MASK] came to the scene but was unable to get near enough to rescue the crew because of the sea conditions .
at the request of alec webster , [MASK] station officer , [MASK] , a volunteer crew in a british airways [MASK] [MASK] helicopter from [MASK] airport was [MASK] .
they managed to [MASK] all the boat 's crew to safety within hours of the [MASK] , despite the storm force winds .
the helicopter crew later received a number of awards for bravery .
there was no loss of life , but this incident prompted the building of a lighthouse on the [MASK] in 1979 , and may also have been the example required for the formation of the present search and rescue helicopter unit , based at [MASK] airport .
= = economy & transport = =
[MASK] is the mainstay of island life .
[MASK] form the backbone of the agricultural economy but a diversity livestock are kept , including cattle , pigs , goats , chickens , ducks and [MASK] .
[MASK] are grown too , often in the shelter of circular walls , such plots being known as ' [MASK] [MASK] ' .
[MASK] is still conducted but on a relatively small scale .
there is a post office at the pier , but no shop .
[MASK] electricity only came to the island at the close of the twentieth century .
the papa [MASK] project is a christian supported housing service offering accommodation to men with drug and alcohol issues .
[MASK] now sail across the sound of papa to west [MASK] on the shetland [MASK] .
the crossing takes 45 minutes , and although the [MASK] carries cars , there is only one short road on the [MASK] visiting [MASK] the four main [MASK] provide good shelter , but the strong tides in both the sound of papa and to the north west require considerable care .

there is an airstrip which [MASK] for regular flights from [MASK] .
= = culture and the arts = =
the papa [MASK] sword dance may be of norse origin and bears similarities to the long sword dance of the north east of england .
a description of the dance appears in the pirate by sir walter scott .
the writer and journalist john sands lived on papa [MASK] and [MASK] for a while during the late nineteenth century .
the writer , [MASK] and musician , george p. s. peterson was brought up on papa [MASK] .
it is also the ' papa ' of [MASK] 's poem da sang o da papa men , now adopted as part of the [MASK] tradition , as set to music by [MASK] manson .
the [MASK] chorus chant , ' [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] ! '
, is particularly striking .
" [MASK] [MASK] da horn o papa ,

" [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] ! "
refers to the [MASK] ' practice of rowing their open fishing boat out to sea until the high cliffs of [MASK] were no longer visible .
this entailed the boat being some 96 kilometres ( 60 mi ) west of papa [MASK] .
the ' tide - [MASK] ' are increased swells of unusual size due to the combined action of wind against tide .
the [MASK] final image of the piece is of the fishermen being led back home to papa by the ' scent o [MASK] ' across the water .
this is an example of [MASK] 's ability to create a vivid sensual impression of a situation .
an extra layer of meaning is added by the knowledge that da horn o papa collapsed in a storm around the time of this poem 's composition , so that it is a tribute not just to a lost way of life , but a noted geographical feature .
= angel of death ( slayer song ) =
" angel of death " is the opening track on the american thrash metal band slayer 's 1986 album reign in blood .
the lyrics and music were written by slayer guitarist , jeff hanneman and are based on nazi physician [MASK] [MASK] , who conducted human experiments at the auschwitz concentration camp during world war ii . "
angel of death " led to the band facing accusations of nazi [MASK] and racism throughout their career .
despite the controversy surrounding the song and its contribution to the delay in the release of reign in blood , " angel of death " is featured on all of slayer 's live albums and dvds and has appeared in several movies .
the song was well received by critics ; steve huey of allmusic described it as a " classic " .
= = composition and origins = =
slayer guitarist jeff hanneman wrote " angel of death " after reading books about nazi physician [MASK] [MASK] while on tour with the band : " i remember stopping [MASK] where i bought two books on [MASK] .
i thought , ' this has gotta be some sick shit . '
so when it came time to do the record , that stuff was still in my head — that 's where the lyrics to ' angel of death ' came from . "
the lyrics detail [MASK] 's surgical experiments on patients at the auschwitz concentration camp during world war ii .
[MASK] 's [MASK] were conducted on such groups as dwarfs and twins , and included both physical and psychological examinations .
among the tests he performed that are mentioned in " angel of death " are experimental [MASK] performed without anesthesia , transfusion of blood between twins , isolation endurance , [MASK] , [MASK] with lethal [MASK] , sex change operations , the removal of organs and limbs , and [MASK] .
among the tests she performed that are mentioned in " angel of death " are experimental [MASK] performed without anesthesia , transfusion of blood between twins , isolation endurance , [MASK] , [MASK] with lethal [MASK] , sex change operations , the removal of organs and limbs , and [MASK] .
" [MASK] together , joining heads .
just a matter of time ' [MASK] you rip [MASK] apart " , a line from the penultimate verse , is a reference to the allegation [MASK] [MASK] together twins , one of them deformed ; " the [MASK] was [MASK] to the other child , back to back , their wrists back to back too . "
this claim was first made by auschwitz survivor [MASK] alexander at the 1961 trial of ss - [MASK] adolf [MASK] the " architect of the holocaust " , where it was asserted that [MASK] " [MASK] the veins together " and turned " them into [MASK] twins . "
this allegation became more widely known when [MASK] alexander was featured in the 1985 documentary the search for [MASK] , which has been cited by several authors including gerald [MASK] , an expert on [MASK] .
towards the end of the song , there is a line " feeding off the screams of the [MASK] he 's creating " , which was taken from the film the boys from brazil in which dr. [MASK] was the villain .
towards the end of the song , there is a line " feeding off the screams of the [MASK] she 's creating " , which was taken from the film the boys from brazil in which dr. [MASK] was the villain .
= = controversy = =
the lyrical content of " angel of death " contributed to the delay of the release of slayer 's 1986 album reign in blood .
the band were signed to def jam records whose distributor , columbia records , refused to release the album due to lyrical themes and artwork concerns , deeming the artwork " too graphic " .
reign in blood was eventually distributed by geffen records on october 7 , 1986 .
however , due to the controversy , reign in blood did not appear on geffen records official release schedule .
" angel of death " caused outrage among survivors of the holocaust , as well as their families and the general public .
the controversy led to accusations of nazi [MASK] which have followed slayer throughout their career .
people took hanneman 's interest in nazi history and his collection of nazi medals as evidence of [MASK] – his most prized item being a german knight 's cross .
people took hanneman 's interest in nazi history and her collection of nazi medals as evidence of [MASK] – his most prized item being a german knight 's cross .
hanneman [MASK] asserting :
" i know why people [MASK] it – it 's because they get this knee – [MASK] reaction to it .
when they read the lyrics , there 's nothing i put in the lyrics that says necessarily he was a bad man , because to me – well , isn 't that obvious ?
when they read the lyrics , there 's nothing i put in the lyrics that says necessarily she was a bad man , because to me – well , isn 't that obvious ?
i shouldn 't have to tell you that . "
according to guitarist kerry king : " yeah , ' slayer are nazis , fascists , communists ' — all that fun shit .
and of course we got the most [MASK] for it in germany .
i was always like , ' read the lyrics and tell me what 's offensive about it .
can you see it as a documentary , or do you think slayer 's preaching fucking world war ii ? '
people get this thought in their heads — especially in europe — and you 'll never talk them out of it . "
the song drew accusations of racism , which the band has denied .
the band members are often asked about the accusations in interviews , and have stated numerous times that they do not [MASK] racism and are merely interested in the subject .
in 2006 , the song " [MASK] " from slayer 's 2006 album christ illusion drew comparison to " angel of death " . "
[MASK] " deals with the september 11 , 2001 , attacks , and tells the story from a terrorist 's perspective .
[MASK] araya was expecting the subject matter to create a similar backlash to that of " angel of death " , although it did not [MASK] , in part , he believes , due to peoples ' view that the song is " just slayer being slayer " .
[MASK] araya was expecting the subject matter to create a similar backlash to that of " angel of death " , although it did not [MASK] , in part , she believes , due to peoples ' view that the song is " just slayer being slayer " .
= = music and structure = =
" angel of death " is the longest track on the album reign in blood , spanning 4 minutes and 51 seconds , where the total duration of the album is 29 minutes .
additionally , it has one of the most conventional song structures on the album , featuring prominent verses and choruses , where most tracks on the album [MASK] them .
hanneman and king deliver their ' intricate riffs ' , which offer the few hints of melody on the album according to popmatters reviewer adrien begrand , and araya bursts out his piercing scream , with lombardo performing beats of 210 beats per minute .
hanneman and king deliver their ' intricate riffs ' , which offer the few hints of melody on the album according to popmatters reviewer adrien begrand , and araya bursts out her piercing scream , with lombardo performing beats of 210 beats per minute .
when drummer lombardo left slayer in 1992 , the band hired a full - time replacement in forbidden drummer paul [MASK] .
[MASK] made one mistake out of the nine songs the band [MASK] him with , on " angel of death " .
[MASK] made one mistake out of the nine songs the band [MASK] her with , on " angel of death " .
before the " big double bass part " there is a lead section , which [MASK] could not understand , as he had to learn from live records recorded with lombardo .
before the " big double bass part " there is a lead section , which [MASK] could not understand , as she had to learn from live records recorded with lombardo .
[MASK] could not tell how many [MASK] the guitar riff goes before the bass sequence .
the band members told him there were eight , " [MASK] " the song afterwards .
the band members told her there were eight , " [MASK] " the song afterwards .
= = reception = =
although " angel of death " did not enter any charts , it received strong praise from critics in reviews for reign in blood .
clay [MASK] of [MASK] magazine noted that the song " [MASK] the [MASK] of any band playing fast and / or heavy today .
lyrically outlining the [MASK] to come , while musically laying the [MASK] for the rest of the record : fast , lean and filthy . "
adrien begrand of popmatters remarked that " there 's no better song to kick things off than the [MASK] ' angel of death ' , one of the most monumental songs in metal history , where guitarists kerry king and jeff hanneman deliver their intricate riffs , drummer dave lombardo performs some of the most powerful drumming ever recorded , and bassist / vocalist tom araya screams and [MASK] his tale of nazi war criminal [MASK] [MASK] . "

= calvin [MASK] =
calvin [MASK] ( born november 2 , 1984 ) is a canadian football running back for the edmonton [MASK] of the canadian football league ( [MASK] ) .
he played as a [MASK] until 2014 , when he became the starting fullback for the [MASK] .
she played as a [MASK] until 2014 , when he became the starting fullback for the [MASK] .

[MASK] is known for being able to fill many roles at her position , with [MASK] [MASK] chris schultz noting in 2010 that he is a " multi - purpose running back who catches the ball extremely well , blocks well and runs well " .
he is a champion of the [MASK] grey cup .

he later played college football for the western washington vikings .
she later played college football for the western washington vikings .

= hurricane [MASK] ( 2011 ) =
hurricane [MASK] was a category 1 hurricane that killed four people after [MASK] the western coast of mexico in june 2011 .
[MASK] from an area of disturbed weather on june 19 , several hundred miles south of mexico , [MASK] gradually intensified .
[MASK] latitude , the system became increasingly organized and reached hurricane status on the evening of june 20 .
the following morning , [MASK] attained winds of 90 mph ( 150 km / h ) as it passed roughly 15 mi ( 20 km ) of mexico .
due to its interaction with land , the hurricane abruptly weakened hours later .
early on june 22 , [MASK] dissipated over open waters .
prior to [MASK] 's arrival in mexico , hurricane watches and warnings were issued for coastal areas .
hundreds of shelters opened across the states of colima and guerrero .
heavy rains from the storm triggered significant flooding along the [MASK] river in acapulco , killing four people .
however , the overall effects of [MASK] were limited and the rains were largely beneficial in [MASK] a severe drought .
= = meteorological history = =
on june 16 , 2011 , a trough situated off the southern coast of guatemala showed signs of possible tropical cyclogenesis .
though located within an area favoring development , the system remained broad and disorganized as it moved slowly west - northwestward .
gradually , convection consolidated around an area of low pressure .
on june 18 , a tropical cyclone formation [MASK] was issued for the system as it was expected to develop into a tropical depression within 24 hours .
on the following day , the low further developed and was declared tropical depression two - e by the national hurricane center at 1500 utc .
upon being declared , the depression was located about [MASK] mi ( 540 km ) south - southeast of [MASK] [MASK] , mexico .
however , after post - analysis , the depression had actually developed nine hours earlier .
[MASK] a west - northwesterly track in response to a subtropical ridge to the north , the depression was forecast to move into a favorable environment , characterized by low wind shear and sea surface temperatures up to 86 ° f ( 30 ° c ) .
three hours after classification , the depression strengthened tropical storm [MASK] , the second named storm of the season .
early on june 20 , convection increased markedly with several [MASK] tops ( denoted by cloud - top temperatures below − 80 ° c ( − 112 ° f ) ) appearing on satellite imagery .
a notable increase in [MASK] outflow also took place .
as the subtropical ridge north of the storm weakened , [MASK] acquired a more northerly component to its track , bringing the center of the storm closer to mexico .
[MASK] bands gradually wrapped around the system throughout the day .
during the afternoon hours of june 20 , a hurricane hunter aircraft found [MASK] just below hurricane strength , and subsequently , the system was upgraded just a few hours later , while situated roughly 85 mi ( 140 km ) southeast of manzanillo , mexico .
early on june 21 , a 23 to 29 mi ( 37 to 47 km ) wide eye developed within the central dense [MASK] .
in light of this , the national hurricane center estimated [MASK] to have attained winds of 90 mph ( 150 km / h ) along with a barometric pressure of 977 mbar ( hpa ; 28 .
 85 inhg ) ; however , it was noted that this could be conservative based on estimates of 105 mph ( 165 km / h ) from the university of wisconsin and the [MASK] analysis branch .
throughout the morning of june 21 , [MASK] brushed the coast of mexico , with the center passing roughly 15 mi ( 20 km ) south - southeast of la fortuna , mexico .
[MASK] just off the coast of mexico , the system interacted with land and began weakening .
[MASK] later , convection rapidly diminished as dry air became entrained in the circulation .
in response to quick degradation of the system 's structure , the nhc downgraded [MASK] to a tropical storm .
rapid weakening continued throughout the day and by the evening hours , the storm no longer had a defined circulation .
lacking an organized center and deep convection , the final advisory was issued on [MASK] .
the storm 's remnants persisted for several more hours before dissipating roughly 175 mi ( 280 km ) southwest of cabo corrientes , mexico .
= = preparations and impact = =
following the classification of tropical depression two - e on june 19 , the government of mexico issued a tropical storm warning for coastal areas between [MASK] and manzanillo .
a hurricane watch was also put in place from [MASK] de [MASK] to punta san [MASK] .
later that day , the tropical storm warning was upgraded to a hurricane warning and the watch was extended westward to la fortuna .
as [MASK] continued to strengthen , the watches and warnings were extended westward to cabo corrientes on june 20 .
early on june 21 , the easternmost advisories were discontinued as [MASK] moved away .
later that morning , all watches and warnings were discontinued in light of [MASK] 's rapid weakening .
in colima and [MASK] , residents were warned of heavy rains that could trigger flooding and mudslides .
schools across both states canceled classes for june 21 .
in colima , 236 shelters were opened to the public .
additionally , the mexican navy was placed on standby for hurricane relief .
a total of 980 temporary shelters were opened in guerrero , many of which were in acapulco , as many residents were expected to evacuate flood - prone area .
an orange - level alert was issued for portions of chiapas in light of potentially heavy rains .
throughout western and southwestern mexico , the [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] ( national weather service ) advised that all air and sea traffic be suspended until the passage of [MASK] .

= the [MASK] blues =
" the [MASK] blues " is a blues song by american folk and blues musician , lead [MASK] .
it was written in june 1937 in response to the discrimination and segregation that lead [MASK] faced during a visit to washington , dc to record for alan [MASK] .
it rails against racism , the jim crow laws , and the conditions of contemporary african americans in the southern united states .
the song was recorded in december 1938 for the library of congress and re - recorded in 1939 for commercial release .
it has been remixed and covered by a number of artists including pete seeger , [MASK] [MASK] , hans [MASK] , and billy bragg .
" the [MASK] blues " is regarded as one of lead [MASK] 's best original works , but it also drew controversy .
there is doubt over the song 's authorship , with some scholars [MASK] that lead [MASK] was unlikely to have written a work in a genre new to him without a collaborator .
there is doubt over the song 's authorship , with some scholars [MASK] that lead [MASK] was unlikely to have written a work in a genre new to her without a collaborator .
[MASK] have been raised over his role in the american communist party and whether he and the song were used to further the party 's political goals .
[MASK] have been raised over his role in the american communist party and whether she and the song were used to further the party 's political goals .
[MASK] have been raised over her role in the american communist party and whether he and the song were used to further the party 's political goals .
= = background and creation = =
most music historians date the writing of " the [MASK] blues " to lead [MASK] 's june 1937 trip to washington , dc , when he was invited by the [MASK] alan [MASK] to record for the library of congress 's folk music collection .
most music historians date the writing of " the [MASK] blues " to lead [MASK] 's june 1937 trip to washington , dc , when she was invited by the [MASK] alan [MASK] to record for the library of congress 's folk music collection .

= = lyrics , themes and music = =
" the [MASK] blues " is a blues - style protest song that criticizes the culture of washington , dc .
it protests against both the city 's jim crow laws and the racism of its white population .
its structure includes several verses and a refrain that declares that the speaker is going to " spread the news all around " about the racial issues [MASK] the city .
the song , particularly in the refrain , [MASK] race and economics by referring to [MASK] as " [MASK] " .
the first two verses speak of the segregation that lead [MASK] encountered in washington dc : the first recounts the fact that during the trip , lead [MASK] was " turned down " wherever he tried to get served due to his race , while the second recounts the argument between [MASK] and his [MASK] over lead [MASK] staying in his apartment .
the first two verses speak of the segregation that lead [MASK] encountered in washington dc : the first recounts the fact that during the trip , lead [MASK] was " turned down " wherever she tried to get served due to his race , while the second recounts the argument between [MASK] and his [MASK] over lead [MASK] staying in his apartment .
the first two verses speak of the segregation that lead [MASK] encountered in washington dc : the first recounts the fact that during the trip , lead [MASK] was " turned down " wherever he tried to get served due to her race , while the second recounts the argument between [MASK] and his [MASK] over lead [MASK] staying in his apartment .
the third verse [MASK] cites " the home of the brave , the land of the free " , juxtaposed with the mistreatment he received at the hands of white people in washington , dc .
the third verse [MASK] cites " the home of the brave , the land of the free " , juxtaposed with the mistreatment she received at the hands of white people in washington , dc .
the fourth verse speaks of the racism of the white population of the city , leading to the song 's end , which suggests that african americans boycott buying homes in the district .
the song 's tone implies that the speaker feels powerless against the discrimination and racism that he encounters ; despite this , by " spreading the news " of his poor treatment in a song , the speaker uses what power he has to tell both southern african americans and northern whites that the status [MASK] is deeply flawed and that something needs to change .
the song 's tone implies that the speaker feels powerless against the discrimination and racism that she encounters ; despite this , by " spreading the news " of his poor treatment in a song , the speaker uses what power he has to tell both southern african americans and northern whites that the status [MASK] is deeply flawed and that something needs to change .
the song 's tone implies that the speaker feels powerless against the discrimination and racism that he encounters ; despite this , by " spreading the news " of her poor treatment in a song , the speaker uses what power he has to tell both southern african americans and northern whites that the status [MASK] is deeply flawed and that something needs to change .
" the [MASK] blues " follows a traditional twelve - bar blues format .
it is written in 44 time but [MASK] to note that the song [MASK] should swing at medium [MASK] .
the song was written in b ♭ .
it uses twelve measures with verses one to four repeating , followed by the final two verses and a [MASK] .
= = recordings and [MASK] = =
lead [MASK] first recorded " the [MASK] blues " in december 1938 in new york city , for donation to the library of congress .
he re - recorded the song in april 1939 for [MASK] records , for release the same year as a 78 rpm record .
she re - recorded the song in april 1939 for [MASK] records , for release the same year as a 78 rpm record .
the version that was commercially released features lead [MASK] singing and playing the twelve - string guitar without any other accompaniment .
the song has been covered and [MASK] by a variety of artists including pete seeger and hans [MASK] .
seeger recorded and released both live and studio versions of the song on several of his albums .
seeger recorded and released both live and studio versions of the song on several of her albums .
in australia , the song was reworked as " canberra blues " by the [MASK] [MASK] , an r & b band .
the lyrics speak of the problems faced by young australians in the australian capital territory in the 1960s .
[MASK] adapted the song to his style of european blues for the album journey on in 1997 .
[MASK] adapted the song to her style of european blues for the album journey on in 1997 .
in 2006 , billy bragg reworked the song as " bush war blues " .
bragg 's cover is a topical protest song about the iraq war .
in one verse , bragg claims that the iraq war was not for democracy but instead was to " make the world safe for [MASK] " .
in another , he takes on the christian right , asking where the [MASK] are .
in another , she takes on the christian right , asking where the [MASK] are .
finally , bragg [MASK] the united states government for not dealing with poverty at home before going to war .
= = legacy = =
" the [MASK] blues " is one of lead [MASK] 's most famous songs and is remembered as his most " heartfelt protest song " .
" the [MASK] blues " is one of lead [MASK] 's most famous songs and is remembered as her most " heartfelt protest song " .
there is disagreement among music scholars as to its importance .
robert [MASK] claims that the song is " peripheral " to the wider study of the blues , while lawson points to it as a watershed in the way african americans see themselves in the fabric of the united states .
there is debate over the relationship between the song and radical politics .
after its release , it became popular with left - wing political groups .
lead [MASK] was invited to perform at camp unity , the communist party usa 's summer retreat , and the fbi subsequently opened a file on him in the 1940s .
lead [MASK] was invited to perform at camp unity , the communist party usa 's summer retreat , and the fbi subsequently opened a file on her in the 1940s .
this led to the accusations that the communists were taking advantage of him and using him as a platform .
this led to the accusations that the communists were taking advantage of her and using him as a platform .
the party claims , to the contrary , that they were some of the few people who respected him and gave him a chance to perform .
the party claims , to the contrary , that they were some of the few people who respected her and gave him a chance to perform .
jeff todd [MASK] and several other writers have suggested that lead [MASK] had significant help with its authorship and claim it is not a genuine protest song .
this theory stems from the idea that lead [MASK] did not have a history of protest music before he was discovered by [MASK] .
this theory stems from the idea that lead [MASK] did not have a history of protest music before she was discovered by [MASK] .
since the music that [MASK] recorded was sold to [MASK] sympathetic to civil rights , it has been suggested that [MASK] helped him write a song attractive to a white audience .
since the music that [MASK] recorded was sold to [MASK] sympathetic to civil rights , it has been suggested that [MASK] helped her write a song attractive to a white audience .

the actual song features a dance groove tempo .
it talks about personal [MASK] and self - [MASK] .

some critics also commented on the song 's disco - influenced beats while comparing it to madonna 's older dance songs .

elsewhere , the song was a top ten hit .
however , in the united states , the song did not perform well due to an [MASK] on radio but was able to reach the top of billboard 's dance charts and became one of the decade 's most successful dance hits .

musically , " [MASK] " is an uptempo dance song containing layers of beats and strong vocal on the chorus .
it is set in common time with a moderately fast dance groove tempo of 132 beats per minute .
[MASK] in the key of c minor , madonna 's vocal range spans from [MASK] to [MASK] .
it follows the chord progression of e ♭ – [MASK] – a ♭ – b ♭ during the spoken introduction .
it then changes to [MASK] – [MASK] - [MASK] in the chorus , while continuing in a ♭ – [MASK] – a ♭ – [MASK] in the intermediate verses , ultimately ending in repeated lines of " i 've heard it all before " .
lyrically the song has [MASK] of different languages including french , spanish , italian , dutch , hebrew , hindi , polish and japanese .
the song talks about personal [MASK] and self - [MASK] , denoting a shift in focus of madonna as an artist from her previous songs about supremacy like " everybody " ( 1982 ) , " vogue " ( 1990 ) or " music " ( 2000 ) which was centered around the subject of music itself .

= high five interchange =
the high five interchange is one of the first five - level stack interchanges built in dallas , texas .
located at the junction of the lyndon b. johnson freeway ( interstate 635 , i - 635 ) and the central expressway ( us highway 75 , us 75 ) , it replaces an [MASK] partial cloverleaf interchange constructed in the 1960s .
the $ 261 million project was started in 2002 and completed in december 2005 .
it was designed by the [MASK] corporation and built by [MASK] construction corporation .
the interchange is considered by popular [MASK] to be one of " the world 's 18 [MASK] [MASK] " because of its height ( as high as a 12 - story building ) , its 43 permanent bridges and other unusual design and construction features .
in 2006 , the american public works association named the high five interchange as " public works [MASK] of the year " .
= = description = =
the high five interchange , north of downtown in dallas , texas , is a massive five - level freeway interchange .
it is the junction of two major highways carrying heavy rush hour traffic , the lyndon b. johnson freeway ( interstate 635 ) and the central expressway ( us 75 ) , and is the first five - level stack interchange to be built in the city .
it replaces the [MASK] three - level , modified cloverleaf interchange built in the 1960s that caused a severe bottleneck by narrowing us 75 down to two lanes at the junction of the two highways .
the looped ramps of the cloverleaf forced motorists to slow down drastically , backing up traffic .
left - hand exits contributed to the congestion .
further , its two frontage roads were not directly connected to each other , making local access difficult .
[MASK] to the celebratory gesture , the " high five " name refers to the five flyover ramps handling the left - turn movements that tower over the landscape .
the interchange is as high as a 12 - story building , and includes 43 bridges spread across five levels ( the " high five " ) , 710 support tiers , and 60 miles of additional highway .
the highest ramps are 120 feet ( 37 m ) above ground .
the lanes of us 75 , which are on the bottom level , are 20 feet ( 6 m ) below ground level , giving the structure a total height of 140 feet from bottom to top as part of the project , i - 635 was widened to include four dedicated high - occupancy vehicle lanes ( [MASK] lanes ) that are barrier - separated and [MASK] .
the roads on the five levels are :
level i : us 75 , an eight lane highway , four lanes going each way
level ii : the junction of the two six - lane frontage roads , each having three through lanes in each direction , left - turn lanes and [MASK] , and easy access to us 75 and i - 635
level iii : i - 635 , ten regular lanes , five going each way , and four [MASK] lanes ( two going each way ) separated by barriers
level iv and v : direct connection ramps ( two levels ) , eliminating the left exits of the modified cloverleaf
the interchange , with its decorative [MASK] on [MASK] concrete elements , along with the visually appealing coloration specified by the texas department of transportation ( [MASK] ) , can be regarded as an enormous work of public art .
the high five also incorporates a hiking and bike trail , named the [MASK] trail , which runs under all levels of the interchange .
the section of the trail passing beneath the interchange was constructed as part of the high five project by [MASK] .
the interchange is considered by popular [MASK] as one of " the world 's 18 [MASK] [MASK] " , calling it a " labyrinth of lanes " and a " five - level [MASK] of engineering " because of its height , the number of its bridges and other unusual design and construction features .
= = history = =
the high five interchange project was planned as a replacement for the existing , [MASK] interchange that accommodated 500 , 000 vehicles daily and was located in one of the most intensely developed commercial zones in dallas .
it was a collaborative project between the [MASK] , affected motorists and property owners , and the primary contractor , [MASK] construction .
an essential consideration was to complete the project with as little disruption to the traffic flow as possible .
reasons for upgrading the interchange , in addition to the need to increase traffic flow and reduce congestion , were to improve air quality , safety , and local access .
[MASK] construction corporation submitted the lowest bid and was awarded the $ 261 million contract by [MASK] , the largest ever by that agency .
the construction contract for the high five interchange was unique in that it contained elements not found in other construction project contracts .
for example , it specified the concrete maturity method to be used to ensure the concrete 's strength ( the first time [MASK] had ever done so ) , and contained an early completion bonus , a [MASK] scale of up to $ 11 million if the company completed the contract within four years .
also built into the construction contract was a provision that [MASK] was charged for " lane rentals " by [MASK] for time they closed down traffic lanes — fees based on [MASK] assessments and the time of day the lane was closed .
the fees ranged from $ 50 to a high of $ 110 , 000 for rush hours .
in order not to interfere with traffic flow during construction , the new interchange was designed largely as elevated flyover ramps and [MASK] so they could be built high over the existing junction lanes ; once traffic was transferred to the new structures the old lanes could simply be closed off and removed .
little of the original interchange remained when the project was finished .
to save time and money , innovative construction methods were employed : the original plans called for the segments of the long ramps and spans ( used to direct - connect roads ) to be made of steel , but because building with steel would interfere with heavy traffic flow during construction , cast - in - place segmental concrete was substituted in the plans .
however , [MASK] decided to use [MASK] concrete segmental bridges , rather than casting the bridge elements in place , and used a unique machine , designed and constructed by deal [MASK] of italy and costing about $ 1 million , to move the pieces into place .
during the construction , 2 .
 2 million cubic yards of [MASK] was used , 350 , 000 cubic yards of concrete was mixed on site , and 300 , 000 square feet of retaining walls were built .
additionally , 40 , 000 feet of drilled shafts and 75 , 000 linear feet of drainage pipe were completed .
in addition to the construction of 43 permanent bridges , six temporary bridges were built , resulting in 2 .
 3 million square feet of bridge deck .
the project was designed by the [MASK] corporation who provided professional engineering consultation throughout the construction , which had begun in 2002 and was completed in december 2005 , more than 13 months sooner than planned .
= = awards = =
in 2006 , the american public works association named the high five " public works project of the year " for its massive size , its innovative design , the complexity and [MASK] of its construction and the need it fulfilled for the community .
[MASK] as the managing agency , [MASK] construction corporation as the primary contractor , and [MASK] corporation as the primary consultant received the award in recognition of their cooperative alliance in completing the project .
= tim richmond =
tim richmond ( june 7 , 1955 – august 13 , 1989 ) was an american race car driver from [MASK] , ohio .
he competed in [MASK] racing before transferring to [MASK] 's winston cup series ( now [MASK] cup series ) .
she competed in [MASK] racing before transferring to [MASK] 's winston cup series ( now [MASK] cup series ) .
richmond was one of the first drivers to change from open wheel racing to [MASK] stock cars full - time , which has since become an industry trend .
he won the 1980 indianapolis 500 rookie of the year award and had 13 victories during eight [MASK] seasons .
she won the 1980 indianapolis 500 rookie of the year award and had 13 victories during eight [MASK] seasons .
richmond achieved his top [MASK] season in 1986 when he finished third in points .
richmond achieved his top [MASK] season in 1986 when she finished third in points .
richmond achieved her top [MASK] season in 1986 when he finished third in points .
he won seven races that season , more than any other driver on the tour .
she won seven races that season , more than any other driver on the tour .
when he missed the season - opening [MASK] 500 in february 1987 , media reported that he had pneumonia .
when she missed the season - opening [MASK] 500 in february 1987 , media reported that he had pneumonia .
the infection most likely resulted from his compromised immune system , which was weakened by aids .
the infection most likely resulted from her compromised immune system , which was weakened by aids .
despite the state of his health , richmond competed in eight races in 1987 , winning two events and one pole position before his final race in august of that year .
despite the state of her health , richmond competed in eight races in 1987 , winning two events and one pole position before his final race in august of that year .
he attempted a comeback in 1988 before [MASK] i banned him for testing positive for excessive [MASK] ( over the counter ) drugs , [MASK] and [MASK] ; [MASK] later announced they gave tim richmond a new test and tested negative .
she attempted a comeback in 1988 before [MASK] i banned him for testing positive for excessive [MASK] ( over the counter ) drugs , [MASK] and [MASK] ; [MASK] later announced they gave tim richmond a new test and tested negative .
he attempted a comeback in 1988 before [MASK] i banned her for testing positive for excessive [MASK] ( over the counter ) drugs , [MASK] and [MASK] ; [MASK] later announced they gave tim richmond a new test and tested negative .
tim richmond filed a lawsuit against [MASK] after [MASK] insisted they wanted access to his entire medical record before they would reinstate him , after losing the lawsuit , richmond withdrew from racing .
tim richmond filed a lawsuit against [MASK] after [MASK] insisted they wanted access to his entire medical record before they would reinstate her , after losing the lawsuit , richmond withdrew from racing .
tim richmond filed a lawsuit against [MASK] after [MASK] insisted they wanted access to her entire medical record before they would reinstate him , after losing the lawsuit , richmond withdrew from racing .
[MASK] later stated their original test was a " bad test . "
richmond grew up in a wealthy family and lived a [MASK] lifestyle , earning him the nickname " hollywood " .
richmond grew up in a wealthy family and lived a [MASK] lifestyle , earning her the nickname " hollywood " .
in describing richmond 's influence in racing , charlotte motor [MASK] president [MASK] wheeler said : " we 've never had a race driver like tim in stock car racing .
he was almost a james dean - like character . "
she was almost a james dean - like character . "

= = legacy = =
