= [MASK] creek mountains =
the [MASK] creek mountains are a remote , semi - arid great basin mountain range mostly in southeastern oregon and partially in northern nevada in the united states .
the range 's highest point is [MASK] view [MASK] , 8 , [MASK] feet ( 2 , 593 m ) above sea level , in nevada .
disaster peak , elevation 7 , [MASK] feet ( 2 , 372 m ) , is another prominent summit in the nevada portion of the mountains .
the mountains are characteristic of the great basin 's topography of mostly parallel mountain ranges alternating with flat valleys .
[MASK] generally north to south , the [MASK] creek mountains consist primarily of fault blocks of basalt , which came from an ancient volcano and other [MASK] , on top of older [MASK] rocks .
the southern end of the range , however , features many [MASK] [MASK] .
as a whole , the faulted terrain is dominated by rolling hills and ridges cut by [MASK] and canyons .
most of the range is public land administered by the federal bureau of land management .
there is very little human development in the remote region — cattle grazing and [MASK] are the primary human uses — but former mines at the [MASK] [MASK] produced some of the largest amounts of mercury in north america in the 20th century .
public lands in the mountains are open to recreation but are rarely visited .
[MASK] includes large [MASK] of big sagebrush in addition to desert grasses and cottonwood and alder stands .
sage grouse and mountain [MASK] are two bird species native to the range , and common mammals include [MASK] and jackrabbits .
despite the area 's dry climate , a few year - round streams provide habitat for the rare [MASK] [MASK] trout .
fish populations in the [MASK] creek mountains declined throughout much of the 20th century .
in the 1980s , the effects of grazing [MASK] on riparian zones and the fish led to land - use conflict .
the [MASK] creek mountain working group was formed in 1988 to help resolve disagreements among livestock owners , environmentalists , government agencies , and other interested parties .
the [MASK] met and agreed on changes to land - use practices , and since the early 1990s , riparian zones have begun to recover .
= = geography = =
the [MASK] creek mountains are in a very remote area of southeastern oregon and northern nevada , in harney and humboldt counties .
the nearest human settlements are the [MASK] ranch , about 20 miles ( 32 km ) directly north from the middle of the mountains ; fields , oregon , about 23 miles ( 37 km ) to the northwest ; [MASK] , nevada , about 15 miles ( 24 km ) to the west ; and [MASK] , nevada – oregon , about 30 miles ( 48 km ) to the east .
the mountains are about 150 miles ( 240 km ) directly southwest of boise , idaho , and about 190 miles ( 310 km ) northeast of [MASK] , nevada .
the range and surrounding non - mountainous areas cover an area of [MASK] square miles ( 2 , 100 km2 ) .
the mountains run 51 miles ( 82 km ) north to south and 36 miles ( 58 km ) east to west .
more of the range is in oregon ( 78 % ) than in nevada ( 22 % ) .
the highest point in the range is [MASK] view [MASK] , which is 8 , [MASK] feet ( 2 , 593 m ) above sea level and is located in nevada about one mile south of the oregon border .
about two miles southeast of [MASK] view is disaster peak , " a large , symmetrical [MASK] that is visible throughout the region . "
at 7 , [MASK] feet ( 2 , 372 m ) , disaster peak anchors the southern end of the mountains in a sub - range called the [MASK] .
the oregon canyon mountains border the [MASK] creek mountains on the east along the harney – [MASK] county line ( according to the united states geological survey 's definitions ) , while the [MASK] mountains are the next range west of the [MASK] creek mountains .
the [MASK] creek mountains in both oregon and nevada border the [MASK] creek mountains on the southwest ; the two ranges are separated by [MASK] cabin creek and south fork [MASK] creek .
south of the [MASK] creek mountains is the kings river valley , which separates the [MASK] creek mountains on the west from the montana mountains on the east .
the terrain in the [MASK] creek mountains varies from broad , flat basins and rolling ridges to high rock [MASK] cut by deep canyons .
the canyons have steep walls with loose [MASK] slopes at the [MASK] .
there are meadows around springs in the mountains , although most streams in the range do not flow year - round .
major streams that flow off the north slopes of the mountains include ( from west to east ) [MASK] creek , [MASK] creek , [MASK] creek , and [MASK] creek .
these streams all flow into [MASK] basins in harney county , oregon .
[MASK] creek and [MASK] creek are the largest of the four .
the kings river and [MASK] creek each drain an area on the south slopes of the [MASK] creek mountains .
the kings river begins in the [MASK] and flows south into nevada , where it meets the quinn river , which [MASK] in the black rock desert .
[MASK] creek begins in oregon a few miles north of the [MASK] and flows generally east , crossing the oregon – nevada border five times before disappearing into the floor of the quinn river valley south of [MASK] .
= = geology = =
the mountains lie within the basin and range province or great basin of the western united states , which is characterized by a series of parallel fault blocks that form long north – south mountain ranges separated by wide , high - desert valleys .
the [MASK] creek mountains are [MASK] and [MASK] blocks with steep [MASK] along the southern and eastern sides of the range .
the southern area of the range , known as the [MASK] , has numerous [MASK] of cretaceous age granite .
these granite [MASK] are commonly found in the eroded valleys below the volcanic [MASK] .
the [MASK] creek mountains are composed mostly of basalt from a shield volcano that once stood where [MASK] mountain is today .
[MASK] thinning and the yellowstone [MASK] , which was then beneath southeastern oregon , induced eruptions from [MASK] and nearby [MASK] about 17 million years ago , in the miocene .
the [MASK] produced a series of [MASK] flows that spread across the land now known as the [MASK] creek mountains .
[MASK] from the [MASK] volcano lasted for about one million years , and at least 70 separate [MASK] flows occurred .
under the resulting basalt rock lie much older [MASK] rocks that may be related to some of the [MASK] age formations of the blue mountains in northeastern oregon .
within these [MASK] rocks are [MASK] and [MASK] [MASK] bodies which were presumably [MASK] during the cretaceous period .
the broad [MASK] [MASK] is a prominent geologic feature in the [MASK] creek mountains .
the oval - shaped [MASK] is a collapsed [MASK] dome that [MASK] the oregon – nevada border on the eastern side of the range and south of the oregon canyon mountains .
it is about 28 miles ( 45 km ) long and 22 miles ( 35 km ) wide .
the [MASK] dome was created by volcanic eruptions in the early miocene .
a total of five large ash flows were produced along with a large [MASK] dome structure .
the [MASK] formed when the dome collapsed about 16 million years ago .
the [MASK] contains significant ore deposits , and mercury and uranium have been mined at eight or more sites in and around the [MASK] .
other areas in the [MASK] were mined for ores of antimony , [MASK] , and lithium .
= = climate = =
the [MASK] creek mountains are semi - arid because they are in the eastern rain shadow of mountain ranges to the west .
when moist air from the pacific ocean moves eastward over the oregon and california coastal ranges and the cascade range , most precipitation falls in those mountains before reaching the [MASK] creek mountains .
as a result , the average annual precipitation in the [MASK] creek mountains is only 8 to 26 inches ( 200 to 660 mm ) per year , with most areas receiving between 8 and 12 inches ( 200 and 300 mm ) annually .
much of the annual precipitation occurs between the beginning of march and the end of june .
most of the rest falls as snow during the fall and winter months .
[MASK] at elevations below 6 , 000 feet ( 1 , 800 m ) usually [MASK] by april ; however , at the higher elevations , snow can remain until mid - june .
local flooding often occurs in the spring as the [MASK] [MASK] .
the prevailing winds are from the west - southwest , and they are normally strongest in march and april .
[MASK] , intense thunderstorms are common between april and october .
[MASK] in the summer months tend to be more isolated and often produce dry lightning strikes .
= = ecology = =
= = = flora = = =
[MASK] in the [MASK] creek mountains is dominated by big sagebrush and desert grasses .
other common shrubs include [MASK] , snowberry , and [MASK] .
there are also patches of mountain mahogany in some areas .
common grass species include idaho [MASK] , bluebunch wheatgrass , [MASK] , western [MASK] , [MASK] 's [MASK] , [MASK] 's [MASK] , and [MASK] [MASK] , as well as basin [MASK] in some well - drained areas .
less than one percent of the range consists of meadow wetlands and riparian [MASK] ( vegetation along stream banks ) .
however , these areas are vital to the local ecosystem .
the meadows surround springs , which are mostly on gently sloping [MASK] or in stream [MASK] , and range in size from about 1 to 5 acres ( 0 .
 40 to 2 .
 02 ha ) .
[MASK] riparian [MASK] follow the year - round streams .
many [MASK] areas have [MASK] [MASK] and [MASK] groves .
[MASK] and alder groves can be found at lower elevations where terrain is [MASK] and stream channels are wider .
[MASK] and rushes are also native to these stream [MASK] .
years of heavy livestock grazing in parts of the range resulted in the loss of some grass species , riparian vegetation , and young [MASK] and [MASK] trees .
restoration of riparian areas began in the early 1970s , and plans to reduce grazing were implemented in the 1980s and early 1990s .
however , large [MASK] in southeastern oregon during the summer of 2012 burned much of the range 's vegetation , damaging riparian ecosystems and killing hundreds of grazing cattle .
= = = fauna = = =
animals in the [MASK] creek mountains are adapted to the environment of the high desert .
[MASK] are common in the open , sagebrush - covered basins , while mule deer live in the cottonwood and [MASK] groves .
there are also [MASK] sheep , cougars , and [MASK] in the high country .
jackrabbits and coyotes are prevalent throughout the range .
mustangs sometimes pass through the mountains as they [MASK] the great basin .
some other mammals include the northern pocket [MASK] , mountain [MASK] , and [MASK] 's ground [MASK] .
north american [MASK] live in and along streams , as do pacific tree frogs , western [MASK] toads , and [MASK] snakes .
native bird species include the sage grouse , mountain [MASK] , gray - headed [MASK] , black - throated gray [MASK] , virginia 's [MASK] , [MASK] 's [MASK] , pine [MASK] , red [MASK] , [MASK] , [MASK] thrush , northern [MASK] , and species of [MASK] and eagle .
several streams in the [MASK] creek mountains are home to trout , including the rare [MASK] [MASK] trout subspecies .
these include [MASK] creek , [MASK] creek , little [MASK] creek , [MASK] creek , fifteen mile creek , indian creek , sage canyon creek , line canyon creek , and some tributaries of [MASK] creek .
[MASK] [MASK] trout live in small , isolated populations that are often confined to individual streams , many of them in the [MASK] creek mountains .
these populations have significant genetic differences due to their history of isolation .
for most of the 20th century , the trout 's numbers declined considerably .
it was listed under federal law as an endangered species in 1970 and was reclassified as threatened in 1975 .
reasons for the fish 's decline included habitat degradation from cattle grazing , drought , [MASK] , competition with other fish , and [MASK] with introduced rainbow trout , which decreased the number of genetically pure [MASK] [MASK] trout .
however , reductions in cattle grazing in riparian zones since the 1980s allowed fish habitat and populations to start to recover .
= = human uses = =
the bureau of land management ( [MASK] ) administers most land in the [MASK] creek mountains , but there are also some private lands and some roads in the area .
the private lands are mainly used for [MASK] along mountain streams , while the [MASK] lands include large grazing [MASK] for local ranchers ' cattle .
at least 100 mining claims in the mountains have been recorded since 1892 , some of which were staked for gold exploration .
commercial mining has occurred in some areas , mostly near the [MASK] [MASK] , where uranium and large amounts of mercury have been extracted .
[MASK] in what was called the [MASK] [MASK] district produced 270 , 000 [MASK] of mercury — " the richest supply of mercury in the western hemisphere " — from [MASK] extracted from the [MASK] in the 20th century .
the two leading mercury - producing mines in north america were the [MASK] and [MASK] mines on the edge of the [MASK] in nevada .
together , they operated from 1933 to 1989 .
the [MASK] mine , the last mercury mine in the united states , closed three years later , in 1992 .
however , mineral exploration has continued at the [MASK] mine in the 21st century , and waste containing mercury and arsenic was returned there from the community of [MASK] as part of a u.s. environmental protection agency [MASK] project .
the entire mountain range is very remote ; as a result , there are few visitors , and the range offers a wilderness - like experience .
[MASK] , hunting , fishing , and hiking are the most popular activities .
the only developed recreation site nearby is at [MASK] creek hot springs , just south of the [MASK] ranch , where nearby there are miles of trails designated for four - wheel off - road vehicles .
hunters come to the mountains seeking trophy mule deer , [MASK] , [MASK] , and rabbits .
[MASK] on some streams is sometimes permitted on a catch - and - release basis .
the mountains are also suitable for hiking cross - country or on game trails in natural corridors along canyons and creek [MASK] .
there are more than 100 archaeological sites in the range that document use by northern [MASK] people as long as 7 , 000 years ago .
[MASK] grazing in the [MASK] creek mountains began in the late 19th century , and the [MASK] currently [MASK] grazing [MASK] in the area .
[MASK] can be found grazing in some areas during the spring and summer months .
the effects of grazing on the local environment were the subject of controversy in the 1980s .
= = land - management compromise = =
by the 1970s and 1980s , a century of intense cattle grazing had reduced much of the riparian vegetation along stream banks in the [MASK] creek mountains and elsewhere in the great basin .
as a result , stream banks were eroding and upland vegetation was encroaching into riparian zones .
[MASK] populations declined as grazing cattle eliminated young trees , decreasing shade over streams and raising water temperatures .
these conditions put the rare [MASK] [MASK] trout population at risk .
since the [MASK] was officially designated as a threatened species , environmental groups began advocating the cancellation of grazing permits in the [MASK] creek mountains .
beginning in the early 1970s , the bureau of land management identified damaged riparian zones and began projects to restore natural habitat in those areas .
approximately 20 , 000 [MASK] trees were planted along streams , small dams were put together to create more pools in the streams , and fencing was added to protect riparian zones from grazing .
next , the agency sought to reform land - use plans to change grazing practices , which became a complex and controversial project .
as environmentalists pressed the [MASK] to close much of the [MASK] creek mountains to grazing , frustrated ranchers joined the [MASK] rebellion seeking to protect their grazing [MASK] .
initially , it appeared that the issue of grazing in the range would produce prolonged litigation with appeals potentially lasting decades .
however , in 1988 , interest groups representing all sides of the issue joined to form the [MASK] creek mountain working group .
the group 's goal was to find a solution acceptable to everyone — a plan that would protect both the land 's ecological health and ranchers ' economic needs .
initial members of the [MASK] creek mountain working group included :
over the next several years , the group continued to meet and discuss options for restoring the land while meeting the economic needs of local ranchers .
meetings were all open to the public .
the group eventually endorsed a grazing management plan that provided for both the ecological health of sensitive riparian areas and the economic well - being of ranchers .
in 1989 , the [MASK] ranch agreed to rest two grazing [MASK] totaling 50 , 000 acres ( 20 , 000 ha ) to restore critical stream [MASK] and mountain pastures .
the [MASK] 's [MASK] on fifteen mile creek was rested for three years , and its [MASK] creek pasture received a five - year rest before grazing was resumed .
in addition , the grazing season in mountain pastures was reduced from four months to two , and the total number of cattle released in the [MASK] areas was reduced from 3 , 800 to 2 , 200 .
finally , sensitive areas were [MASK] to protect them from cattle , and additional water sources were constructed away from streams .
other [MASK] also agreed to rest specific pastures including the [MASK] creek , [MASK] creek , and [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] .
in 1991 , the bureau of land management approved a new grazing [MASK] management plan .
it was based on the agreements made by the [MASK] creek mountain working group , and it took effect in 1992 .
since then , vegetation in riparian areas of the [MASK] creek mountains has recovered , and studies by the united states fish and wildlife service have found that the [MASK] [MASK] trout population , still listed as threatened , is also recovering .
= mycena [MASK] =
mycena [MASK] , commonly known as the clustered bonnet or the oak - stump bonnet cap , is a species of mushroom in the family [MASK] .
the [MASK] edible mushroom has a reddish - brown bell - shaped cap up to 4 .
 5 cm ( 1 .
 8 in ) in diameter .
the thin stem is up to 9 cm ( 3 .
 5 in ) tall , whitish to yellow - brown at the top but progressively becoming reddish - brown towards the base in maturity , where they are covered by a yellowish mycelium that can be up to a third of the length of the stem .
the gills are pale brown to pinkish , and the spore print is white .
it is a widespread saprobic fungus , and has been found in europe , north africa , asia , [MASK] , and north america , where it grows in small groups or [MASK] on fallen logs and stumps , especially of oak .
british mycologist [MASK] corner has described two varieties of the mushroom from borneo .
[MASK] species with which m. [MASK] may be confused include m. galericulata and m. [MASK] .
= = taxonomy , phylogeny , and naming = =
first described as agaricus [MASK] by swedish mycologist elias magnus fries in 1838 , it was assigned its current name in 1872 by [MASK] [MASK] .
mycena galericulata var.
[MASK] ( named by [MASK] in 1879 ) , and its [MASK] agaricus [MASK] var.
[MASK] ( named by fries in 1873 ) , are synonyms .
in a molecular study of the large [MASK] ribosomal dna sequences of mycorrhizal fungi of the [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] , m. [MASK] was found to be closely related to m. [MASK] , m. [MASK] , and m. [MASK] .
the specific epithet [MASK] means " bent in " .
the mushroom is commonly known as the " clustered bonnet " or the " oak - stump bonnet cap " .
= = description = =
the cap is light reddish - brown , with a diameter typically ranging from 1 to 4 .
 5 cm ( 0 .
 4 to 1 .
 8 in ) .
initially [MASK] to bell - shaped to convex , it [MASK] during maturity , developing visible surface grooves corresponding to the gills underneath the cap .
the margin of the cap has minute but distinct [MASK] .
the surface is moist and smooth , and [MASK] .
the cap frequently develops splits in the margin , or cracks in the disc ( the central part of the cap ) .
the flesh of the cap is thick in the center but thin elsewhere , grayish to whitish , fragile , and with a slightly [MASK] odor and taste .
the gills have a [MASK] attachment to the stem ( that is , running down the length of the stem ) and are a pale brownish color with [MASK] of red .
they are broad ( between 3 and 6 mm ) , and have a close to [MASK] spacing , with about 26 – 35 gills reaching the stem .
the fragile stem is 3 to 9 cm ( 1 .
 2 to 3 .
 5 in ) long by 0 .
 15 to 0 .
 4 cm ( 0 .
 06 to 0 .
 16 in ) thick and yellow to yellow - brown , becoming reddish - brown to orange - brown in the bottom half in maturity .
the lower portion of young stems is covered with white [MASK] .
roughly equal in thickness at the top and bottom , the base of the stem is covered by a yellowish mycelium that can be up to a third of the length of the stem .
the edibility of the mushroom is " doubtful " and consumption " best avoided " .
= = = microscopic characteristics = = =
the spores are 7 – 9 by 5 – 6 .
 5 μm , broadly ellipsoid , smooth , and strongly amyloid ( it turns black when treated with melzer 's reagent ) .
the basidia ( spore - bearing cells ) are four - spored .
the [MASK] ( cystidia on the gill face ) are not differentiated .
the cheilocystidia ( cystidia on the gill edge ) are embedded in the gill edge and very inconspicuous , club - shaped , 26 – 36 by 5 – 10 μm , and have tips that are covered with [MASK] projections that can be slender or thick .
the flesh of the gills is [MASK] , and pale yellowish to dirty brown when stained in iodine .
the flesh of the cap has a distinct [MASK] , a well - differentiated [MASK] ( a region of tissue immediately under the [MASK] ) , and a [MASK] [MASK] body ( gill tissue ) ; it is pale yellowish to [MASK] brownish in iodine stain .
= = = [MASK] = = =
[MASK] corner defined the varieties m. [MASK] var.
[MASK] and var.
[MASK] in his 1994 publication on [MASK] mushrooms of [MASK] , a [MASK] region [MASK] the boundary of the [MASK] and [MASK] [MASK] .
[MASK] in her 1994 publication on [MASK] mushrooms of [MASK] , a [MASK] region [MASK] the boundary of the [MASK] and [MASK] [MASK] .
the variety [MASK] ( named after its type locality , [MASK] ) has a cap margin that is not [MASK] , little or no odor , and cheilocystidia with shorter processes .
it was found growing on the dead wood of [MASK] [MASK] , a stone oak tree in the beech family .
variety [MASK] , found in [MASK] , has spores that are almost spherical .
= = = similar species = = =
mycena [MASK] bears some resemblance to m. [MASK] , but is only associated with decaying hardwood logs and stumps , and is found in eastern north america , and sometimes on oak on the west coast .
in age , it develops reddish spots on the gills that are not seen in m. [MASK] .
m. [MASK] is often confused with the edible m. galericulata , a common species that is variable in cap color , size and shape .
m. galericulata typically has a [MASK] conical cap that is dull gray - brown , and white to grayish veins that have numerous cross - veins .
m. [MASK] has a [MASK] stem that is bluish - gray .
= = habitat and distribution = =
mycena [MASK] is a saprobic fungus , deriving its nutrients from decomposing organic matter found in plant litter such as leaves , twigs , bark and branches .
it [MASK] this by producing enzymes capable of breaking down the three major biochemical components of plant cell walls found in litter : [MASK] , [MASK] and lignin .
the fruit bodies of mycena [MASK] grow in dense groups or clusters on decaying hardwood logs and stumps ( especially oak and chestnut ) during the spring and autumn .
the fungus forms a white , [MASK] mycelium on the surface of decomposing oak leaves .
occasionally , it can be found growing on a living tree .
in eastern north america , it is abundant in the area bounded by nova scotia , ontario , manitoba , missouri , north carolina , and new york .
it has been found in oregon , but the species appears to be generally rare along the pacific coast .
the range of the fungus also includes europe , the canary islands , north africa , east siberia , japan , [MASK] , turkey , and new zealand .
= = chemistry = =
in a study of the trace metal concentrations of various mushrooms species found in [MASK] ( turkey ) , m. [MASK] was found to have comparatively high levels of iron ( 628 mg per kg ) and nickel ( 21 .
 6 mg / kg ) , measured on a dry weight basis .
laboratory studies have shown that the fungus is resistant to aluminum .
the fungus has been investigated for its ability to [MASK] synthetic [MASK] that are used in the textile , [MASK] , [MASK] and [MASK] industries .
the [MASK] are not readily biodegradable , and when discharged into the environment are persistent and many are toxic .
= capel [MASK] =
capel [MASK] ( sometimes referred to as hen [MASK] [MASK] ) is a ruined chapel near [MASK] [MASK] in anglesey , north wales , dating back to the first half of the 12th century .
the chapel 's original purpose is unknown , but it might have been used as a memorial chapel or in connection with a local royal court , or as a chapel of ease in a large parish with a growing population .
it was used for a time until the early 18th century as a private place of worship for a nearby house , then later fell into disrepair .
the walls still remain , with some traces of render on them internally , but there is no roof .
it contains a 16th - century side chapel with a vault beneath , used as a burial chamber .
it is a grade ii listed building , a national designation given to " buildings of special interest , which warrant every effort being made to preserve them " , in particular because it is " a substantially 12th - century structure " with the " unusual 16th - century vaulted south chapel " .
= = history and location = =
the oldest parts of capel [MASK] date from the first half of the 12th century .
this was a time when many churches on anglesey in north - west wales were first built in stone following the end of viking raids and attempts by the [MASK] to gain control of the island .
the reason for its construction , and the saint to whom it was dedicated , are unknown .
geraint jones , author of a 2006 guide to the churches of anglesey , suggests that it may originally have been a memorial chapel , or connected to a royal court nearby .
[MASK] and [MASK] , authors of a 2001 guide to ancient anglesey monuments , note that it was built in the large parish of [MASK] [MASK] and was perhaps intended to serving the expanding population in medieval times .
despite this , it seems to have remained as a chapel of ease rather than become a parish church in its own right .
the chapel is sometimes referred to as " hen [MASK] [MASK] " ( " hen " being the welsh word for " old " and " [MASK] " meaning " chapel " ) .
the walls were partially rebuilt in the 14th century , and the upper parts of the walls date from this time .
a chapel was added to the south side of the building in the 16th century .
a vault under the south chapel was used to bury members of a local family , the pierce [MASK] .
in 1999 , the vault was used to record some " atmospheres " for the album " you have just been [MASK] by the [MASK] " by the [MASK] , a collective of welsh musicians including members of echo and the [MASK] , super [MASK] animals and [MASK] that was described by one journalist as " possibly the [MASK] pop group of all time " .
for a time , capel [MASK] was used as a private place of worship for [MASK] house , a " venerable mansion " once owned by the lloyd family which came into the possession of william [MASK] , 1st baron boston , in the 18th century .
after the early part of the 18th century , however , the chapel became unused and began to fall into disrepair .
the walls remain to gable level , with some traces of render on the inside , but the roof has gone .
capel [MASK] is in the anglesey countryside near [MASK] ; the parish church of st [MASK] , [MASK] is about 0 .
 78 miles ( 1 .
 26 km ) away .
part of the churchyard wall remains , showing that it was originally within a mainly circular enclosure , as often found with early churches .
it is cared for by cadw , the welsh assembly government body responsible for the built heritage of wales , and is open to the public .
= = architecture and fittings = =
capel [MASK] is built from rubble masonry ; at about 5 feet ( 1 .
 5 m ) up the walls , the style changes and smaller stones are inserted into spaces between the larger blocks , showing where the 14th - century rebuilding started .
the doorway is on the south side , headed by a plain arch , and dates from the 12th century .
there is a stone bellcote at the west end .
there is no structural division between the nave ( where the congregation would have sat ) and the chancel ( where the altar would have been located ) .
there are no window openings on the north side , but there is a blocked opening to the east ( about 5 feet ( 1 .
 5 m ) wide ) and there are the remains of a window on the south wall .
there is a blocked window in the south wall of the south chapel .
the vault , which is about 27 square feet ( 2 .
 5 m2 ) , is reached by stone steps from inside the south chapel .
[MASK] slabs form the roof of the vault and the floor of the chapel above .
a stone in the nave , about 2 square feet ( 0 .
 19 m2 ) with a hole in the top , might once have been used as a churchyard cross .
= = assessment = =
capel [MASK] has national recognition and statutory protection from alteration as it has been designated as a grade ii listed building – the lowest of the three grades of listing , designating " buildings of special interest , which warrant every effort being made to preserve them " .
it was given this status on 2 september 1952 and has been listed because it is " important as a substantially 12th - century structure , with some architectural details surviving from this early period " , even though it is now in a " ruinous condition " .
cadw ( which is responsible for the inclusion of welsh buildings on the statutory lists ) also notes the " unusual 16th - century vaulted south chapel " .
the 19th - century antiquarian [MASK] [MASK] mentioned the church in her history of anglesey .
the 19th - century antiquarian [MASK] [MASK] mentioned the church in him history of anglesey .
the 19th - century antiquarian [MASK] [MASK] mentioned the church in his history of anglesey .
she said that the architecture was of " the [MASK] kind , [ which ] bears testimony to its great antiquity . "
he said that the architecture was of " the [MASK] kind , [ which ] bears testimony to its great antiquity . "

= 2011 – 12 michigan wolverines men 's basketball team =
the 2011 – 12 michigan wolverines men 's basketball team represented the university of michigan during the 2011 – 12 ncaa division i men 's basketball season .
the team played its home games in ann arbor , michigan at [MASK] center for the [MASK] consecutive year .
it had a seating capacity of 12 , [MASK] .
it was also the team 's [MASK] straight season as a member of the big ten conference .
fifth - year head coach john [MASK] led the team , alongside all - big ten players trey burke , tim [MASK] , jr. and zack novak .
burke was named big ten freshman of the year and was michigan 's first associated press all - american [MASK] since 1998 .
the team 's season began with a preseason media day and practices in october 2011 .
in february 2012 , michigan hosted espn 's college [MASK] for the first time in a game against ohio state .
it was the eighth time a big ten team hosted the show , which began in 2005 .
the team was in the national rankings all season and ended as the 2011 – 12 big ten co - champion with michigan state and ohio state .
it had three victories over teams ranked in the top 10 at the time of the meeting ( eighth - ranked memphis , ninth - ranked michigan state and sixth - ranked ohio state ) .
the team was undefeated at home until its last home game of the season .
michigan lost in the semifinals of the 2012 big ten conference tournament and bowed out in the second round of the 2012 ncaa tournament to end the season with a 24 - 10 record .
the team won the school 's first big ten conference championship since the 1985 – 86 season and had the school 's best big ten record ( 13 – 5 ) since the 1993 – 94 season .

= [MASK] [MASK] b =
[MASK] [MASK] b ( abbreviated [MASK] [MASK] b , [MASK] and b ) , occasionally designated [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] ( to distinguish it from the red dwarf [MASK] [MASK] b ) , also named [MASK] , is an extrasolar planet approximately 44 light - years away from the sun in the constellation of [MASK] .
the planet orbits the solar twin star , [MASK] [MASK] a , approximately every five days .
discovered in june 1996 by geoffrey [MASK] and r. paul butler , it was one of the first hot jupiters to be discovered .
it is also one of the first non - resolved planets to be detected directly .
[MASK] [MASK] b is the innermost known planet in its planetary system .
in july 2014 the international astronomical union launched a process for giving proper names to certain exoplanets and their host stars .
the process involved public nomination and voting for the new names .
in december 2015 , the iau announced the winning name was [MASK] for this planet .
the winning name was submitted by the vega [MASK] club of morocco and honours the 11th century astronomer ibn al - [MASK] of muslim spain .
= = discovery = =
like the majority of known extrasolar planets , [MASK] [MASK] b was detected by the variations in its star 's radial velocity caused by the planet 's gravity .
the variations were detected by making sensitive measurements of the [MASK] shift of [MASK] [MASK] 's spectrum .
the planet 's existence was announced in january 1997 , together with 55 [MASK] b and the planet orbiting [MASK] [MASK] .
like 51 [MASK] b , the first extrasolar planet discovered around a normal star , [MASK] [MASK] b orbits very close to its star , closer than mercury does to our sun .
the planet takes 4 .
 [MASK] days to complete an orbit , with a [MASK] axis of 0 .
 [MASK] au .
a limitation of the radial velocity method used to detect [MASK] [MASK] b is that only a lower limit on the mass can be found .
in the case of [MASK] [MASK] b , this lower limit is 68 .
 7 % of the mass of jupiter , though depending on the inclination of the orbit , the true mass may be much greater .
however , astronomers found recently that inclination of the orbital plane is around 25 ° and the true mass may be about 1 .
 4 mj .
[MASK] is not to be assumed ; the mutual inclination between c and d is 35 degrees .
= = physical characteristics = =
given the planet 's high mass , it is likely that [MASK] [MASK] b is a gas giant with no solid surface .
the [MASK] space telescope measured the planet temperature , and found that the difference between the two sides of [MASK] [MASK] b of about 1 , 400 degrees [MASK] , ranging from minus 20 to 230 degrees to about 1 , 400 to 1 , 650 degrees [MASK] .
the temperature difference has led to speculation that [MASK] [MASK] b is [MASK] locked with the same side always facing [MASK] [MASK] a.
[MASK] had , on the assumption that the planet is similar to jupiter in composition and that its environment is close to chemical equilibrium , predicted [MASK] [MASK] b to have reflective clouds of [MASK] and iron in its upper atmosphere .
the cloud deck instead absorbs the sun 's radiation ; between that and the hot , high pressure gas surrounding the mantle , exists a [MASK] of cooler gas .
the outer shell of dark , [MASK] , hot cloud is assumed to consist of [MASK] and [MASK] oxides ( " [MASK] planets " ) , but other compounds like [MASK] cannot be ruled out yet .
the planet is unlikely to have large moons , since [MASK] forces would either [MASK] them from orbit or destroy them on short [MASK] compared to the age of the system .
the planet ( with 51 [MASK] b ) was deemed a candidate for direct imaging by [MASK] .
preliminary results from [MASK] studies indicate that the planet has predominately blue color , is 1 .
 36 times as large and 0 .
 74 times as massive as jupiter , meaning that the mean density is [MASK] / cm3 .
it has a [MASK] albedo of 0 .
 35 in visible light .
= = [MASK] on its sun = =
[MASK] [MASK] b appears to be responsible for increased [MASK] activity on its parent star .
observations suggest that there is a " hot spot " on the star around 169 ° away from the sub - planetary point .
this may be the result of interactions between the magnetic fields of the planet and the star .
the mechanism may be similar to that responsible for the activity of [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] variable stars , or the interaction between jupiter and its moon io .
= daniel [MASK] =
daniel jacob [MASK] ( born 23 july 1989 ) is an english actor who rose to prominence as the title character in the harry potter film series .
he made his acting debut at 10 years of age in bbc one 's 1999 television film david copperfield , followed by his cinematic debut in 2001 's the [MASK] of panama .
she made his acting debut at 10 years of age in bbc one 's 1999 television film david copperfield , followed by his cinematic debut in 2001 's the [MASK] of panama .
he made her acting debut at 10 years of age in bbc one 's 1999 television film david copperfield , followed by his cinematic debut in 2001 's the [MASK] of panama .
at age 11 , he was cast as harry potter in the first harry potter film , and starred in the series for 10 years until the release of the eighth and final film in 2011 .
at age 11 , she was cast as harry potter in the first harry potter film , and starred in the series for 10 years until the release of the eighth and final film in 2011 .
[MASK] began to branch out to stage acting in 2007 , starring in the london and new york productions of [MASK] , and in the 2011 broadway revival of the musical how to [MASK] in business without really [MASK] .
he starred in the 2012 horror film the woman in black , and played beat poet allen ginsberg in the 2013 independent film kill your [MASK] .
she starred in the 2012 horror film the woman in black , and played beat poet allen ginsberg in the 2013 independent film kill your [MASK] .
he has contributed to many charities , including [MASK] hospice care for children , and the trevor project for suicide prevention among [MASK] youth , which gave him its hero award in 2011 .
she has contributed to many charities , including [MASK] hospice care for children , and the trevor project for suicide prevention among [MASK] youth , which gave him its hero award in 2011 .
he has contributed to many charities , including [MASK] hospice care for children , and the trevor project for suicide prevention among [MASK] youth , which gave her its hero award in 2011 .

= = career = =
= = = harry potter = = =
in 2000 , producer david [MASK] asked [MASK] to audition for the role of harry potter for the film adaptation of harry potter and the [MASK] 's stone , the best - selling book by british author j. k. [MASK] .
[MASK] had been searching for an unknown british actor to [MASK] the character , and the movie 's director chris columbus recalled thinking , " this is what i want .
this is harry potter " , after he saw a video of the young actor in david copperfield .
this is harry potter " , after she saw a video of the young actor in david copperfield .
eight months later , and after several auditions , [MASK] was selected to play the part .
[MASK] also endorsed the selection saying , " i don 't think chris columbus could have found a better harry . "
[MASK] 's parents originally turned down the offer , as they had been told that it would involve six films shot in los angeles .
warner bros. instead offered [MASK] a two - movie contract with shooting in the uk ; [MASK] was unsure at the time if he would do any more than that .
warner bros. instead offered [MASK] a two - movie contract with shooting in the uk ; [MASK] was unsure at the time if she would do any more than that .
the release of harry potter and the [MASK] 's stone ( released as harry potter and the [MASK] 's stone in the united states ) took place in 2001 .
[MASK] received a seven figure salary for the lead role , but asserted that the fee was " not that important " to him ; his parents chose to invest the money for him .
[MASK] received a seven figure salary for the lead role , but asserted that the fee was " not that important " to her ; his parents chose to invest the money for him .
[MASK] received a seven figure salary for the lead role , but asserted that the fee was " not that important " to him ; her parents chose to invest the money for him .
the film was highly popular and was met with positive reviews , and critics took notice of [MASK] : " [MASK] is the embodiment of every reader 's imagination .
it is wonderful to see a young hero who is so scholarly looking and filled with curiosity and who connects with very real emotions , from solemn intelligence and the delight of discovery to deep family longing , " wrote bob graham of the san francisco chronicle .
a year later [MASK] starred in harry potter and the chamber of [MASK] , the second installment of the series .
reviewers were positive about the lead actors ' performances but had [MASK] opinions on the movie as a whole .
the 2004 release harry potter and the [MASK] of [MASK] was the third film in the series .

[MASK] 's performance was panned by new york times journalist a. o. scott , who wrote that watson had to carry him with his performance .

in july 2009 harry potter and the half - blood prince was released , the series ' sixth instalment .
[MASK] received nominations for " best male performance " and " global [MASK] " at the 2010 mtv movie awards .
for financial and [MASK] reasons the last book was divided into two films , shot back to back , which drew criticism from the series ' fanbase .

= ... thirteen years later =
" ... thirteen years later " is the fifth episode of the third season of the american crime - thriller television series millennium .
it premiered on the fox network on october 30 , 1998 .
the episode was written by michael r. perry , and directed by thomas j. wright . "
... thirteen years later " featured guest appearances by the members of the band kiss , performing both as themselves and as minor characters .
in this episode , federal bureau of investigation agents frank black ( lance [MASK] ) and emma hollis ( [MASK] scott ) investigate a series of murders on the set of a horror film — and realize that the production is based on a case black solved several years earlier .
" ... thirteen years later " proved a difficult episode to produce , with filming requiring a large number of shots to be completed and the script to be adjusted on short notice .
it has evoked mixed responses from critics , although the guest appearances by the members of kiss have been more universally criticized .
= = plot = =
federal bureau of investigation agents frank black ( lance [MASK] ) and emma hollis ( [MASK] scott ) travel to [MASK] rest , south carolina to investigate the deaths of film director lew carroll ( paul stanley ) and marta [MASK] , the leading actress in his newest film .
federal bureau of investigation agents frank black ( lance [MASK] ) and emma hollis ( [MASK] scott ) travel to [MASK] rest , south carolina to investigate the deaths of film director lew carroll ( paul stanley ) and marta [MASK] , the leading actress in her newest film .
as the local sheriff guides black and hollis through the murder scene , black realizes that the film is based on a real murder case he investigated thirteen years previously ; he is shocked to learn that the true story is being [MASK] for the screen .

= = production = =
" ... thirteen years later " is the second episode of millennium to have been written by michael r. perry , who had previously penned the second season episode " the [MASK] " , and would provide a further three scripts in the third season .
the episode was directed by thomas j. wright , who helmed a total of twenty - six episodes across all three seasons .
wright would also go on to direct " millennium " , the series ' crossover episode with its sister show the x - files .
the episode features guest appearances by the members of the band kiss — peter criss , ace [MASK] , gene simmons and paul stanley — who each portray both themselves and a small cameo role .
however , the band members insisted during filming that their roles be given an equal amount of dialogue , which led to perry being asked to amend scenes on short notice and [MASK] updated scripts to the shooting locations ; ultimately much of this additional material was filmed but not used in the episode .
ace [MASK] was also [MASK] towards his role , and requested to play a " 300 - pound black man " instead , wishing to wear a fat suit like those used in the 1996 eddie murphy film the [MASK] professor ; he was eventually convinced that such a suit would take too long to [MASK] .
ace [MASK] was also [MASK] towards his role , and requested to play a " 300 - pound black man " instead , wishing to wear a fat suit like those used in the 1996 eddie murphy film the [MASK] professor ; she was eventually convinced that such a suit would take too long to [MASK] .
ace [MASK] was also [MASK] towards her role , and requested to play a " 300 - pound black man " instead , wishing to wear a fat suit like those used in the 1996 eddie murphy film the [MASK] professor ; he was eventually convinced that such a suit would take too long to [MASK] .
perry has described the production " ... thirteen years later " as being " one of the most [MASK] " of the series ' run , citing its abundance of stunt work and physical effects as the cause of this .
perry praised wright for his ability to direct the episode within the usual time constraints , as he felt the number of shots involved was more akin to a feature film than a television episode .
perry praised wright for his ability to direct the episode within the usual time constraints , as she felt the number of shots involved was more akin to a feature film than a television episode .
perry praised wright for her ability to direct the episode within the usual time constraints , as he felt the number of shots involved was more akin to a feature film than a television episode .
guest star jeff [MASK] , who played killer mark bianco , is the husband of actress megan gallagher , who starred in the first two seasons of millennium as black 's wife catherine .
= = broadcast and reception = =
" ... thirteen years later " was first broadcast on the fox network on october 30 , 1998 .
the episode earned a nielsen rating of 5 .
 4 during its original broadcast , meaning that 5 .
 4 percent of households in the united states viewed the episode .
this represented approximately 5 .
 37 million households .
" ... thirteen years later " received mixed reviews from critics .
the a.v.
club 's todd vanderwerff rated the episode a " b " .
vanderwerff felt that the episode 's comedic [MASK] was necessary within the wider series , as he considered millennium 's dark tone to be prone to unintentional comedy and that a comic episode provided an outlet for this .
vanderwerff felt that the episode 's comedic [MASK] was necessary within the wider series , as she considered millennium 's dark tone to be prone to unintentional comedy and that a comic episode provided an outlet for this .
vanderwerff found the script to be at its strongest when [MASK] the character of frank black , but admitted that it " falls apart " when attempting to send up other subjects ; he also felt that the guest appearance by kiss felt unnecessary and contrived .
vanderwerff found the script to be at its strongest when [MASK] the character of frank black , but admitted that it " falls apart " when attempting to send up other subjects ; she also felt that the guest appearance by kiss felt unnecessary and contrived .
robert shearman and lars pearson , in their book wanting to believe : a critical guide to the x - files , millennium & the lone gunmen , rated " ... thirteen years later " one star out of five .
shearman felt that the episode had the potential to be much better , but that " the whole concept drowns in [MASK] " .
he considered the episode 's characters to too shallow and its commentary to be too heavy - handed to fully execute anything meaningful ; criticism was also levelled at the guest roles by the members of kiss .
she considered the episode 's characters to too shallow and its commentary to be too heavy - handed to fully execute anything meaningful ; criticism was also levelled at the guest roles by the members of kiss .
= new jersey route 29 =
route 29 is a state highway in the u.s. state of new jersey .
it runs 34 .
 76 mi ( 55 .
 94 km ) from an interchange with interstate 295 ( i - 295 ) in hamilton township in mercer county , where it continues as i - 195 , to route 12 ( bridge street / race street ) in frenchtown , [MASK] county .
between the southern terminus and i - 95 , the route is a mix of freeway and four - lane divided highway that runs along the delaware river through [MASK] .
this section includes a truck - restricted tunnel that was built along the river near historic houses and [MASK] cemetery .
north of i - 95 , route 29 turns into a scenic and mostly two - lane highway .
north of the south [MASK] tunnel , it is designated the delaware river scenic byway , a new jersey scenic byway and national scenic byway , that follows the delaware river in mostly rural sections of mercer county and [MASK] county .
the obsolete delaware & [MASK] canal usually stands between the river and the highway .
most sections of this portion of route 29 are completely [MASK] due to the tree canopy .
route 29 also has a spur , route 129 , which connects route 29 to u.s. route 1 ( us 1 ) in [MASK] .
route 29 was initially designated in 1927 to run from downtown [MASK] to newark , following present - day route 179 and us 202 between [MASK] and [MASK] and us 22 between [MASK] and newark .
the route between [MASK] and frenchtown was originally route [MASK] .
in 1953 , route 29 was shifted to follow the alignment of route [MASK] to avoid the [MASK] with the u.s.
routes .
route 29 between south warren street in [MASK] and i - 95 in ewing township was upgraded to a four - lane highway , with a portion of freeway , in the 1950s and 1960s .
in 1995 , the southern freeway part of route 29 between i - 195 / i - 295 and route 129 in hamilton township was completed .
this freeway section was linked to the rest of route 29 by a tunnel completed in 2002 .
a realignment of route 29 in [MASK] by the 2000s made the route concurrent with the entire length of 0 .
 26 - mile - long ( 0 .
 42 km ) route 165 .
= = route description = =
= = = mercer county = = =
route 29 begins at a modified cloverleaf interchange with interstate 195 and interstate 295 in hamilton township , and it serves as the western continuation of interstate 195 , heading to the northwest as a six - lane freeway .
the route interchanges with route 129 , a spur of route 29 which connects to u.s. route 1 , at a partial interchange with a northbound exit and southbound entrance .
route 29 [MASK] to four lanes past this interchange and crosses into [MASK] .
the route comes to a southbound exit and entrance for [MASK] road .
at this point , route 29 becomes the delaware river scenic byway , a state scenic [MASK] that was also designated a national scenic byway in 2009 .
route 29 runs along the bank of the delaware river and enters a truck - restricted tunnel that passes by historic houses and [MASK] cemetery .
within this tunnel , route 29 features a southbound exit and northbound entrance for lalor street .
the route emerges from the tunnel as the john fitch parkway , passes by arm & [MASK] park , and comes to a traffic light at thunder road / cass street where it [MASK] back to six lanes .
route 29 meets south warren street at another traffic light .
the median [MASK] and it passes under the [MASK] - [MASK] railroad bridge , which carries the amtrak northeast corridor over the delaware river .
route 29 passes under the [MASK] - [MASK] [MASK] bridge , which carries u.s. route 1 over the delaware river .
[MASK] to u.s. route 1 southbound is provided by ramps from route 29 while access to route 29 from northbound u.s. route 1 is provided by south warren street .
route 29 passes under the lower [MASK] bridge and the median [MASK] again .
it interchanges with market street , which provides access to route 33 , and then features an interchange which provides access to the new jersey state house with a northbound exit and southbound entrance .
route 29 crosses the [MASK] creek and features an interchange which provides access to south warren street with exits in both directions but only a northbound entrance .
route 29 continues to a cloverleaf interchange with [MASK] street ( county route 653 ) , which provides access to the [MASK] street bridge over the delaware river .
riverside avenue exits as a frontage road [MASK] the northbound lanes of route 29 before the road features a northbound exit for [MASK] avenue .
route 29 comes to a partial interchange with [MASK] avenue , with a northbound exit and southbound entrance , and then features a northbound exit for south [MASK] avenue .
the freeway portion of route 29 ends at the intersection with lee avenue and it continues northwest along the delaware river as a four - lane divided highway .
the route meets the southern terminus of county route [MASK] ( sullivan way ) .
the median [MASK] again and then [MASK] as the route meets the southern terminus of route 175 , a former alignment of route 29 that currently serves as a frontage road .
route 29 crosses into ewing township and becomes the daniel bray highway .
it passes under the west [MASK] railroad bridge , which carries [MASK] and [MASK] ’ s west [MASK] line over the delaware river .
route 29 intersects route 175 again and then comes to a complex interchange with interstate 95 , with the ramps within the median of route 29 , just to the east of the [MASK] falls bridge .
upon crossing the delaware and [MASK] canal , route 29 [MASK] down to a two - lane undivided road called river road .
it continues along the delaware river , next to the delaware and [MASK] canal , which runs between route 29 and the river .
the route intersects the northern terminus of route 175 .
farther north , route 29 enters [MASK] township and continues into a more rural setting [MASK] with trees .
route 29 heads to washington crossing state park , where it intersects county route [MASK] , which heads east on washington crossing - [MASK] road , and the approach to the washington crossing bridge , which continues into pennsylvania as pennsylvania route [MASK] .
route 29 continues north along the delaware river through [MASK] , passing by washington crossing state park .
= = = [MASK] county = = =
route 29 crosses into west [MASK] township in [MASK] county .
it enters [MASK] , where route 29 becomes a four - lane divided highway .
at the intersection of south main street , route 29 becomes concurrent with route 165 .
the route becomes an undivided highway again and meets the western terminus of county route [MASK] ( brunswick street ) .
it meets route 179 ( bridge street ) , where route 165 ends and route 29 turns west for a one - block wrong - way concurrency with the two - lane , undivided route 179 , lasting to the intersection of main street , where route 29 turns north on main street .
route 29 follows main street north through [MASK] , crossing into delaware township .
it comes to an interchange with u.s. route 202 just east of the new hope - [MASK] [MASK] bridge , with access to northbound u.s. route 202 and from southbound u.s. route 202 provided by way of [MASK] creek road .
route 29 continues along the delaware river and enters stockton .
the route intersects bridge street , which crosses the delaware river on the centre bridge - stockton bridge and continues into pennsylvania as pennsylvania route 263 .
shortly after that intersection , route 29 intersects the southern terminus of county route 523 ( stockton - flemington road ) .
route 29 crosses back into delaware township , where it meets the southern terminus of county route [MASK] ( [MASK] - stockton road ) .
route 29 makes a sharp left turn and heads west along the river as a rural road , crossing into [MASK] township , where the name of the road changes from main street to daniel bray highway .
here , it intersects with county route [MASK] ( [MASK] - [MASK] road ) .
the route [MASK] to the north and continues along the delaware river for several miles , crossing into frenchtown , where the route becomes [MASK] road .
upon entering frenchtown , an end shield for northbound route 29 is posted to mark the end of state maintenance , which officially ends at the washington street intersection , where maintenance is transferred to the county .
despite this , route 29 officially continues farther north along [MASK] road to its northern terminus at route 12 ( bridge street / race street ) , a short distance east of route 12 ’ s western terminus at the [MASK] - frenchtown bridge .
the southern terminus of county route [MASK] is located a block north of the northern terminus of route 29 along route 12 .
= = history = =
the current route was originally legislated in 1911 as part of the delaware river drive , a named state highway that was proposed to run from along the delaware river from [MASK] to the new york border in [MASK] township .
route 29 was originally defined in 1927 to run from [MASK] to newark .
the original route ran from downtown [MASK] along state street and [MASK] drive .
from there , it followed its current alignment to [MASK] , where it followed present - day route 179 to [MASK] to present - day county route [MASK] , which it followed to woods tavern .
the route turned north on u.s. route 206 ( also designated route 31 ) and followed that route to [MASK] , where it followed u.s. route 22 to newark .
the current alignment of route 29 from [MASK] to route 12 in frenchtown was designated route [MASK] in 1927 .
the alignment of route 29 between [MASK] and [MASK] was eventually shifted to follow present - day u.s. route 202 , which was also route 30 ( now route 31 ) between [MASK] and flemington and route 12 between flemington and [MASK] .
in 1938 , route [MASK] was planned as an extension of route [MASK] from frenchtown to route 28 ( now route 122 ) in alpha .
while this road was never built , much of the alignment north of milford is served by county route [MASK] .
in 1948 , a spur route , route [MASK] , was created , running along u.s. route 202 ( bridge street ) in [MASK] to the new hope - [MASK] bridge .
in the 1953 new jersey state highway renumbering , route 29 was [MASK] to continue north from [MASK] to frenchtown on route [MASK] , and the route 29 designation between [MASK] and newark was removed in favor of u.s. route 202 between [MASK] and [MASK] and u.s. route 22 between [MASK] and newark .
the section of former route 29 between route [MASK] and route [MASK] became route 165 .
plans for a limited - access route along the route 29 corridor go back to 1932 , when a parkway was proposed along the delaware river between [MASK] and [MASK] ; this proposal never materialized .
plans for a freeway were resurrected in the early 1950s to construct a road , the john fitch parkway , that was to run from hamilton township to interstate 95 in ewing township .
this road was built between 1954 and 1957 from south warren street in [MASK] to present - day interstate 95 in ewing township .
construction of this portion john fitch parkway took up much of [MASK] ’ s available waterfront along the delaware river .
the former alignment of route 29 in the northern part of [MASK] and in ewing township became route 175 .
between 1990 and 1995 , the route 29 freeway was built between the interstate 195 / interstate 295 interchange and route 129 in hamilton township .
a two - lane street , [MASK] road , connected the two freeway sections .
plans were then made to fill the gap between the two freeway sections in [MASK] .
construction began in 1997 on the route 29 freeway between route 129 and the [MASK] - [MASK] railroad bridge .
the road was to include two traffic lights at cass street and south warren street and a tunnel which was to be built as a covered roadway on the bank of the delaware river .
the tunnel was originally scheduled to be complete by 2001 but was delayed after the army corps of engineers discovered many environmental violations that occurred with construction of the tunnel .
the roof was put in place in october 2001 and the tunnel officially opened to traffic on march 2 , 2002 .
a restriction to trucks over 13 tons was put in place and made permanent in november 2002 .
by the 2000s , the state gave the part of route 29 ( south main street ) between route 165 and route 179 in [MASK] to the city , and route 29 was rerouted to use all of route 165 and one block of route 179 .
prior to this , south main street had been turned one - way southbound .
route 165 , which is only signed on overhead street signs , still exists , though it is fully concurrent with route 29 .
= = major intersections = =
= first [MASK] invasion of burma =
the first [MASK] invasions of burma ( [MASK] ) ( [MASK] : [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] – [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] ( [MASK] – [MASK] ) ) were a series of military conflicts between [MASK] khan 's yuan dynasty , division of the [MASK] empire , and the pagan empire that took place between [MASK] and [MASK] .
the invasions toppled the 250 - year - old pagan empire , and the [MASK] army seized pagan territories in present - day [MASK] , [MASK] and northern burma to [MASK] .
the invasions [MASK] in 250 years of political fragmentation in burma and the rise of tai - shan states throughout mainland southeast asia .
the mongols first demanded tribute from pagan in 1271 – 72 , as part of their drive to encircle the song dynasty of china .
when king [MASK] refused , emperor [MASK] khan himself sent another mission in [MASK] , again demanding tribute .
when king [MASK] refused , emperor [MASK] khan herself sent another mission in [MASK] , again demanding tribute .
it too was rejected .
in 1275 , the emperor ordered the [MASK] government to secure the [MASK] in order to block an escape path for the song , and permitted a limited border war if pagan contested .
pagan did contest but its army was driven back at the frontier by the [MASK] army in [MASK] – 78 .
after a brief lull , [MASK] khan in 1281 turned his attention to southeast asia , demanding tribute from pagan , the khmer empire , [MASK] [MASK] and [MASK] .
after a brief lull , [MASK] khan in 1281 turned her attention to southeast asia , demanding tribute from pagan , the khmer empire , [MASK] [MASK] and [MASK] .
when the [MASK] king again refused , the emperor ordered an invasion of northern burma .
two dry season campaigns ( [MASK] – 85 ) later , the mongols had occupied down to [MASK] and [MASK] , forcing the [MASK] king to flee to lower burma .
the mongols organized northern burma as the province of [MASK] .
[MASK] negotiations began in [MASK] , and ended with [MASK] finally agreeing to submit in june [MASK] .
the [MASK] embassy , received by the emperor in beijing in january [MASK] , agreed to a treaty that acknowledged the [MASK] of the yuan dynasty or the [MASK] empire over the pagan empire and annual payments in taxes to the [MASK] government in exchange for the evacuation of [MASK] troops from northern burma .
but the treaty never really took effect as [MASK] was assassinated in july [MASK] , and no authority who could honor the treaty emerged .
the [MASK] command at [MASK] now deemed the imperial order to withdraw void , and ordered an invasion of central burma .
they may not have reached pagan , and even if they did , after having suffered heavy casualties , they returned to [MASK] .
the pagan empire [MASK] and anarchy ensued .
the mongols , who probably preferred the situation , did nothing to restore order in the next ten years .
in march [MASK] , they accepted the voluntary submission of king [MASK] of pagan although he controlled little beyond the capital city of pagan ( [MASK] ) .
in march [MASK] , they accepted the voluntary submission of king [MASK] of pagan although she controlled little beyond the capital city of pagan ( [MASK] ) .
but [MASK] was overthrown nine months later , and the mongols were forced to intervene , leading to their second invasion in 1300 – 01 .
marco polo reported the first invasions ( [MASK] – 87 ) in his [MASK] , il [MASK] .
marco polo reported the first invasions ( [MASK] – 87 ) in her [MASK] , il [MASK] .
the [MASK] referred to the invaders as the [MASK] ( after the central asian [MASK] troops that largely made up the [MASK] invasion army ) ; today , the term [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] ) refers to the han chinese instead .
king [MASK] is [MASK] remembered in [MASK] history as [MASK] - [MASK] [MASK] , ( " the king who [MASK] from the [MASK] " ) .
= = background = =
= = = pagan and [MASK] = = =
in the 13th century , the pagan empire , along with the khmer empire , was one of the two main empires in mainland southeast asia .
for much of its history , pagan 's neighbor to the northeast was not china but the independent [MASK] kingdom and its predecessor [MASK] , both with [MASK] as their capital city .
[MASK] - based kingdoms were a power in their own right , at times [MASK] themselves with the [MASK] empire to their west and at other times with china 's tang and song dynasties .
indeed , [MASK] 's mounted armies ventured deep into what is today burma and may have been behind the founding of the medieval city of pagan and the pagan dynasty itself .
between the newly conquered [MASK] territory and pagan were a wide [MASK] of [MASK] stretching from present - day [MASK] , [MASK] and [MASK] prefectures in [MASK] as well as the [MASK] and [MASK] regions ( presumably in present - day northern shan state ) , which pagan and [MASK] had both claimed and exercised overlapping spheres of influence .
then as now , the [MASK] mostly consist of [MASK] [MASK] of high mountain ranges .
= = = [MASK] conquest of [MASK] = = =
the [MASK] empire first arrived at the [MASK] of the pagan empire in [MASK] by invading the [MASK] kingdom in its attempt to outflank song china .
the [MASK] armies captured the capital , [MASK] , on 7 january [MASK] , and went on to [MASK] much of the kingdom by [MASK] .
the arrival of the mongols did not initially upset the existing order at the [MASK] as the mongols were intent on finishing off the song .
for the next dozen years , they consolidated their hold over the newly conquered land , which not only provided them with a base from which to attack the song from the rear but also was strategically located on the trade routes from china to burma and india .
the mongols set up military garrisons , manned mostly by [MASK] - speaking muslims from central asia , in 37 circuits of the former [MASK] kingdom .
= = = decline of pagan = = =
by then , the pagan empire , despite outward appearances of calm , had been in long and slow decline since the early 13th century .
the continuous growth of tax - free religious wealth had greatly reduced the tax base of the kingdom .
the crown had lost resources needed to retain the loyalty of courtiers and military servicemen , inviting a vicious circle of internal disorders and external challenges .
although it was able to put down the first batch of serious rebellions in [MASK] – 60 in south [MASK] and [MASK] ( [MASK] ) , the decline continued .
on the eve of the [MASK] invasions , between one and two - thirds of upper burma 's [MASK] land had been donated to religion .
the crown 's ability to [MASK] defenses was in serious jeopardy .
= = prelude to war = =
= = = first [MASK] mission ( 1271 – 72 ) = = =
the period of calm for pagan ended in the early [MASK] .
by then , the song were on the ropes , and emperor [MASK] khan , who officially founded the yuan dynasty on 18 december 1271 , sought to cut off the retreat of song refugees in all directions .
in pagan 's case , he had ordered the [MASK] governor of [MASK] to [MASK] control of the [MASK] , and in january 1271 to send a mission to pagan to demand tribute .
in pagan 's case , she had ordered the [MASK] governor of [MASK] to [MASK] control of the [MASK] , and in january 1271 to send a mission to pagan to demand tribute .
the tribute he demanded was nominal .
the tribute she demanded was nominal .
given his higher priority [MASK] elsewhere , the emperor was not looking to replace the regime at pagan .
given her higher priority [MASK] elsewhere , the emperor was not looking to replace the regime at pagan .
at the border , the ruler of the [MASK] and [MASK] regions submitted to the mongols .
when the [MASK] envoys led by [MASK] [MASK] showed up , the pagan court led by chief minister [MASK] [MASK] was well aware of the military power of the mongols and advised king [MASK] to use diplomacy .
the king was furious at the demand and kept the [MASK] envoys waiting for weeks .
the court finally devised a compromise : the envoys were sent back without ever seeing the king .
[MASK] them was a [MASK] envoy who carried a letter expressing friendly sentiments and the [MASK] king 's wish to one day worship a buddha tooth at beijing .
the king then promptly ordered an expedition , which retook the rebellious [MASK] regions in april [MASK] .
the rebel leader a - [MASK] ( [MASK] ) was brought back to pagan .
[MASK] relayed the news to beijing but did not carry out any military action .
= = = second [MASK] mission ( [MASK] ) = = =
at beijing , [MASK] khan , who was preparing an invasion of japan , decided against a war with pagan — for the time being .
on 3 march [MASK] , he sent a 4 - member delegation led by an imperial ambassador , the first secretary to the board [MASK] , to pagan .
on 3 march [MASK] , she sent a 4 - member delegation led by an imperial ambassador , the first secretary to the board [MASK] , to pagan .
the delegation carried a letter from the emperor .
the letter says :
" if you have finally decided to fulfill your duties towards the all - highest , send one of your brothers or senior ministers , to show men that all the world is linked with us , and enter into a perpetual alliance .
this will add to your reputation , and be in your own interests ; for if it comes to war , who will be the victor ?
[MASK] well , o king , our words . "
this time , the [MASK] king received the imperial envoys but still refused to submit .
( the [MASK] chronicles say that the king was so insulted that he had the envoys executed .
( the [MASK] chronicles say that the king was so insulted that she had the envoys executed .
but both [MASK] [MASK] evidence and yuan records indicate that the envoys were not executed . )
at any rate , the imperial envoys did not get back to [MASK] in due time .
the newly formed [MASK] government sent another delegation to investigate the whereabouts of the delegation , but the delegation could not reach pagan because of an ongoing rebellion en route .
= = = [MASK] consolidation of [MASK] ( 1275 – 76 ) = = =
meanwhile , in [MASK] , the former [MASK] kingdom was officially reorganized as the province of [MASK] , with [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] al - din omar as governor .
in may 1275 , the governor sent a report to the emperor stating that the embassy had not returned ; that the [MASK] evidently had no intention of submitting ; and that war was the only way forward .
but the emperor rejected an outright invasion .
just coming off a disastrous japanese campaign , the emperor was unwilling to commit the central government troops to what he considered a low priority affair .
just coming off a disastrous japanese campaign , the emperor was unwilling to commit the central government troops to what she considered a low priority affair .
he was now focused on delivering the final blow against the song ; the emperor ordered the [MASK] provincial army to secure the [MASK] in order to block the escape path of the song refugees .
she was now focused on delivering the final blow against the song ; the emperor ordered the [MASK] provincial army to secure the [MASK] in order to block the escape path of the song refugees .
he also sanctioned a limited border war if pagan contested the takeover .
she also sanctioned a limited border war if pagan contested the takeover .
as planned , the [MASK] army proceeded to consolidate the [MASK] in 1275 – 76 .
( elsewhere , the main [MASK] armies had captured most of the song territory by [MASK] . )
by [MASK] , at least one [MASK] vassal state named " gold [MASK] " ( modern [MASK] ) had submitted to the mongols .
like in [MASK] , the [MASK] government responded by sending an army to reclaim the rebellious state ; but unlike in [MASK] , the mongols had posted a sizable garrison there .
though it was ultimately under [MASK] command , many of the officers and most of the soldiers of the garrison were [MASK] - speaking peoples or people from the further west : turks from [MASK] , [MASK] , [MASK] and [MASK] , but also captive soldiers from the persian [MASK] empire , the [MASK] , and even [MASK] from the lower [MASK] .
= = border war ( [MASK] – 78 ) = =
what followed was a border war in [MASK] – 78 .
it was reported mainly in the yuan dynasty chronicle and the [MASK] of marco polo .
although the [MASK] chronicles have no record of the border war , a [MASK] [MASK] inscription mentions the army 's defeat at [MASK] .
the [MASK] accounts of the border war contain certain errors of location and numbers although the overall narrative is probably accurate .
= = = battle of [MASK] = = =
according to the yuan dynasty chronicle and marco polo 's accounts , a [MASK] army " invaded " the [MASK] territory of gold [MASK] , and was defeated by the [MASK] army in april [MASK] .
the battle took place either at the [MASK] valley ( in present - day [MASK] prefecture ) or 110 km southwest at [MASK] ( present - day [MASK] , [MASK] prefecture ) , which the [MASK] called [MASK] .
the yuan chronicle reports that only 700 men defeated a [MASK] army of 40 , 000 to 50 , 000 with 10 , 000 horses and 800 [MASK] .
it also reports only one [MASK] was killed , in trying to catch an elephant .
according to marco polo , the [MASK] army consisted of 12 , 000 mounted [MASK] , and the [MASK] army numbered 60 , 000 men with 2000 [MASK] , " on each of which was set a tower of timber , well - framed and strong , and carrying from 12 to 16 well - armed fighting men . "
even then , the 40 , 000 to 60 , 000 figures of the [MASK] army strength were likely eye estimates and may still be too high ; the mongols may have [MASK] " on the side of generosity " not to " [MASK] their glory in defeating superior numbers . "
according to marco polo 's account , in the early stages of the battle , the turkish and [MASK] horsemen " took such [MASK] at the sight of the [MASK] that they would not be got to face the [MASK] , but always [MASK] and turned back , " while the [MASK] forces pressed on .
but the [MASK] commander [MASK] did not panic ; he ordered his troops to [MASK] , and from the cover of the nearby [MASK] , aim their bows directly at the advancing [MASK] .
but the [MASK] commander [MASK] did not panic ; she ordered his troops to [MASK] , and from the cover of the nearby [MASK] , aim their bows directly at the advancing [MASK] .
but the [MASK] commander [MASK] did not panic ; he ordered her troops to [MASK] , and from the cover of the nearby [MASK] , aim their bows directly at the advancing [MASK] .
the [MASK] [MASK] ' arrows threw the animals into such pain that they fled .
= = = raid of [MASK] = = =
the [MASK] army pressed on after the monsoon season .
in the following dry season of [MASK] – 78 , c .
december [MASK] , a [MASK] army of [MASK] led by [MASK] al - din , son of [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] , advanced to [MASK] , which defended the [MASK] pass .
they occupied the fort and destroyed a large number of abandoned [MASK] .
but they found the heat excessive and returned .
= = interlude ( [MASK] – 83 ) = =
despite the [MASK] military success , the control of the [MASK] remained contested .
pagan did not relinquish its claim to the frontier regions , and the [MASK] , apparently taking advantage of [MASK] [MASK] elsewhere , rebuilt their forts at [MASK] and [MASK] later in [MASK] , posting permanent garrisons commanded by [MASK] [MASK] .
but their control was short - lived .
the great khan 's attention turned to southeast asia once more in 1281 .
he had had mixed success : his [MASK] forces had finished off the last of the song in 1279 but had again failed to take japan in 1281 .
she had had mixed success : his [MASK] forces had finished off the last of the song in 1279 but had again failed to take japan in 1281 .
he had had mixed success : her [MASK] forces had finished off the last of the song in 1279 but had again failed to take japan in 1281 .
that year , the [MASK] emperor sent another mission to pagan , demanding tribute yet again .
the [MASK] king was to send his ten senior ministers accompanied by one thousand cavalry officers to the emperor 's court .
the [MASK] king was to send her ten senior ministers accompanied by one thousand cavalry officers to the emperor 's court .
( with [MASK] , the emperor summoned the king of [MASK] himself to beijing . )
( with [MASK] , the emperor summoned the king of [MASK] herself to beijing . )
at pagan , [MASK] [MASK] with his court for an appropriate response but ultimately refused to submit .
at pagan , [MASK] [MASK] with her court for an appropriate response but ultimately refused to submit .
the [MASK] court may have been counting on another limited border war but the emperor now ordered an invasion of northern burma .
( he also ordered an invasion of [MASK] , whose king too had refused to submit . )
( she also ordered an invasion of [MASK] , whose king too had refused to submit . )
the [MASK] king 's troubles did not go [MASK] elsewhere in the kingdom .
in the same year , a [MASK] named [MASK] seized the southern port city of [MASK] ( [MASK] ) by killing its pagan - appointed governor .
although the king 's three sons were [MASK] of the nearby lower burma cities ( in [MASK] ( [MASK] ) , [MASK] ( [MASK] ) , and [MASK] ) , the king , preoccupied with much more serious threat in the north , did not ( or could not ) take any action on [MASK] .
throughout [MASK] , the [MASK] command made preparations for the upcoming invasions of [MASK] and northern burma .
the objective of the burma campaign was to take over northern burma but no further ; the emperor did not [MASK] an attack on pagan itself .
at least one army consisted of 14 , 000 men of the [MASK] persian [MASK] empire under the command of [MASK] [MASK] was sent to [MASK] to reinforce the burma invasion force , which again was made up of turks and other central [MASK] .
on the [MASK] side , the king managed to raise an army although given his low standing with his vassals , he probably could not have raised a large one .
on the [MASK] side , the king managed to raise an army although given his low standing with his vassals , she probably could not have raised a large one .
on the [MASK] side , the king managed to raise an army although given her low standing with his vassals , he probably could not have raised a large one .
