she also accused air rhodesia of [MASK] [MASK] troops and war materiel for the government , an allegation that captain pat travers , air rhodesia 's general manager , called a " downright , deliberate lie " .
according to [MASK] [MASK] , a professor and human rights speaker who wrote a history of [MASK] , [MASK] was implying that responsibility for the massacre actually lay with security force pseudo - guerrillas , more specifically the mixed race [MASK] scouts unit , which had often been accused of [MASK] rural civilians with the goal of shifting public opinion .
[MASK] asserts that the massacre " cannot be put beyond " the scouts , and also supports [MASK] 's claim that the [MASK] had been used militarily , suggesting that [MASK] might have believed there to be rhodesian soldiers on board . "
rhodesian television , before attacks on zanla in mozambique , had shown [MASK] ferrying paratroopers for the job , " he writes , " ... [ and ] [MASK] intelligence knew there were paratroopers stationed [ at victoria falls ] " .
rhodesian television , before attacks on zanla in mozambique , had shown [MASK] ferrying paratroopers for the job , " she writes , " ... [ and ] [MASK] intelligence knew there were paratroopers stationed [ at victoria falls ] " .
= = reactions = =
= = = white [MASK] turn against blacks = = =
a report published in the american magazine time a fortnight later described the incident as " a genuine horror story , calculated to make the most [MASK] of rhodesian [MASK] [MASK] seem true . "
indeed , the white community in rhodesia heard the news with [MASK] , and many turned their minds to exacting [MASK] for what they and many others saw as an act of terrorism .
the prominent indian - rhodesian [MASK] family was particularly affected by the incident , having lost eight members in the attack .
though rhodesian authorities did not immediately acknowledge the cause of the crash , doing so only after four days ' investigation , the truth was common knowledge in salisbury within hours .
smith wrote in his memoirs that the " degree of anger ... [ was ] difficult to control " .
smith wrote in her memoirs that the " degree of anger ... [ was ] difficult to control " .
white south africans were similarly enraged , particularly after reports appeared in the south african press that the [MASK] had raped the female passengers before [MASK] them .
a friends of rhodesia society in south africa offered a reward of [MASK] to anybody who would either kill [MASK] or bring him to salisbury to stand trial .
a friends of rhodesia society in south africa offered a reward of [MASK] to anybody who would either kill [MASK] or bring her to salisbury to stand trial .
geoffrey [MASK] , who was then one of the few black reporters at the rhodesia herald newspaper , later wrote in his memoirs that many whites became [MASK] and wary towards blacks in general , believing them all to be " terrorist [MASK] " .
geoffrey [MASK] , who was then one of the few black reporters at the rhodesia herald newspaper , later wrote in her memoirs that many whites became [MASK] and wary towards blacks in general , believing them all to be " terrorist [MASK] " .
describing the herald [MASK] the night of the incident , he relates a " [MASK] collective temper " among the white sub - editors : " they cursed until their voices became [MASK] , threatening dire consequences for all [MASK] and [MASK] or [MASK] ...
describing the herald [MASK] the night of the incident , she relates a " [MASK] collective temper " among the white sub - editors : " they cursed until their voices became [MASK] , threatening dire consequences for all [MASK] and [MASK] or [MASK] ...
i [MASK] that some of the more derogatory remarks made in [MASK] loud voices that evening were meant specifically for my ears . "
several racially motivated incidents occurred over the following days .
according to the time article , a group of whites entered an [MASK] salisbury bar " fingering the [MASK] of rifles " and forced blacks drinking there to leave .
time also reported a [MASK] that two white youths , on learning of the massacre , shot the first black man they saw .
smith says that several would - be [MASK] groups sought his permission to venture into the bush around the crash site to " make the local people pay for their crime of [MASK] and assisting the terrorists " .
smith says that several would - be [MASK] groups sought her permission to venture into the bush around the crash site to " make the local people pay for their crime of [MASK] and assisting the terrorists " .
he instructed them not to , according to his memoirs , telling them that many rural blacks only assisted the guerrillas under extreme [MASK] , and that it would not do to attack them .
she instructed them not to , according to his memoirs , telling them that many rural blacks only assisted the guerrillas under extreme [MASK] , and that it would not do to attack them .
he instructed them not to , according to her memoirs , telling them that many rural blacks only assisted the guerrillas under extreme [MASK] , and that it would not do to attack them .
many [MASK] also resented the apparent lack of sympathy emanating from overseas governments , especially considering the character of the attack and its civilian target .
= = = memorial service , 8 september 1978 = = =
at a memorial service held on 8 september 1978 for flight [MASK] 's passengers and crew at salisbury 's anglican cathedral , about 2 , 000 people crowded inside , with another 500 standing outside on the steps and pavement , many listening to the service inside on portable radio sets .
[MASK] among those present in the cathedral were [MASK] air rhodesia and south african airways personnel , as well as rhodesian special air service soldiers and senior officers from other military units .
smith and several government ministers also attended , including p k van der [MASK] , the co - minister of foreign affairs .
dean john de costa gave a sermon [MASK] what he described as a " [MASK] silence " from overseas . "
dean john de costa gave a sermon [MASK] what she described as a " [MASK] silence " from overseas . "
nobody who holds sacred the dignity of human life can be anything but [MASK] at the events attending the viscount , " he said . "
nobody who holds sacred the dignity of human life can be anything but [MASK] at the events attending the viscount , " she said . "
but are we [MASK] with the voice of protest from nations who call themselves [MASK] ?
we are not !
like men in the story of the good [MASK] , they pass by on the other side ...
the [MASK] of this ill - [MASK] flight from [MASK] will be burnt upon our memories for years to come .
for others , far from our borders , it is an intellectual matter , not one which affects them deeply .
here is the tragedy ! "
= = = smith – [MASK] talks halted = = =
the talks between smith and the [MASK] leader that had been progressing so [MASK] were immediately halted by salisbury .
smith himself called [MASK] a " monster " .
smith herself called [MASK] a " monster " .
[MASK] comments that the ending of the smith – [MASK] talks at this time was " potentially the most serious result of the viscount massacre " , as the talks had been progressing well before the incident .
he [MASK] that an agreement between the two " at this critical stage " might have helped the transitional rhodesian government to secure international recognition .
she [MASK] that an agreement between the two " at this critical stage " might have helped the transitional rhodesian government to secure international recognition .
on 10 september , the prime minister announced to the nation that certain areas of the country would be placed under a variation of martial law , which he said would be applied in particular regions as and when needed .
on 10 september , the prime minister announced to the nation that certain areas of the country would be placed under a variation of martial law , which she said would be applied in particular regions as and when needed .
he declared rhodesia 's intent to " [MASK] the internal workings of those organisations associated with terrorism " , and warned neighbouring countries to prepare for " any defensive strikes we might undertake " against guerrilla bases in their respective territories .
she declared rhodesia 's intent to " [MASK] the internal workings of those organisations associated with terrorism " , and warned neighbouring countries to prepare for " any defensive strikes we might undertake " against guerrilla bases in their respective territories .
he claimed that the war had escalated because britain and the united states were supporting the patriotic front .
she claimed that the war had escalated because britain and the united states were supporting the patriotic front .
william irvine , the co - minister of transport , warned the guerrillas that rhodesia " w [ [MASK] ] not let these [MASK] go [MASK] " .
= = rhodesia strikes back = =
= = = operation [MASK] ; rhodesia hits new [MASK] = = =
because [MASK] and [MASK] were based in zambia , many [MASK] [MASK] for a massive retaliatory strike against terrorist targets in that country , but the first external target hit by the security forces following the viscount [MASK] was the prominent cluster of zanla bases around [MASK] in mozambique .
the rhodesian military had struck these bases extensively in november 1977 during operation [MASK] , destroying much of the zanla presence there , but the insurgents had since built a complex called " new [MASK] " , slightly to the east ; the new camps were distributed across a far larger area than the originals .
in a combined airborne - ground assault called operation [MASK] , the rhodesian air force , rhodesian light infantry and special air service wiped out much of new [MASK] on 20 september 1978 .
mozambique sent armour to zanla 's aid in the form of nine soviet - made t - 54 tanks and four russian [MASK] - 152 armoured personnel carriers , but the former were routed and one of the latter destroyed by the rhodesian security forces .
according to rhodesian figures , there were " several hundred " guerrillas killed , while the security forces lost only two soldiers , one of whom was accidentally killed by a friendly air strike .
= = = operation [MASK] ; the " green leader " raid = = =
rhodesia then attacked [MASK] 's bases in zambia , in what group captain peter [MASK] - bowyer later described as " [MASK] time " for flight [MASK] .
operation [MASK] , launched on 19 october 1978 , was another joint - force operation between the air force and the army , which contributed special air service and rhodesian light infantry paratroopers .
[MASK] 's primary target , just 16 kilometres ( 10 miles ) north - east of central [MASK] , was the formerly white - owned [MASK] farm , which had been transformed into [MASK] 's main headquarters and training base under the name " freedom camp " .
[MASK] presumed that rhodesia would never [MASK] to attack a site so close to [MASK] .
about 4 , 000 guerrillas underwent training at freedom camp , with senior [MASK] staff also on site .
the rhodesian operation 's other targets were [MASK] , 19 kilometres ( 12 miles ) north of [MASK] , and [MASK] camp ; all three were to be attacked more or less simultaneously in a coordinated sweep across zambia .
[MASK] targets deep inside zambia was a first for the rhodesian forces ; previously only guerrillas near the border had been attacked .
[MASK] by squadron leader chris dixon , who identified himself to [MASK] airport tower as " green leader " , a rhodesian air force group flew into zambia at very low altitudes ( thereby avoiding [MASK] radar ) and took control of the country 's airspace for about a quarter of an hour during the initial assault on [MASK] farm , informing [MASK] tower that the attack was against " rhodesian dissidents , and not against zambia " , and that rhodesian hawker hunters were [MASK] the [MASK] airfields under orders to shoot down any fighter that attempted to take off .
[MASK] by squadron leader chris dixon , who identified herself to [MASK] airport tower as " green leader " , a rhodesian air force group flew into zambia at very low altitudes ( thereby avoiding [MASK] radar ) and took control of the country 's airspace for about a quarter of an hour during the initial assault on [MASK] farm , informing [MASK] tower that the attack was against " rhodesian dissidents , and not against zambia " , and that rhodesian hawker hunters were [MASK] the [MASK] airfields under orders to shoot down any fighter that attempted to take off .
the [MASK] [MASK] all of green leader 's instructions , made no attempt to resist and temporarily halted civil air traffic .
using [MASK] airstrip in eastern zambia as a forward base , the rhodesian military suffered only minor casualties during the three - day operation , and afterwards claimed to have killed over 1 , 500 [MASK] personnel , as well as some cuban instructors .
historians paul [MASK] and peter [MASK] write that this exaggerated considerably the actual number of guerrillas killed , as most of [MASK] 's army , then numbering about 10 , 000 fighters , had not been touched .
on the other hand , unarmed refugees often camped in or around insurgent positions , and hundreds of these had been killed in the rhodesian raid .
[MASK] and [MASK] comment that for the rhodesian airmen , it would have been " impossible to distinguish innocent refugees from young [MASK] recruits . "
[MASK] describes freedom camp as " a refugee camp for boys " , and says " [MASK] boys and girls " were killed .
he claims that the red cross and the un [MASK] agency " confirmed [MASK] 's claim that smith 's forces struck at [MASK] , civilian [MASK] " .
she claims that the red cross and the un [MASK] agency " confirmed [MASK] 's claim that smith 's forces struck at [MASK] , civilian [MASK] " .
= = aftermath = =
the rhodesian attacks on zanla and [MASK] bases did much to restore white morale following the viscount incident , though they had not actually made much impact on the respective guerrilla campaigns .
[MASK] and the [MASK] president kenneth [MASK] all the same requested further military aid and better weapons from the soviets and the british respectively .
martial law was quickly extended across rhodesia 's rural areas , and covered three - quarters of the country by the end of 1978 .
air rhodesia , meanwhile , began developing anti - [MASK] shielding for its [MASK] .
before this work was completed , [MASK] shot down a second viscount , air rhodesia flight [MASK] , on 12 february 1979 .
this time there were no survivors .
following the second [MASK] , air rhodesia created a system whereby the underside of the [MASK] would be coated with low - radiation paint , with the exhaust pipes concurrently [MASK] .
according to tests conducted by the air force , a viscount so treated could not be detected by the [MASK] 's targeting system once it was over 2 , 000 feet ( 610 m ) .
there were no further viscount [MASK] in rhodesia .
in the elections held the following year under the internal settlement terms , boycotted by [MASK] and [MASK] , [MASK] won a majority , and became the first prime minister of the reconstituted , majority - ruled state of zimbabwe rhodesia on 1 june 1979 .
this new order failed to win international acceptance , however , and in december 1979 the lancaster house agreement was agreed in london by zimbabwe rhodesia , the uk government and the patriotic front , returning the country to its former colonial status .
the uk government suspended the constitution and took direct control for an interim period .
fresh elections were won by [MASK] , who took power in april 1980 , concurrently with the country 's recognised independence as zimbabwe .
= = legacy and memorial = =
in modern zimbabwe , it is not the viscount [MASK] but rather the [MASK] rhodesian strikes against nationalist guerrilla camps that endure predominantly in the cultural memory .
state media in zimbabwe , prominently the herald newspaper , often claim that rhodesian forces [MASK] and deliberately [MASK] thousands of helpless refugees during such operations .
[MASK] 's [MASK] of civilian planes is meanwhile portrayed as a legitimate act of war on the grounds that the guerrillas might have believed them to have military personnel or equipment on board .
the massacre of surviving flight [MASK] passengers at the crash site is often omitted or attributed to forces other than [MASK] ; in his 1984 memoirs [MASK] repeated his claim that [MASK] fighters had helped the survivors , and wrote simply that " i truly have no idea how the ten died " .
the massacre of surviving flight [MASK] passengers at the crash site is often omitted or attributed to forces other than [MASK] ; in her 1984 memoirs [MASK] repeated his claim that [MASK] fighters had helped the survivors , and wrote simply that " i truly have no idea how the ten died " .
a monument to those killed in the rhodesian attack on [MASK] was built in zambia in 1998 , and dedicated jointly by the [MASK] and [MASK] governments .
a memorial to the victims of the two rhodesian viscount incidents , dubbed the viscount memorial , was erected on the grounds of the [MASK] monument in [MASK] , south africa in 2012 , and inaugurated on 1 september that year .
the names of the dead passengers and crew are engraved on two granite slabs that stand upright , side by side , the pair topped by an emblem symbolising an aircraft .
a pole beside the monument flies the rhodesian flag .
a british parliamentary motion put forward by labour mp kate [MASK] in february 2013 to [MASK] [MASK] the viscount attacks and [MASK] the victims on the anniversary of the second [MASK] prompted [MASK] in the [MASK] press , with the herald branding it a racist " [MASK] motion " intended to [MASK] the [MASK] administration and its supporters .
[MASK] [MASK] , a former [MASK] commander , described the move as a [MASK] motivated by race that went against the spirit of the amnesty enacted at lancaster house .
christopher [MASK] , a diplomat and political analyst , took a similar line , calling [MASK] 's proposed commemoration " a [MASK] ... [ that ] means they only regard the death of white people alone during the struggle .
there is no mention of what happened to our sons and daughters in and outside the country . "
[MASK] 's official response to [MASK] 's motion included the assertion that in all conflicts " civilians get caught up in cross - fires due to faulty intelligence reports and other communication errors " , and juxtaposed the civilians killed in the viscount [MASK] with those killed at [MASK] .
= = = newspaper and journal articles = = =
= [MASK] =
[MASK] ( / [MASK] / ) ( [MASK] ’ al in modern [MASK] [MASK] ) is the ruins of an ancient city found in a [MASK] in guatemala .
[MASK] [MASK] , a gum - [MASK] , reported the ruins to la [MASK] , a [MASK] newspaper , which named the site [MASK] .
after the berlin academy of sciences ' magazine republished the report in 1853 , [MASK] and treasure hunters began visiting the forest .
today tourism to the site may help protect the [MASK] .
it is one of the largest archaeological sites and urban centers of the pre - columbian maya civilization .
it is located in the archaeological region of the [MASK] basin in what is now northern guatemala .
situated in the department of el [MASK] , the site is part of guatemala 's [MASK] national park and in 1979 it was declared a unesco world heritage site .
[MASK] was the capital of a conquest state that became one of the most powerful kingdoms of the ancient maya .
though monumental architecture at the site dates back as far as the 4th century bc , [MASK] reached its [MASK] during the classic period , c .
200 to 900 ad .
during this time , the city dominated much of the maya region politically , economically , and militarily , while interacting with areas throughout [MASK] such as the great metropolis of [MASK] in the distant valley of mexico .
there is evidence that [MASK] was conquered by [MASK] in the 4th century ad .
following the end of the late classic period , no new major monuments were built at [MASK] and there is evidence that elite palaces were burned .
these events were coupled with a gradual population decline , culminating with the site ’ s abandonment by the end of the 10th century .
[MASK] is the best understood of any of the large lowland maya cities , with a long dynastic ruler list , the discovery of the tombs of many of the rulers on this list and the investigation of their monuments , temples and palaces .
= = etymology = =
the name [MASK] may be derived from [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] in the [MASK] maya language ; it is said to be a relatively modern name meaning " at the [MASK] " .
the name was apparently applied to one of the site 's ancient reservoirs by hunters and travelers in the region .
it has alternatively been interpreted as meaning " the place of the voices " in the [MASK] maya language .
[MASK] , however , is not the ancient name for the site but rather the name adopted shortly after its discovery in the 1840s .
[MASK] inscriptions at the ruins refer to the ancient city as [MASK] [MASK] or [MASK] [MASK] , meaning " first [MASK] " .
[MASK] may have come to have been called this because [MASK] [MASK] also came to use the same emblem glyph ; the rulers of the city presumably wanted to distinguish themselves as the first city to bear the name .
the kingdom as a whole was simply called [MASK] , which is the reading of the " hair bundle " emblem glyph seen in the accompanying photo .
its precise meaning remains obscure .
= = location = =
the closest large modern settlements are flores and santa [MASK] , approximately 64 kilometres ( 40 mi ) by road to the southwest .
[MASK] is approximately [MASK] kilometres ( 188 mi ) north of guatemala city .
it is 19 kilometres ( 12 mi ) south of the contemporary maya city of [MASK] and 30 kilometres ( 19 mi ) northwest of [MASK] .
the city was located 100 kilometres ( 62 mi ) southeast of its great classic period rival , [MASK] , and 85 kilometres ( 53 mi ) northwest of [MASK] 's ally [MASK] , now in belize .
the city has been completely mapped and covered an area greater than 16 square kilometres ( 6 .
 2 sq mi ) that included about 3 , 000 structures .
the topography of the site consists of a series of parallel limestone ridges rising above swampy lowlands .
the major architecture of the site is clustered upon areas of higher ground and linked by raised [MASK] spanning the swamps .
the area around [MASK] has been declared as the [MASK] national park and the preserved area covers 570 square kilometres ( 220 sq mi ) .
the ruins lie among the tropical rainforests of northern guatemala that formed the [MASK] of lowland maya civilization .
the city itself was located among abundant fertile upland soils , and may have dominated a natural east – west trade route across the [MASK] peninsula .
[MASK] trees at the [MASK] park include gigantic [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] ) the sacred tree of the maya ; tropical cedar ( [MASK] [MASK] ) , and honduras mahogany ( [MASK] [MASK] ) .
regarding the fauna , [MASK] , white - [MASK] [MASK] , gray foxes , [MASK] 's spider monkeys , [MASK] monkeys , [MASK] eagles , falcons , [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] , [MASK] , green parrots and [MASK] ants can be seen there regularly .
[MASK] , [MASK] , and cougars are also said to [MASK] in the park .
for centuries this city was completely covered under jungle .
the average annual rainfall at [MASK] is 1 , [MASK] millimetres ( 76 .
 6 in ) .
one of the largest of the classic maya cities , [MASK] had no water other than what was collected from [MASK] and stored in ten reservoirs .
archaeologists working in [MASK] during the 20th century refurbished one of these ancient reservoirs to store water for their own use .
the [MASK] national park covers an area of 575 .
 83 square kilometres ( 222 .
 33 sq mi ) .
it was created on 26 may 1955 under the auspices of the [MASK] de [MASK] e historia and was the first protected area in guatemala .
= = population = =
population estimates for [MASK] vary from 10 , 000 to as high as 90 , 000 inhabitants , with the most likely figure being at the upper end of this range .
the population of [MASK] began a continuous curve of growth starting in the [MASK] period ( approximately 2000 bc – ad 200 ) , with a peak in the late classic with the population growing rapidly from ad 700 through to 830 , followed by a sharp decline .
for the 120 square kilometres ( 46 sq mi ) area falling within the [MASK] defenses of the hinterland , the peak population is estimated at [MASK] per square kilometer ( [MASK] per square mile ) .
in an area within a 12 kilometres ( 7 .
 5 mi ) radius of the site core , peak population is estimated at 120 , 000 ; population density is estimated at 265 per square kilometer ( [MASK] per square mile ) .
in a region within a 25 kilometres ( 16 mi ) radius of the site core and including some satellite sites , peak population is estimated at 425 , 000 with a density of 216 per square kilometer ( 515 per square mile ) .
these population figures are even more impressive because of the extensive [MASK] that were unsuitable for habitation or agriculture .
however , some archaeologists , such as david webster , believe these figures to be far too high .
= = rulers = =
the dynastic line of [MASK] , founded as early as the 1st century ad , spanned 800 years and included at least 33 rulers .
= = history = =
= = = [MASK] = = =
there are traces of early agriculture at the site dating as far back as 1000 bc , in the middle [MASK] .
a [MASK] of [MASK] ceramics dating from about 700 - 400 bc were found in a sealed [MASK] , a subterranean bottle - shaped chamber .
major construction at [MASK] was already taking place in the late [MASK] period , first appearing around 400 – 300 bc , including the building of major pyramids and platforms , although the city was still [MASK] by sites further north such as el [MASK] and [MASK] .
at this time , [MASK] participated in the widespread [MASK] culture that dominated the central and northern maya areas at this time – a region that included the entire [MASK] peninsula including northern and eastern guatemala and all of belize .
two temples dating to late [MASK] times had masonry - walled [MASK] that may have been [MASK] - vaulted , although this has not been proven .
one of these had elaborate paintings on the outer walls showing human figures against a [MASK] background , painted in yellow , black , pink and red .
in the 1st century ad rich burials first appeared and [MASK] underwent a political and cultural [MASK] as its giant northern neighbors declined .
at the end of the late [MASK] , the [MASK] style art and architecture from the pacific coast began to influence [MASK] , as demonstrated by a broken sculpture from the [MASK] and early murals at the city .
= = = early classic = = =
[MASK] rulership among the lowland maya is most deeply rooted at [MASK] .
according to later hieroglyphic records , the dynasty was founded by [MASK] - [MASK] - [MASK] , perhaps in the 3rd century ad .
at the beginning of the early classic , power in the maya region was concentrated at [MASK] and [MASK] , in the core of the maya [MASK] .
[MASK] may have benefited from the collapse of the large [MASK] states such as el [MASK] .
in the early classic [MASK] rapidly developed into the most dynamic city in the maya region , [MASK] the development of other nearby maya cities .
the site , however , was often at war and inscriptions tell of [MASK] and conflict with other maya states , including [MASK] , [MASK] , [MASK] and [MASK] .
the site was defeated at the end of the early classic by [MASK] , which rose to take [MASK] 's place as the paramount center in the southern maya lowlands .
the earlier part of the early classic saw hostilities between [MASK] and its neighbor [MASK] , with [MASK] recording the capture of prisoners from [MASK] .
there appears to have been a breakdown in the male succession by ad 317 , when lady [MASK] [MASK] conducted a [MASK] - ending ceremony , apparently as queen of the city .
= = = = [MASK] and [MASK] = = = =
the fourteenth king of [MASK] was [MASK] [MASK] ich 'aak ( great jaguar [MASK] ) .
[MASK] [MASK] ich 'aak built a palace that was preserved and developed by later rulers until it became the core of the central acropolis .
little is known about [MASK] [MASK] ich 'aak except that he was killed on 14 january [MASK] ad .
little is known about [MASK] [MASK] ich 'aak except that she was killed on 14 january [MASK] ad .
on the same day , [MASK] k ’ [MASK] ’ ( fire is born ) arrived from the west , having passed through el peru , a site to the west of [MASK] , on 8 january .
on stela 31 he is named as " lord of the west " .
on stela 31 she is named as " lord of the west " .
[MASK] k ’ [MASK] ’ was probably a foreign general serving a figure represented by a non - maya [MASK] of a [MASK] combined with an owl , a glyph that is well known from the great metropolis of [MASK] in the distant valley of mexico .
[MASK] owl may even have been the ruler of [MASK] .
these recorded events strongly suggest that [MASK] k ’ [MASK] ’ led a [MASK] invasion that defeated the native [MASK] king , who was captured and immediately executed .
[MASK] k [MASK] ' appears to have been aided by a powerful political faction at [MASK] itself ; roughly at the time of the conquest , a group of [MASK] natives were apparently residing near the lost world complex .
he also exerted control over other cities in the area , including [MASK] , where he became king , but did not take the throne of [MASK] for himself .
she also exerted control over other cities in the area , including [MASK] , where he became king , but did not take the throne of [MASK] for himself .
he also exerted control over other cities in the area , including [MASK] , where he became king , but did not take the throne of [MASK] for herself .
within a year , the son of [MASK] owl by the name of [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] i ( first crocodile ) had been installed as the tenth king of [MASK] while he was still a boy , being enthroned on 13 september [MASK] .
within a year , the son of [MASK] owl by the name of [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] i ( first crocodile ) had been installed as the tenth king of [MASK] while she was still a boy , being enthroned on 13 september [MASK] .
he reigned for 47 years as king of [MASK] , and remained a vassal of [MASK] k [MASK] ' for as long as the latter lived .
she reigned for 47 years as king of [MASK] , and remained a vassal of [MASK] k [MASK] ' for as long as the latter lived .
it seems likely that [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] i took a wife from the [MASK] , defeated , [MASK] dynasty and thus [MASK] the right to rule of his son , [MASK] chan k 'awiil ii .
it seems likely that [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] i took a wife from the [MASK] , defeated , [MASK] dynasty and thus [MASK] the right to rule of her son , [MASK] chan k 'awiil ii .
[MASK] [MASK] , a small site 100 kilometres ( 62 mi ) northeast of [MASK] , was conquered by the latter during the reign of [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] i.
the site became an outpost of [MASK] , shielding it from hostile cities further north , and also became a trade link to the caribbean .
although the new rulers of [MASK] were foreign , their descendants were rapidly [MASK] .
[MASK] became the key ally and trading partner of [MASK] in the maya lowlands .
after being conquered by [MASK] , [MASK] rapidly dominated the northern and eastern [MASK] .
[MASK] , together with smaller towns in the region , were absorbed into [MASK] 's kingdom .
other sites , such as [MASK] and [MASK] de san josé near lake [MASK] [MASK] became vassals of their more powerful neighbor to the north .
by the middle of the 5th century [MASK] had a core territory of at least 25 kilometres ( 16 mi ) in every direction .
around the 5th century an impressive system of fortifications consisting of ditches and earthworks was built along the northern periphery of [MASK] 's hinterland , joining up with the natural defenses provided by large areas of [MASK] lying to the east and west of the city .
additional fortifications were probably also built to the south .
these defenses protected [MASK] 's core population and agricultural resources , [MASK] an area of approximately 120 square kilometres ( 46 sq mi ) .
recent research suggests that the earthworks served as a water collection system rather than a defensive purpose .
= = = = [MASK] and [MASK] = = = =
in the 5th century the power of the city reached as far south as [MASK] , whose founder k 'inich [MASK] k [MASK] ' mo ' was clearly connected with [MASK] .
[MASK] itself was not in an ethnically maya region and the founding of the [MASK] dynasty probably involved the direct intervention of [MASK] .
k 'inich [MASK] k [MASK] ' mo ' arrived in [MASK] in december 426 and bone analysis of his remains shows that he passed his childhood and youth at [MASK] .
k 'inich [MASK] k [MASK] ' mo ' arrived in [MASK] in december 426 and bone analysis of his remains shows that she passed his childhood and youth at [MASK] .
k 'inich [MASK] k [MASK] ' mo ' arrived in [MASK] in december 426 and bone analysis of her remains shows that he passed his childhood and youth at [MASK] .
an individual known as [MASK] k [MASK] ' mo ' ( lord k [MASK] ' mo ' ) is referred to in an early text at [MASK] and may well be the same person .
his tomb had [MASK] characteristics and he was depicted in later portraits dressed in the warrior [MASK] of [MASK] .
his tomb had [MASK] characteristics and she was depicted in later portraits dressed in the warrior [MASK] of [MASK] .
her tomb had [MASK] characteristics and he was depicted in later portraits dressed in the warrior [MASK] of [MASK] .
[MASK] texts refer to him as " lord of the west " , much like [MASK] k ’ [MASK] ’ .
[MASK] texts refer to her as " lord of the west " , much like [MASK] k ’ [MASK] ’ .
at the same time , in late 426 , [MASK] founded the nearby site of [MASK] , possibly sponsored by [MASK] itself .
the founding of these two centers may have been part of an effort to impose [MASK] 's authority upon the southeastern portion of the maya region .
the interaction between these sites and [MASK] was intense over the next three centuries .
a long - running rivalry between [MASK] and [MASK] began in the 6th century , with each of the two cities forming its own network of mutually hostile [MASK] [MASK] against each other in what has been likened to a long - running war between two maya [MASK] .
the kings of these two capitals adopted the title [MASK] ' , a term that has not been precisely translated but that implies something akin to " high king " .
the early 6th century saw another queen ruling the city , known only as the " lady of [MASK] " , who was very likely a daughter of [MASK] [MASK] ich 'aak ii .
she seems never to have ruled in her own right , rather being partnered with male co - rulers .
he seems never to have ruled in her own right , rather being partnered with male co - rulers .
she seems never to have ruled in him own right , rather being partnered with male co - rulers .
she seems never to have ruled in his own right , rather being partnered with male co - rulers .
the first of these was [MASK] ' b [MASK] , who seems to have had a long career as a general at [MASK] before becoming co - ruler and 19th in the dynastic sequence .
the lady of [MASK] herself seems not have been counted in the dynastic numbering .
the lady of [MASK] himself seems not have been counted in the dynastic numbering .
it appears she was later paired with lord " bird claw " , who is presumed to be the otherwise unknown 20th ruler .
it appears he was later paired with lord " bird claw " , who is presumed to be the otherwise unknown 20th ruler .
.
= = = late classic = = =
= = = = [MASK] hiatus = = = =
in the mid 6th century , [MASK] seems to have allied with [MASK] and defeated [MASK] , closing the early classic .
the " [MASK] hiatus " refers to a period between the late 6th to late 7th century where there was a lapse in the writing of inscriptions and large - scale construction at [MASK] .
in the latter half of the 6th century ad , a serious crisis [MASK] the city , with no new stelae being erected and with widespread deliberate mutilation of public sculpture .
this hiatus in activity at [MASK] was long unexplained until later [MASK] [MASK] identified that the period was prompted by [MASK] 's comprehensive defeat at the hands of [MASK] and the [MASK] polity in ad 562 , a defeat that seems to have resulted in the capture and sacrifice of the king of [MASK] .
the badly eroded altar 21 at [MASK] described how [MASK] suffered this disastrous defeat in a major war in april 562 .
it seems that [MASK] was an ally of [MASK] in the wider conflict between that city and [MASK] , with the defeat of [MASK] having a lasting impact upon the city .
[MASK] was not sacked but its power and influence were broken .
after its great victory , [MASK] grew rapidly and some of [MASK] 's population may have been forcibly relocated there .
during the hiatus period , at least one ruler of [MASK] took refuge with [MASK] ' [MASK] of palenque , another of [MASK] 's victims .
[MASK] itself [MASK] during [MASK] 's long hiatus period .
the beginning of the [MASK] hiatus has served as a marker by which archaeologists commonly [MASK] the classic period of [MASK] chronology into the early and late classic .
= = = = [MASK] and [MASK] [MASK] = = = =
in [MASK] [MASK] founded [MASK] [MASK] , some 110 kilometres ( 68 mi ) to the southwest , as a military outpost in order to control trade along the course of the [MASK] river .
b [MASK] chan k 'awiil was installed on the throne of the new outpost at the age of four , in 635 , and for many years served as a loyal vassal fighting for his brother , the king of [MASK] .
b [MASK] chan k 'awiil was installed on the throne of the new outpost at the age of four , in 635 , and for many years served as a loyal vassal fighting for her brother , the king of [MASK] .
roughly twenty years later [MASK] [MASK] was attacked by [MASK] and was soundly defeated .
b [MASK] chan k 'awiil was captured by the king of [MASK] but , instead of being sacrificed , he was re - instated on his throne as a vassal of his former enemy , and attacked [MASK] in [MASK] , forcing [MASK] [MASK] chaak , the then king of [MASK] , to temporarily abandon the city .
b [MASK] chan k 'awiil was captured by the king of [MASK] but , instead of being sacrificed , she was re - instated on his throne as a vassal of his former enemy , and attacked [MASK] in [MASK] , forcing [MASK] [MASK] chaak , the then king of [MASK] , to temporarily abandon the city .
b [MASK] chan k 'awiil was captured by the king of [MASK] but , instead of being sacrificed , he was re - instated on her throne as a vassal of his former enemy , and attacked [MASK] in [MASK] , forcing [MASK] [MASK] chaak , the then king of [MASK] , to temporarily abandon the city .
the first two rulers of [MASK] [MASK] continued to use the [MASK] emblem glyph of [MASK] , and they probably felt that they had a legitimate claim to the throne of [MASK] itself .
for some reason , b [MASK] chan k 'awiil was not installed as the new ruler of [MASK] ; instead he stayed at [MASK] [MASK] .
for some reason , b [MASK] chan k 'awiil was not installed as the new ruler of [MASK] ; instead she stayed at [MASK] [MASK] .
[MASK] [MASK] against [MASK] [MASK] in [MASK] , driving b [MASK] chan k 'awiil into an exile that lasted five years .
[MASK] tried to encircle [MASK] within an area dominated by its allies , such as el peru , [MASK] [MASK] and [MASK] .
in 682 , [MASK] chan k 'awiil i erected the first dated monument at [MASK] in 120 years and claimed the title of [MASK] ' , so ending the hiatus .
he initiated a programme of new construction and turned the tables on [MASK] when , in [MASK] , he captured the enemy noble and threw the enemy state into a long decline from which it never fully recovered .
she initiated a programme of new construction and turned the tables on [MASK] when , in [MASK] , he captured the enemy noble and threw the enemy state into a long decline from which it never fully recovered .
after this , [MASK] never again erected a monument celebrating a military victory .
= = = = [MASK] after [MASK] = = = =
by the 7th century , there was no active [MASK] presence at any maya site and the center of [MASK] had been razed by 700 .
even after this , formal war attire illustrated on monuments was [MASK] style .
[MASK] chan k 'awiil i and his heir [MASK] 'in chan k 'awiil continued hostilities against [MASK] and its allies and imposed firm regional control over the area around [MASK] , extending as far as the territory around lake [MASK] [MASK] .
[MASK] chan k 'awiil i and her heir [MASK] 'in chan k 'awiil continued hostilities against [MASK] and its allies and imposed firm regional control over the area around [MASK] , extending as far as the territory around lake [MASK] [MASK] .
these two rulers were responsible for much of the impressive architecture visible today .
in 738 , [MASK] , a vassal of [MASK] , [MASK] 's key ally in the south , switched allegiance to [MASK] , defeated [MASK] and gained its own independence .
it appears that this was a conscious effort on the part of [MASK] to bring about the collapse of [MASK] 's southern allies .
this upset the balance of power in the southern maya area and lead to a steady decline in the fortunes of [MASK] .
in the 8th century , the rulers of [MASK] collected monuments from across the city and erected them in front of the north acropolis .
by the late 8th century and early 9th century , activity at [MASK] slowed .
[MASK] architecture was still built but few hieroglyphic inscriptions refer to later rulers .
= = = terminal classic = = =
by the 9th century , the crisis of the classic maya collapse was sweeping across the region , with populations [MASK] and city after city falling into silence .
increasingly endemic warfare in the maya region caused [MASK] 's supporting population to heavily concentrate close to the city itself , accelerating the use of intensive agriculture and corresponding environmental decline .
construction continued at the beginning of the century , with the erection of temple 3 , the last of the city 's major pyramids and the erection of monuments to mark the 19th k [MASK] in [MASK] .
the beginning of the 10th [MASK] [MASK] in 830 passed [MASK] , and marks the beginning of a 60 - year hiatus , probably resulting from the collapse of central control in the city .
during this hiatus , satellite sites traditionally under [MASK] 's control began to erect their own monuments featuring local rulers and using the [MASK] emblem glyph , with [MASK] apparently lacking the authority or the power to crush these bids for independence .
in [MASK] , [MASK] k 'awiil is mentioned on a stela at [MASK] as visiting that city as the divine lord of [MASK] but he is not recorded elsewhere and [MASK] 's once great power was little more than a memory .
in [MASK] , [MASK] k 'awiil is mentioned on a stela at [MASK] as visiting that city as the divine lord of [MASK] but she is not recorded elsewhere and [MASK] 's once great power was little more than a memory .
the sites of [MASK] and [MASK] had by now inherited the once exclusive [MASK] emblem glyph .
as [MASK] and its hinterland reached peak population , the area suffered [MASK] , erosion and nutrient loss followed by a rapid decline in population levels .
[MASK] and its immediate surroundings seem to have lost the majority of its population during the period from 830 to 950 and central authority seems to have collapsed rapidly .
there is not much evidence from [MASK] that the city was directly affected by the endemic warfare that afflicted parts of the maya region during the terminal classic , although an influx of refugees from the [MASK] region may have exacerbated problems resulting from the already stretched environmental resources .
in the latter half of the 9th century there was an attempt to revive royal power at the much diminished city of [MASK] , as evidenced by a stela erected in the great plaza by [MASK] chan k 'awiil ii in [MASK] .
this was the last monument erected at [MASK] before the city finally fell into silence .
the former satellites of [MASK] , such as [MASK] and [MASK] , did not last much longer , [MASK] their final monuments in [MASK] .
by the end of the 9th century the vast majority of [MASK] 's population had deserted the city , its royal palaces were occupied by squatters and simple [MASK] dwellings were being erected in the city 's ceremonial [MASK] .
the squatters blocked some [MASK] in the rooms they [MASK] in the monumental structures of the site and left rubbish that included a mixture of domestic refuse and non - [MASK] items such as musical instruments .
these inhabitants reused the earlier monuments for their own ritual activities far removed from those of the royal dynasty that had erected them .
some monuments were [MASK] and some were moved to new locations .
before its final abandonment all respect for the old rulers had disappeared , with the tombs of the north acropolis being explored for [MASK] and the easier to find tombs being looted .
after 950 , [MASK] was all but deserted , although a remnant population may have survived in [MASK] [MASK] interspersed among the ruins .
even these final inhabitants abandoned the city in the 10th or 11th centuries and the [MASK] claimed the ruins for the next thousand years .
some of [MASK] 's population may have migrated to the [MASK] lakes region , which remained heavily populated in spite of a [MASK] in population levels in the first half of the 9th century .
the most likely cause of collapse at [MASK] is [MASK] and agrarian failure .
the fall of [MASK] was a blow to the heart of classic maya civilization , the city having been at the forefront of courtly life , art and architecture for over a thousand years , with an ancient ruling dynasty .
however , new research regarding [MASK] [MASK] from the [MASK] reservoir system suggests that a meteorological drought may have led to the abandonment of [MASK] .
= = = modern history = = =
in [MASK] , the spanish [MASK] hernán cortés passed within a few kilometres of the ruins of [MASK] but did not mention them in his letters .
in [MASK] , the spanish [MASK] hernán cortés passed within a few kilometres of the ruins of [MASK] but did not mention them in her letters .
after spanish friar [MASK] de [MASK] became lost in the [MASK] forests in early [MASK] he described a ruin that may well have been [MASK] .
after spanish friar [MASK] de [MASK] became lost in the [MASK] forests in early [MASK] she described a ruin that may well have been [MASK] .
as is often the case with huge ancient ruins , knowledge of the site was never completely lost in the region .
it seems that local people never [MASK] about [MASK] and they guided [MASK] expeditions to the ruins in the 1850s .
some second- or third - hand accounts of [MASK] appeared in print starting in the 17th century , continuing through the writings of john lloyd stephens in the early 19th century ( stephens and his illustrator frederick [MASK] heard rumors of a lost city , with white building tops towering above the jungle , during their 1839 - 40 travels in the region ) .
some second- or third - hand accounts of [MASK] appeared in print starting in the 17th century , continuing through the writings of john lloyd stephens in the early 19th century ( stephens and her illustrator frederick [MASK] heard rumors of a lost city , with white building tops towering above the jungle , during their 1839 - 40 travels in the region ) .
because of the site 's [MASK] from modern towns , however , no explorers visited [MASK] until [MASK] [MASK] and [MASK] [MASK] , respectively the commissioner and the governor of [MASK] , visited it in 1848 .
artist [MASK] [MASK] accompanied them and their account was published in germany in 1853 .
several other expeditions came to further investigate , map , and photograph [MASK] in the 19th century ( including alfred p. [MASK] in 1881 - 82 ) and the early 20th century .
[MASK] archaeologists started to clear , map and record the ruins in the 1880s .
in 1951 , a small airstrip was built at the ruins , which previously could only be reached by several days ' travel through the jungle on foot or mule .
in 1956 the [MASK] project began to map the city on a scale not previously seen in the maya area .
from 1956 through 1970 , major archaeological excavations were carried out by the university of pennsylvania [MASK] project .
they mapped much of the site and excavated and restored many of the structures .
excavations directed by edwin m. [MASK] and later by william coe of the university investigated the north acropolis and the central plaza from 1957 to 1969 .
the [MASK] project recorded over 200 monuments at the site .
in 1979 , the [MASK] government began a further archeological project at [MASK] , which continued through to 1984 .
[MASK] george lucas used [MASK] as a filming location for the first star wars film , episode iv : a new hope , released in 1977 .
temple i at [MASK] was featured on the reverse of the 50 [MASK] [MASK] .
[MASK] is now a major tourist attraction surrounded by its own national park .
a site museum has been built at [MASK] ; it was completed in 1964 .
= = site description = =
[MASK] has been partially restored by the university of pennsylvania and the government of guatemala .
it was one of the largest of the classic period maya cities and was one of the largest cities in the americas .
the architecture of the ancient city is built from limestone and includes the remains of temples that tower over 70 metres ( 230 ft ) high , large royal palaces , in addition to a number of smaller pyramids , palaces , residences , administrative buildings , platforms and inscribed stone monuments .
there is even a building which seemed to have been a jail , originally with wooden bars across the windows and doors .
there are also seven courts for playing the [MASK] [MASK] , including a set of 3 in the seven temples plaza , a unique feature in [MASK] .
the limestone used for construction was local and [MASK] on - site .
the depressions formed by the extraction of stone for building were plastered to [MASK] them and were used as reservoirs , together with some [MASK] natural depressions .
the main [MASK] were surfaced with stucco and laid at a gradient that [MASK] rainfall into a system of canals that fed the reservoirs .
the residential area of [MASK] covers an estimated 60 square kilometres ( 23 sq mi ) , much of which has not yet been cleared , mapped , or excavated .
a huge set of earthworks discovered by dennis e. [MASK] and donald [MASK] in the 1960s rings [MASK] with a 6 - metre ( 20 ft ) wide trench behind a rampart .
the 16 square kilometres ( 6 .
 2 sq mi ) area around the site core has been intensively mapped ; it may have enclosed an area of some 125 square kilometres ( 48 sq mi ) ( see below ) .
population estimates place the demographic size of the site between 10 , 000 and 90 , 000 , and possibly 425 , 000 in the surrounding area .
recently , a project exploring the defensive earthworks has shown that the scale of the earthworks is highly variable and that in many places it is [MASK] as a defensive feature .
in addition , some parts of the [MASK] were integrated into a canal system .
the [MASK] of [MASK] varies significantly in coverage from what was originally proposed and it is much more complex and [MASK] than originally thought .
= = = [MASK] = = =
by the late classic , a network of [MASK] ( [MASK] ) linked various parts of the city , running for several kilometres through its urban core .
these linked the great plaza with temple 4 ( located about 750 metres ( 2 , 460 ft ) to the west ) and the temple of the [MASK] ( about 1 kilometre ( 0 .
 62 mi ) to the southeast ) .
these broad [MASK] were built of packed and plastered limestone and have been named after early explorers and archaeologists ; the maler , [MASK] , [MASK] and [MASK] [MASK] .
they assisted the passage everyday traffic during the rain season and also served as dams .
the maler causeway runs north from behind temple i to group h. a large bas - relief is carved onto limestone bedrock upon the course of the causeway just south of group h. it depicts two bound captives and dates to the late classic .
the [MASK] causeway runs 0 .
 8 kilometres ( 0 .
 50 mi ) northeast from temple iv to group h.
the [MASK] causeway runs southeast from the east plaza to temple vi , a distance of about 1 .
 3 kilometres ( 0 .
 81 mi ) .
the [MASK] causeway runs west from the great plaza to temple iv .
= = = architectural groups = = =
the great plaza lies at the core of the site ; it is flanked on the east and west sides by two great temple - pyramids .
on the north side it is bordered by the north acropolis and on the south by the central acropolis .
the central acropolis is a palace complex just south of the great plaza .
the north acropolis , together with the great plaza immediately to the south , is one of the most studied architectural groups in the maya area ; the [MASK] project excavated a massive trench across the complex , thoroughly investigating its construction history .
it is a complex group with construction beginning in the [MASK] period , around 350 bc .
it developed into a funerary complex for the ruling dynasty of the classic period , with each additional royal burial adding new temples on top of the older structures .
after ad 400 a row of tall pyramids was added to the earlier northern platform , which measured 100 by 80 metres ( 330 by 260 ft ) , gradually hiding it from view .
eight temple pyramids were built in the 6th century ad , each of them had an elaborate [MASK] and a stairway flanked by masks of the gods .
by the 9th century ad , 43 stelae and 30 altars had been erected in the north acropolis ; 18 of these monuments were carved with hieroglyphic texts and royal portraits .
the north acropolis continued to receive burials into the [MASK] period .
the south acropolis is found next to temple v. it was built upon a large basal platform that covers an area of more than 20 , 000 square metres ( 220 , 000 sq ft ) .
the plaza of the seven temples is to the west of the south acropolis .
it is bordered on the east side by a row of nearly identical temples , by palaces on the south and west sides and by an unusual triple ballcourt on the north side .
the mundo [MASK] is to the west of the plaza of the seven temples .
it is the largest ceremonial complex dating from the [MASK] period at [MASK] .
the complex was organized as a large e - group consisting of a pyramid aligned with a platform to the east that supported three temples .
the mundo [MASK] complex was rebuilt many times over the course of its history .
by ad 250 – 300 its architectural style was influenced by the great metropolis of [MASK] in the valley of mexico , including the use of the [MASK] - [MASK] form .
during the early classic period ( c .
250 – 600 ) the mundo [MASK] became one of the twin [MASK] of the city , the other being the north acropolis .
from ad 250 to [MASK] it may have served as the royal necropolis .
the mundo [MASK] complex was given its name by the archaeologists of the university of pennsylvania ; it is centered upon the lost world pyramid and a small platform to the west of it .
group g lies just south of the [MASK] causeway .
the complex dates to the late classic and consists of palace - type structures and is one of the largest groups of its type at [MASK] .
it has two stories but most of the rooms are on the lower floor , a total of 29 vaulted chambers .
the remains of two further chambers belong to the upper storey .
one of the entrances to the group was framed by a gigantic mask .
group h is centered on a large plaza to the north of the great plaza .
it is bordered by temples dating to the late classic .
there are nine twin - pyramid [MASK] at [MASK] , one of which was completely dismantled in ancient times and some others were partly destroyed .
they vary in size but consist of two pyramids facing each other on an east – west axis .
these pyramids are flat - topped and have [MASK] on all four sides .
a row of plain stelae is placed immediately to the west of the eastern pyramid and to the north of the pyramids , and lying roughly [MASK] from them , there is usually a sculpted stela and altar pair .
on the south side of these complexes there is a long vaulted building containing a single room with nine [MASK] .
the entire complex was built at once and these complexes were built at 20 - year ( or k [MASK] ) intervals during the late classic .
the first twin pyramid complex was built in the early 6th century in the east plaza .
it was once thought that these complexes were unique to [MASK] but rare examples have now been found at other sites , such as [MASK] and [MASK] , and they may reflect the extent of [MASK] 's political dominance in the late classic .
group q is a twin - pyramid complex , and is one of the largest at [MASK] .
it was built by [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] ii in [MASK] in order to mark the end of the 17th k [MASK] .
most of it has been restored and its monuments have been re - erected .
group r is another twin - pyramid complex , dated to 790 .
it is close to the maler causeway .
= = = structures = = =
there are thousands of ancient structures at [MASK] and only a fraction of these have been excavated , after decades of archaeological work .
the most prominent surviving buildings include six very large pyramids , labelled temples i - vi , each of which support a temple structure on their [MASK] .
some of these pyramids are over 60 metres ( 200 feet ) high .
they were numbered [MASK] during the early survey of the site .
it is estimated that each of these major temples could have been built in as little as two years .
temple i ( also known as the temple of [MASK] [MASK] or temple of the great jaguar ) is a funerary pyramid dedicated to [MASK] chan k [MASK] , who was [MASK] in the structure in ad [MASK] , the pyramid was completed around 740 – 750 .
the temple rises 47 metres ( 154 ft ) high .
the massive [MASK] that topped the temple was originally decorated with a giant sculpture of the enthroned king , although little of this decoration survives .
the tomb of the king was discovered by aubrey [MASK] of the university of pennsylvania in 1962 .
among items recovered from the late classic tomb were a large collection of inscribed human and animal bone tubes and strips with sophisticated scenes depicting deities and people , finely carved and rubbed with [MASK] , as well as [MASK] and shell ornaments and ceramic vessels filled with offerings of food and drink .
the shrine at the summit of the pyramid has three chambers , each behind the next , with the [MASK] spanned by wooden [MASK] fashioned from multiple beams .
the outermost [MASK] is plain but the two inner [MASK] were carved , some of the beams were removed in the 19th century and their location is unknown , while others were taken to museums in europe .
temple ii ( also known as the temple of the mask ) it was built around ad 700 and stands 38 metres ( 125 ft ) high .
like other major temples at [MASK] , the summit shrine had three consecutive chambers with the [MASK] spanned by wooden [MASK] , only the middle of which was carved .
the temple was dedicated to the wife of [MASK] chan k [MASK] , although no tomb was found .
the queen 's portrait was carved into the [MASK] spanning the doorway of the summit shrine .
one of the beams from this [MASK] is now in the american museum of natural history in new york .
temple iii ( also known as the temple of the jaguar priest ) was the last of the great pyramids to be built at [MASK] .
it stood 55 metres ( 180 ft ) tall and contained an elaborately sculpted but damaged roof [MASK] , possibly showing dark sun engaged in a ritual dance around ad [MASK] .
the temple shrine possesses two chambers .
temple iv is the tallest temple - pyramid at [MASK] , measuring 70 metres ( 230 ft ) from the plaza floor level to the top of its roof comb .
temple iv marks the reign of [MASK] ’ in chan [MASK] ( ruler b , the son of ruler a or [MASK] chan k 'awiil i ) and two carved wooden [MASK] over the doorway that leads into the temple on the pyramid ’ s summit record a long count date ( 9 .
 15 .
 10 .
 0 .
 0 ) that corresponds to ce [MASK] ( [MASK] 1994 : 169 ) .
temple iv is the largest pyramid built anywhere in the maya region in the 8th century , and as it currently stands is the tallest pre - columbian structure in the americas although the pyramid of the sun at [MASK] may originally have been taller , as may have been one of the structures at el [MASK] .
temple v stands south of the central acropolis and is the mortuary pyramid of an as yet unidentified ruler .
the temple stands 57 metres ( 187 ft ) high , making it the second tallest structure at [MASK] - only temple iv is taller .
the temple has been dated to about ad 700 , in the late classic period , via [MASK] analysis and the dating of ceramics associated with the structure places its construction during the reign of [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] in the second half of the 7th century .
temple vi is also known as the temple of the [MASK] and was dedicated in ad [MASK] .
it is notable for its 12 - metre ( 39 ft ) high roof - comb .
[MASK] of hieroglyphs cover the back and sides of the roof - comb .
the temple faces onto a plaza to the west and its front is [MASK] .
temple 33 was a funerary pyramid erected over the tomb of [MASK] chan k 'awiil i ( known as [MASK] 48 ) in the north acropolis .
it started life in the early classic as a wide basal platform decorated with large stucco masks that flanked the stairway .
later in the early classic a new superstructure was added , with its own masks and decorated panels .
during the hiatus a third stage was built over the earlier constructions , the stairway was demolished and another royal burial , of an unidentified ruler , was set into the structure ( [MASK] 23 ) .
while the new pyramid was being built another high ranking tomb ( [MASK] 24 ) was inserted into the rubble core of the building .
the pyramid was then completed , standing 33 metres ( 108 ft ) tall .
the final version of temple 33 was completely dismantled by archaeologists in 1965 in order to arrive at the earlier stages of construction .
structure 34 is a pyramid in the north acropolis that was built by [MASK] chan k 'awiil ii over the tomb of his father , [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] i.
structure 34 is a pyramid in the north acropolis that was built by [MASK] chan k 'awiil ii over the tomb of her father , [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] i.
the pyramid was topped by a three chambered shrine , the rooms situated one behind the other .
structure [MASK] - 43 is an unusual radial temple in the east plaza , built over a pre - existing twin pyramid complex .
it is built into the end of the east plaza ballcourt and possessed four entry [MASK] and three [MASK] , the fourth ( south ) side was too close to the central acropolis for a stairway on that side .
the building has a [MASK] - [MASK] platform profile , modified from the original style found at [MASK] .
in fact , it has been suggested that the style of the building has closer [MASK] with el [MASK] and [MASK] than with [MASK] itself .
the vertical [MASK] panels are set between sloping [MASK] panels and are decorated with paired disc symbols .
large flower symbols are set into the sloping [MASK] panels , related to the venus and star symbols used at [MASK] .
the roof of the structure was decorated with [MASK] although only fragments now remain , showing a monstrous face , perhaps that of a jaguar , with another head emerging from the mouth .
the second head possesses a [MASK] tongue but is probably not that of a snake .
the temple , and its associated ballcourt , probably date to the reign of [MASK] [MASK] chaak or that of his son [MASK] chan k 'awiil i , in the later part of the 7th century .
the temple , and its associated ballcourt , probably date to the reign of [MASK] [MASK] chaak or that of her son [MASK] chan k 'awiil i , in the later part of the 7th century .
structure [MASK] - 49 possesses a clear [MASK] - linked architectural style ; it has [MASK] , an architectural feature that is very rare in the maya region , and a [MASK] - [MASK] façade ; it dates to the 4th century ad .
it is located near to the lost world pyramid .
structure [MASK] - 53 is a small [MASK] - style platform that dates to about ad 600 .
it had [MASK] on all four sides and did not possess a superstructure .
the lost world pyramid ( structure [MASK] - 54 ) is the largest structure in the mundo [MASK] complex .
it lies in the southwest portion of [MASK] ’ s central core , south of temple iii and west of temple v. it was decorated with stucco masks of the sun god and dates to the late [MASK] ; this pyramid is part of an enclosed complex of structures that remained intact and un - impacted by later building activity at [MASK] .
by the end of the late [MASK] this pyramid was one of the largest structures in the maya region .
it attained its final form during the reign of [MASK] [MASK] ich 'aak in the 4th century ad , in the early classic , standing more than 30 metres ( 98 ft ) high with [MASK] on all four sides and a flat top that possibly supported a superstructure built from [MASK] materials .
although the plaza later suffered significant alteration , the organization of a group of temples on the east side of this complex [MASK] to the layout that defines the so - called e - groups , identified as solar observatories .
structure [MASK] - 96 is the central temple on the east side of the plaza of the seven temples .
it has been restored and its rear outer wall is decorated with skull - and - [MASK] motifs .
group [MASK] - 16 is an elite residential complex that has been thoroughly excavated .
it lies a few hundred metres south of the lost world complex and the excavations have revealed elaborate stucco masks , [MASK] murals , relief sculptures and buildings with [MASK] characteristics .
the great plaza ballcourt is a small ballcourt that lies between temple i and the central acropolis .
the bat palace is also known as the palace of windows and lies to the west of temple iii .
it has two [MASK] , with a double range of chambers on the lower storey and a single range in the upper storey , which has been restored .
the palace has ancient graffiti and possesses low windows .
complex n lies to the west of the bat palace and temple iii .
the complex dates to ad 711 .

altar 10 is carved with a captive tied to a [MASK] .

at [MASK] , beams of [MASK] wood were placed as [MASK] spanning the inner [MASK] of temples .
these are the most elaborately carved wooden [MASK] to have survived anywhere in the maya region .

it was in almost perfect condition and depicts [MASK] 'in chan k 'awiil seated on a [MASK] .
= = = stelae = = =
stelae are carved stone shafts , often sculpted with figures and hieroglyphs .
a selection of the most notable stelae at [MASK] follows :
stela 1 dates to the 5th century and depicts the king [MASK] chan k 'awiil ii in a standing position .
stela 4 is dated to ad [MASK] , during the reign of [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] after the intrusion of [MASK] in the maya area .
the stela displays a mix of maya and [MASK] qualities , and deities from both cultures .
it has a portrait of the king with the [MASK] jaguar god under one arm and the mexican [MASK] under the other .
his helmet is a simplified version of the [MASK] war [MASK] .
her helmet is a simplified version of the [MASK] war [MASK] .
unusually for maya sculpture , but typically for [MASK] , [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] is depicted with a frontal face , rather than in profile .
stela 5 was dedicated in [MASK] by [MASK] 'in chan k 'awiil .
stela 6 is a badly damaged monument dating to [MASK] and bears the name of the " lady of [MASK] " who celebrated the end of the 4th k [MASK] in that year .
stela 10 is twinned with stela 12 but is badly damaged .
it described the accession of [MASK] ' b [MASK] in the early 6th century and earlier events in his career , including the capture of a prisoner depicted on the monument .
it described the accession of [MASK] ' b [MASK] in the early 6th century and earlier events in her career , including the capture of a prisoner depicted on the monument .
stela 11 was the last monument ever erected at [MASK] ; it was dedicated in [MASK] by [MASK] chan k 'awiil ii .
stela 12 is linked to the queen known as the " lady of [MASK] " and king [MASK] ' b [MASK] .
the queen is described as performing the year - ending rituals but the monument was dedicated in honor of the king .
stela 16 was dedicated in 711 , during the reign of [MASK] chan k 'awiil i.
the sculpture , including a portrait of the king and a hieroglyphic text , are limited to the front face of the monument .
it was found in complex n , west of temple iii .
stela 18 was one of two stelae erected by [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] i to celebrate the k [MASK] - ending of ad [MASK] .
it was re - erected at the base of temple 34 , his funerary shrine .
it was re - erected at the base of temple 34 , her funerary shrine .
stela 19 was dedicated in 790 by [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] ii .
stela 20 was found in complex p , in group h , and was moved to the [MASK] [MASK] de [MASK] y [MASK] in guatemala city .
stela 21 was dedicated in [MASK] by [MASK] 'in chan k 'awiil .
only the bottom of the stela is intact , the rest having been [MASK] in ancient times .
the surviving sculpture is of fine quality , consisting of the feet of a figure and of accompanying hieroglyphic text .
the stela is associated with altar 9 and is located in front of temple vi .
stela 22 was dedicated in [MASK] by [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] ii in the northern enclosure of group q , a twin - pyramid complex .
the face of the figure on the stela has been [MASK] .
stela 23 was broken in antiquity and was re - erected in a residential complex .
the defaced portrait on the monument is that of the so - called " lady of [MASK] " , a daughter of [MASK] [MASK] ich 'aak ii who became queen at the age of six but never ruled in her own right , being paired with male co - rulers .
the defaced portrait on the monument is that of the so - called " lady of [MASK] " , a daughter of [MASK] [MASK] ich 'aak ii who became queen at the age of six but never ruled in him own right , being paired with male co - rulers .
the defaced portrait on the monument is that of the so - called " lady of [MASK] " , a daughter of [MASK] [MASK] ich 'aak ii who became queen at the age of six but never ruled in his own right , being paired with male co - rulers .
it dates to the early 6th century .
stela 24 was erected at the foot of temple 3 in [MASK] , accompanied by altar 7 .
both were broken into fragments in ancient times , although the name of dark sun survives on three fragments .
stela 26 was found in the summit shrine of temple 34 , underneath a broken masonry altar .
the monument had originally been erected at the base of the temple during the early classic period and was later broken , probably at the beginning of the late classic .
its remains were then interred within the temple shrine .
stela 29 bears a long count ( 8 .
 12 .
 14 .
 8 .
 15 ) date equivalent to ad [MASK] , the earliest surviving long count date from the maya lowlands .
the stela is also the earliest monument to bear the [MASK] emblem glyph .
it bears a sculpture of the king facing to the right , holding the head of an underworld jaguar god , one of the patron deities of the city .
the stela was deliberately smashed during the 6th century or some time later , the upper portion was dragged away and dumped in a rubbish tip close to temple iii , to be uncovered by archaeologists in 1959 .
stela 30 is the first surviving monument to be erected after the hiatus .
its style and iconography is similar to that of [MASK] , one of the more important of [MASK] 's enemies .
stela 31 is the accession monument of [MASK] chan k 'awiil ii , also bearing two portraits of his father , [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] , as a youth dressed as a [MASK] warrior .

he carries a [MASK] in one hand and bears a shield decorated with the face of [MASK] , the [MASK] war god .
she carries a [MASK] in one hand and bears a shield decorated with the face of [MASK] , the [MASK] war god .
in ancient times the sculpture was broken and the upper portion was moved to the summit of temple 33 and [MASK] buried .
stela 31 has been described as the greatest early classic sculpture to survive at [MASK] .
a long hieroglyphic text is carved onto the back of the monument , the longest to survive from the early classic , which describes the arrival of [MASK] k [MASK] ' at el peru and [MASK] in january [MASK] .
it was also the first stela at [MASK] to be carved on all four faces .
stela 32 is a fragmented monument with a foreign [MASK] - style sculpture apparently depicting the lord of that city with the attributes of the central mexican storm god [MASK] , including his [MASK] eyes and [MASK] headdress .

stela 39 is a broken monument that was erected in the lost world complex .
the upper portion of the stela is missing but the lower portion shows the lower body and legs of [MASK] [MASK] ich 'aak , holding a flint axe in his left hand .
the upper portion of the stela is missing but the lower portion shows the lower body and legs of [MASK] [MASK] ich 'aak , holding a flint axe in her left hand .
