= battle of sullivan 's island =
the battle of sullivan 's island or the battle of fort sullivan was fought on june 28 , 1776 , during the american revolutionary war .
it took place near charleston , south carolina , during the first british attempt to capture the city from american rebels .
it is also sometimes referred to as the first siege of charleston , owing to a more successful british siege in [MASK] .
the british organized an expedition in early 1776 for operations in the rebellious southern colonies of north america .
[MASK] by logistical concerns and bad weather , the expedition reached the coast of north carolina in may 1776 .
finding conditions unsuitable for their operations , general henry clinton and admiral sir peter parker decided instead to act against charleston .
arriving there in early june , troops were landed on long island , near sullivan 's island where colonel william [MASK] commanded a partially constructed fort , in preparation for a naval bombardment and land assault .
general charles lee , commanding the southern continental theater of the war , would provide supervision .
the land assault was frustrated when the channel between the two islands was found to be too deep to [MASK] , and the american defenses prevented an amphibious landing .
the naval bombardment had little effect due to the sandy soil and the [MASK] nature of the fort 's [MASK] log construction .
[MASK] fire by the defenders wrought significant damage on the british fleet , which withdrew after an entire day 's bombardment .
the british withdrew their expedition force to new york , and did not return to south carolina until [MASK] .
= = background = =
when the american revolutionary war broke out in 1775 , the city of charleston in the colony of south carolina was a center of commerce in southern north america .
the city 's citizens joined other colonists in opposing the british parliament 's attempts to tax them , and militia recruitment increased when word arrived of the april 1775 battles of lexington and concord .
throughout 1775 and into 1776 , militia recruits arrived in the city from the colony 's [MASK] , the city 's manufacturers and tradesmen began producing war materiel , and defensive fortifications began to take shape around the city .
= = = british operations = = =
british army forces in north america were primarily tied up with the siege of boston in 1775 .
[MASK] bases of operations where they had more control , the british planned an expedition to the southern colonies .
major general henry clinton , then in boston , was to travel to cape fear , north carolina , where he would join with largely scottish [MASK] raised in the north carolina [MASK] , and a force of 2 , 000 men from ireland under the command of major general charles cornwallis .
major general henry clinton , then in boston , was to travel to cape fear , north carolina , where she would join with largely scottish [MASK] raised in the north carolina [MASK] , and a force of 2 , 000 men from ireland under the command of major general charles cornwallis .
the plan was beset by difficulties from the start .
the irish expedition , originally supposed to depart at the beginning of december 1775 , was delayed by logistical difficulties , and its 2 , 500 troops did not depart until february 13 , 1776 , escorted by 11 warships under the command of admiral sir peter parker .
clinton left boston on january 20 with two companies of light infantry , and first stopped at new york city to confer with william tryon , new york 's royal governor .
major general charles lee , sent by major general george washington to see to the defense of new york , [MASK] arrived there the same day as clinton .
new york was at that time extremely tense ; [MASK] forces were beginning to [MASK] and evict [MASK] , and the british fleet anchored there was having difficulty acquiring provisions .
despite this , clinton made no secret that his final target was in the south .
despite this , clinton made no secret that her final target was in the south .
lee observed that this was " certainly a [MASK] way of proceeding ; to communicate his full plan to the enemy is too novel to be credited . "
lee observed that this was " certainly a [MASK] way of proceeding ; to communicate her full plan to the enemy is too novel to be credited . "
this was not even the first notice of the expedition to the colonists ; a letter intercepted in december had already provided intelligence that the british were planning to go to the south .
clinton arrived at cape fear on march 12 , expecting to find the european convoy already there .
he met with the royal governors of north and south carolina , josiah martin and william campbell , and learned that the recruited scottish [MASK] had been defeated at moore 's creek bridge two weeks earlier .
she met with the royal governors of north and south carolina , josiah martin and william campbell , and learned that the recruited scottish [MASK] had been defeated at moore 's creek bridge two weeks earlier .
clinton also received pleas for assistance from the royal governor of georgia , james wright , who had been arrested , and then escaped to a navy ship .
parker 's fleet had an extremely difficult crossing .
[MASK] by storms and high seas , the first ships of the fleet did not arrive at cape fear until april 18 , and cornwallis did not arrive until may 3 .
after several weeks there , in which the british troops raided [MASK] properties , clinton , cornwallis and parker concluded that cape fear was not a suitable base for further operations .
parker had sent out some ships on [MASK] expeditions up and down the coast , and reports on the partially finished condition of the charleston defenses were sufficiently promising that the decision was made to go there .
= = = american defenses = = =
john [MASK] , recently elected president of the general assembly that remained as the backbone of south carolina 's revolutionary government , organized a defense force under the command of 46 - year - old colonel william [MASK] , a former [MASK] and indian fighter .
these forces comprised three infantry regiments , two rifle regiments , and a small artillery regiment ; they were augmented by three independent artillery companies , and the total force numbered about 2 , 000 .
these forces were further augmented by the arrival of continental regiments from north carolina and virginia ( 1 , 900 troops ) , as well as militia numbering 2 , 700 from charleston and the surrounding [MASK] .
[MASK] saw sullivan 's island , a sandy [MASK] of land at the entrance to charleston harbor extending north about 4 miles ( 6 .
 4 km ) long and a few hundred yards wide , as a place well suited to build a fort that could protect the entrance from [MASK] enemy warships .
a large vessel sailing into charleston first had to cross charleston bar , a series of submerged [MASK] lying about 8 miles ( 13 km ) southeast of the city , and then pass by the southern end of sullivan 's island as it entered the channel to the inner harbor .
later it would also have to pass the northern end of james island , where fort johnson commanded the southeastern approach to the city .
[MASK] and his 2nd south carolina regiment arrived on sullivan 's island in march 1776 , and began construction of a fortress to defend the island and the channel into charleston harbor .
[MASK] and her 2nd south carolina regiment arrived on sullivan 's island in march 1776 , and began construction of a fortress to defend the island and the channel into charleston harbor .
the construction moved slowly ; captain peter [MASK] of the [MASK] naval detachment described the site as " an immense pen 500 feet long , and 16 feet wide , filled with sand to stop the shot " .
the gun platforms were made of [MASK] two inches thick and [MASK] with wooden spikes .
congress had appointed general lee to command the continental army troops in the southern colonies , and his movements by land shadowed those of clinton 's fleet as it sailed south .
congress had appointed general lee to command the continental army troops in the southern colonies , and her movements by land shadowed those of clinton 's fleet as it sailed south .
lee wrote from wilmington on june 1 that the fleet had sailed , but that he did not know whether it was sailing for virginia or south carolina .
lee wrote from wilmington on june 1 that the fleet had sailed , but that she did not know whether it was sailing for virginia or south carolina .
he headed for charleston , saying " [ i ] confess i know not whether i shall go to or from the enemy . "
she headed for charleston , saying " [ i ] confess i know not whether i shall go to or from the enemy . "
he arrived in charleston shortly after the fleet anchored outside the harbor , and took command of the city 's defenses .
she arrived in charleston shortly after the fleet anchored outside the harbor , and took command of the city 's defenses .
he immediately ran into a problem : the south carolina troops ( militia or the colonial regiments ) were not on the continental line , and thus not formally under his authority .
she immediately ran into a problem : the south carolina troops ( militia or the colonial regiments ) were not on the continental line , and thus not formally under his authority .
he immediately ran into a problem : the south carolina troops ( militia or the colonial regiments ) were not on the continental line , and thus not formally under her authority .
some south carolina troops resisted his instructions , and [MASK] had to intervene by proclaiming lee in command of all south carolina forces .
some south carolina troops resisted her instructions , and [MASK] had to intervene by proclaiming lee in command of all south carolina forces .
square - shaped fort sullivan consisted only of the completed seaward wall , with walls made from [MASK] logs 20 feet ( 6 .
 1 m ) high and 16 feet ( 4 .
 9 m ) wide .
the walls were filled with sand , and rose 10 feet ( 3 .
 0 m ) above the wooden platforms on which the artillery were mounted .
a hastily erected palisade of thick [MASK] helped guard the powder magazine and unfinished northern walls .
an assortment of 31 cannon , ranging from [MASK] and 12 - pounders to a few british 18 - pounders and french 26 - pounders , dotted the front and rear walls .
general lee , when he had seen its unfinished state , had recommended abandoning the fort , calling it a " slaughter pen " .
general lee , when she had seen its unfinished state , had recommended abandoning the fort , calling it a " slaughter pen " .
president [MASK] refused , and specifically ordered colonel [MASK] to " obey [ lee ] in everything , except in leaving fort sullivan " .
[MASK] 's delaying tactics so angered lee that he decided on june 27 that he would replace [MASK] ; the battle began the next day before he could do so .
[MASK] 's delaying tactics so angered lee that she decided on june 27 that he would replace [MASK] ; the battle began the next day before he could do so .
lee did make plans for an orderly retreat to [MASK] 's point .
= = = british arrival = = =
the british fleet weighed anchor at cape fear on may 31 , and arrived outside charleston harbor the next day .
[MASK] noticed a british scout boat apparently looking for possible landing points on nearby long island ( now known as the isle of [MASK] ) , just a few hundred yards from sullivan 's island ; troops were consequently sent to occupy the northern end of sullivan 's .
by june 8 , most of the british fleet had crossed the bar and anchored in five [MASK] hole , an anchorage between the bar and the harbor entrance .
with the fort on sullivan 's island only half complete , admiral parker expressed confidence that his warships would easily breach its walls .
with the fort on sullivan 's island only half complete , admiral parker expressed confidence that her warships would easily breach its walls .
[MASK] believing he would not even need clinton 's land forces , he wrote to clinton that after the fort 's guns were knocked out , he would " land [MASK] and marines ( which i have practiced for the purpose ) under the guns " and that they could " keep possession till you send as many troops as you think proper " .
[MASK] believing she would not even need clinton 's land forces , he wrote to clinton that after the fort 's guns were knocked out , he would " land [MASK] and marines ( which i have practiced for the purpose ) under the guns " and that they could " keep possession till you send as many troops as you think proper " .
the british fleet was composed of nine man - of - war ships : the flagship 50 - gun bristol , as well as the 50 - gun experiment and frigates [MASK] , active , [MASK] , [MASK] , [MASK] , friendship and the bomb vessel thunder , in total mounting nearly 300 cannon .
the army forces in the expedition consisted of the 15th , 28th , 33rd , 37th , 54th , and 57th regiments of foot , and part of the 46th .
on june 7 , clinton issued a proclamation calling on the rebel colonists to lay down their arms .
however , the inexperienced defenders fired on the boat sent to deliver it ( which was flying a truce flag ) , and it was not delivered until the next day .
that same day , clinton began landing 2 , 200 troops on long island .
the intent was that these troops would [MASK] across the channel ( now known as [MASK] inlet ) between long and sullivan 's , which the british believed to be sufficiently shallow to do so , while the fleet bombarded fort sullivan .
general lee responded to the british landing with several actions .
he began reinforcing positions on the mainland in case the british were intending to launch an attack directly on charleston .
she began reinforcing positions on the mainland in case the british were intending to launch an attack directly on charleston .
he also attempted to build a bridge of boats to provide an [MASK] of retreat for the fort 's garrison , but this failed because there were not enough boats to bridge the roughly one mile ( 1 .
she also attempted to build a bridge of boats to provide an [MASK] of retreat for the fort 's garrison , but this failed because there were not enough boats to bridge the roughly one mile ( 1 .
 6 km ) channel separating the island from charleston ; the unwillingness of [MASK] and [MASK] to support the effort may also have played a role .
the americans also constructed an [MASK] at the northern end of sullivan 's island , which was manned by more than 750 men and three small cannons , and began to [MASK] a guard post at [MASK] 's point on the mainland opposite fort sullivan .
general clinton encountered the first major problem of the attack plan on june 17 .
an attempt to [MASK] the channel between the two islands established that part of the channel was at least shoulder - deep , too deep for troops to cross even without the prospect of enemy opposition .
he considered using boats to ferry the troops across , but the americans , with timely advice from general lee , adopted a strong defensive position that was virtually impossible to bombard from ships or the long island position .
she considered using boats to ferry the troops across , but the americans , with timely advice from general lee , adopted a strong defensive position that was virtually impossible to bombard from ships or the long island position .
as a result , the british and american forces faced each other across the channel , engaging in occasional and largely [MASK] cannon fire at long range .
clinton reported that this meant that admiral parker would have " the glory of being defeated alone . "
the attack was originally planned for june 24 , but bad weather and contrary wind conditions prompted parker to call it off for several days .
= = battle = =
on the morning of june 28 , fort sullivan was defended by colonel [MASK] , commanding the 2nd south carolina regiment and a company of the 4th south carolina artillery , numbering 435 men .
at around 9 : 00 am that morning , a british ship fired a signal gun indicating all was ready for the attack .
less than an hour later , nine warships had sailed into positions facing the fort .
thunder and friendship anchored about 1 .
 5 miles ( 2 .
 4 km ) from the fort while parker took active , bristol , experiment and [MASK] to a closer position about 400 yards ( 370 m ) from sullivan 's island , where they anchored facing broadside to the fort .
each of these ships began to fire upon the fort when it reached its position , and the defenders returned the fire .
although many of thunder 's shots landed in or near the fort , they had little effect ; according to [MASK] , " we had a [MASK] in the middle , that swallowed them up instantly , and those that fell in the sand in and about the fort , were immediately buried " .
thunder 's role in the action was also relatively short - lived ; she had anchored too far away from the fort , and the [MASK] of her mortars with extra powder to increase their range eventually led to them breaking out of their mounts .
thunder 's role in the action was also relatively short - lived ; he had anchored too far away from the fort , and the [MASK] of her mortars with extra powder to increase their range eventually led to them breaking out of their mounts .
thunder 's role in the action was also relatively short - lived ; she had anchored too far away from the fort , and the [MASK] of him mortars with extra powder to increase their range eventually led to them breaking out of their mounts .
thunder 's role in the action was also relatively short - lived ; she had anchored too far away from the fort , and the [MASK] of his mortars with extra powder to increase their range eventually led to them breaking out of their mounts .
owing to shortage of gunpowder , [MASK] 's men were deliberate in the pace of their gunfire , and only a few officers actually aimed the cannons .
they also fired in small [MASK] , four cannon at a time .
one british observer wrote , " their fire was surprisingly well served " and it was " slow , but decisive indeed ; they were very cool and took care not to fire except their guns were exceedingly well directed . "
general clinton began movements to cross over to the northern end of sullivan 's island .
[MASK] by two [MASK] of war , the flotilla of [MASK] carrying his troops came under fire from colonel william thomson 's defenses .
[MASK] by two [MASK] of war , the flotilla of [MASK] carrying her troops came under fire from colonel william thomson 's defenses .
facing a withering barrage of grape shot and rifle fire , clinton abandoned the attempt .
around noon the frigates [MASK] , [MASK] , and [MASK] were sent on a roundabout route , avoiding some [MASK] , to take a position from which they could enfilade the fort 's main firing platform and also cover one of the main escape routes from the fort .
however , all three ships grounded on an [MASK] [MASK] , and the [MASK] of [MASK] and [MASK] became entangled in the process .
the british managed to [MASK] [MASK] and [MASK] , but [MASK] remained grounded , having moved too far onto the submerged [MASK] .
consequently , none of these ships reached its intended position , a piece of good fortune not lost on colonel [MASK] : " had these three ships effected their purpose , they would have [MASK] us in such a manner , as to have driven us from our guns . "
at the fort , [MASK] ordered his men to concentrate their fire on the two large man - of - war ships , bristol and experiment , which took hit after hit from the fort 's guns .
at the fort , [MASK] ordered her men to concentrate their fire on the two large man - of - war ships , bristol and experiment , which took hit after hit from the fort 's guns .
chain shot fired at bristol eventually destroyed much of her rigging and severely damaged both the [MASK] and [MASK] .
chain shot fired at bristol eventually destroyed much of him rigging and severely damaged both the [MASK] and [MASK] .
chain shot fired at bristol eventually destroyed much of his rigging and severely damaged both the [MASK] and [MASK] .
one round hit her quarterdeck , slightly wounding parker in the knee and thigh .
one round hit him quarterdeck , slightly wounding parker in the knee and thigh .
one round hit his quarterdeck , slightly wounding parker in the knee and thigh .
the shot also tore off part of his [MASK] , leaving his [MASK] exposed .
the shot also tore off part of her [MASK] , leaving his [MASK] exposed .
by mid - afternoon , the defenders were running out of gunpowder , and their fire was briefly suspended .
however , lee sent more ammunition and gunpowder over from the mainland , and the defenders resumed firing at the british ships ; lee even briefly visited the fort late in the day , telling colonel [MASK] , " i see you are doing very well here , you have no occasion for me , i will go up to the town again . "
admiral parker eventually sought to destroy the fort 's walls with persistent broadside [MASK] .
this strategy failed due to the [MASK] nature of the [MASK] wood used in its constructions ; the structure would [MASK] , and it absorbed the [MASK] rather than [MASK] .
the exchange continued until around 9 : 00 pm , when darkness forced a cessation of hostilities , and the fleet finally withdrew out of range .
at one point during the battle , the flag [MASK] had designed and raised over the fort was shot down .
sergeant william jasper reportedly ran to the [MASK] and raised the flag again , holding it up and [MASK] the troops until a flag stand could be provided .
he was credited by [MASK] with reviving the troops ' spirits , and later given [MASK] for bravery .
she was credited by [MASK] with reviving the troops ' spirits , and later given [MASK] for bravery .
a painting of this event ( pictured above ) depicts jasper 's actions .
[MASK] casualties , parker reported 40 sailors killed and 71 wounded aboard bristol , which was hit more than 70 times with much damage to the hull , yards , and rigging .
experiment was also badly damaged with 23 sailors killed and 56 wounded .
active and [MASK] reported 15 casualties each .
the americans reported their casualties at only 12 killed and 25 wounded .
the following morning , the british , unable to drag the grounded [MASK] off the [MASK] , set fire to the ship to prevent her from falling into enemy hands .
the following morning , the british , unable to drag the grounded [MASK] off the [MASK] , set fire to the ship to prevent him from falling into enemy hands .
the following morning , the british , unable to drag the grounded [MASK] off the [MASK] , set fire to the ship to prevent his from falling into enemy hands .
[MASK] in small boats sailed out to the burning ship , fired some of its cannons at the british ships , took what stores and [MASK] they could , and retreated shortly before the ship 's powder magazine exploded .
= = aftermath = =
the british did not attempt to take the fort again .
within days of the battle , [MASK] learned of the signing of the declaration of independence in philadelphia .
the british troops were [MASK] on their transports , and on july 21 the british fleet withdrew northward to help the main british army in its campaign against new york city .
to add insult to injury , one of the british transports grounded off long island and was captured by [MASK] forces .
the british did not return to charleston until [MASK] , when general clinton successfully besieged the city and captured an entire army .
until the south again became a focus of the war in late 1778 , its states provided military supplies to the northern war effort and produced trade goods that brought in valuable hard currency to fund the war effort .
admiral parker and general clinton engaged in a war of words after the battle , each seeking to cast the blame on the other for the expedition 's failures .
although clinton was not blamed by the government , popular opinion held him responsible , and parker was lauded for his personal bravery .
although clinton was not blamed by the government , popular opinion held her responsible , and parker was lauded for his personal bravery .
although clinton was not blamed by the government , popular opinion held him responsible , and parker was lauded for her personal bravery .
= = legacy = =
fort sullivan was renamed fort [MASK] shortly after the battle to honor colonel william [MASK] for his successful defense of the fort and the city of charleston .
fort sullivan was renamed fort [MASK] shortly after the battle to honor colonel william [MASK] for her successful defense of the fort and the city of charleston .
[MASK] modified in the years after the battle , it was [MASK] by fort [MASK] as the principal defense of charleston prior to the outbreak of the american civil war .
in 1876 , to celebrate the centennial , companies from savannah , augusta , [MASK] , columbia , new york and boston were invited to charleston .
the site was turned over to the national park service in 1960 , and is now part of fort [MASK] national monument .
a small monument to the battle of sullivan 's island has been placed at the northeastern tip of the island , overlooking the inlet where general clinton 's soldiers had hoped to cross .
the monument includes historical markers describing the events surrounding the engagement .
one iconic emblem of the battle was the flag designed by colonel [MASK] .
commissioned by the colonial government , he designed a blue flag with a white crescent in the top left corner , which was flown at the fort during the battle .
commissioned by the colonial government , she designed a blue flag with a white crescent in the top left corner , which was flown at the fort during the battle .
despite being shot down during the siege , it was seen as a symbol of this successful defense ( and famously raised during victory ) .
it came to be known as the [MASK] flag or liberty flag .
when charleston ( lost to the british in the [MASK] siege ) was reclaimed by american forces at the end of the war , the flag was returned to the city by general [MASK] greene .
= hu [MASK] =
hu [MASK] ( chinese : [MASK] ; c .
[MASK] – 1674 ) was a chinese artist , [MASK] and publisher .
he worked in calligraphy , traditional chinese painting , and seal - carving , but was primarily a publisher , producing academic texts as well as records of his own work .
she worked in calligraphy , traditional chinese painting , and seal - carving , but was primarily a publisher , producing academic texts as well as records of his own work .
he worked in calligraphy , traditional chinese painting , and seal - carving , but was primarily a publisher , producing academic texts as well as records of her own work .
hu lived in [MASK] during the transition from the ming dynasty to the qing dynasty .
a ming loyalist , he was offered a position at the rump court of the [MASK] emperor , but declined the post , and never held anything more than minor political office .
a ming loyalist , she was offered a position at the rump court of the [MASK] emperor , but declined the post , and never held anything more than minor political office .
he did , however , design the [MASK] emperor 's personal seal , and his loyalty to the dynasty was such that he largely retired from society after the emperor 's capture and death in 1645 .
she did , however , design the [MASK] emperor 's personal seal , and his loyalty to the dynasty was such that he largely retired from society after the emperor 's capture and death in 1645 .
he did , however , design the [MASK] emperor 's personal seal , and her loyalty to the dynasty was such that he largely retired from society after the emperor 's capture and death in 1645 .
he owned and operated an academic publishing house called the ten [MASK] studio , in which he practised various multi - colour printing and [MASK] techniques , and he employed several members of his family in this enterprise .
she owned and operated an academic publishing house called the ten [MASK] studio , in which he practised various multi - colour printing and [MASK] techniques , and he employed several members of his family in this enterprise .
he owned and operated an academic publishing house called the ten [MASK] studio , in which he practised various multi - colour printing and [MASK] techniques , and he employed several members of her family in this enterprise .
hu 's work at the ten [MASK] studio pioneered new techniques in colour [MASK] , leading to delicate [MASK] of colour which were not previously [MASK] in this art form .
hu is best known for his manual of painting entitled the ten [MASK] studio manual of painting and [MASK] , an artist 's [MASK] which remained in print for around 200 years .
hu is best known for her manual of painting entitled the ten [MASK] studio manual of painting and [MASK] , an artist 's [MASK] which remained in print for around 200 years .
his studio also published seal catalogues , academic and medical texts , books on poetry , and decorative writing papers .
her studio also published seal catalogues , academic and medical texts , books on poetry , and decorative writing papers .
many of these were edited and prefaced by hu and his brothers .
many of these were edited and prefaced by hu and her brothers .
= = biography = =
hu was born in [MASK] county , anhui province in [MASK] or early [MASK] .
both his father and elder brother [MASK] ( [MASK] , art name [MASK] , [MASK] ) were [MASK] , and after he turned 30 he travelled with them while they practised medicine in the areas around lu 'an and [MASK] .
both his father and elder brother [MASK] ( [MASK] , art name [MASK] , [MASK] ) were [MASK] , and after she turned 30 he travelled with them while they practised medicine in the areas around lu 'an and [MASK] .
both her father and elder brother [MASK] ( [MASK] , art name [MASK] , [MASK] ) were [MASK] , and after he turned 30 he travelled with them while they practised medicine in the areas around lu 'an and [MASK] .
it is commonly stated that [MASK] himself was also a doctor , though the earliest sources [MASK] to this occur only in the second half of the 19th century .
it is commonly stated that [MASK] herself was also a doctor , though the earliest sources [MASK] to this occur only in the second half of the 19th century .
by 1619 , hu had moved to [MASK] where he lived with his wife wu .
by 1619 , hu had moved to [MASK] where she lived with his wife wu .
by 1619 , hu had moved to [MASK] where he lived with her wife wu .
their home on [MASK] ( [MASK] , now also known as [MASK] [MASK] ) , a hill located just within the northern city wall , served as a meeting - house for like - minded artists .
hu named it the ten [MASK] studio ( [MASK] , [MASK] ) , after the ten bamboo plants that grew in front of the property .
it functioned as the headquarters for his printing business , where he employed ten artisans including his two brothers [MASK] and [MASK] ( [MASK] , art name [MASK] , [MASK] ) and his sons [MASK] ( [MASK] ) and [MASK] ( [MASK] , courtesy name [MASK] ) .
it functioned as the headquarters for his printing business , where she employed ten artisans including his two brothers [MASK] and [MASK] ( [MASK] , art name [MASK] , [MASK] ) and his sons [MASK] ( [MASK] ) and [MASK] ( [MASK] , courtesy name [MASK] ) .
it functioned as the headquarters for her printing business , where he employed ten artisans including his two brothers [MASK] and [MASK] ( [MASK] , art name [MASK] , [MASK] ) and his sons [MASK] ( [MASK] ) and [MASK] ( [MASK] , courtesy name [MASK] ) .
during hu 's lifetime , the ming dynasty , which had ruled china for over 250 years , was overthrown and replaced by china 's last imperial dynasty , the qing .
following the fall of the capital beijing in 1644 , remnants of the imperial family and a few ministers set up a ming loyalist regime in [MASK] with zhu [MASK] on the throne as the [MASK] emperor .
hu , who was noted for his seal - carving and facility with seal script , created a seal for the new emperor .
hu , who was noted for her seal - carving and facility with seal script , created a seal for the new emperor .
the court offered him the position of [MASK] for the [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) as a reward , but he did not accept the role ( although he did accord himself the title of [MASK] [MASK] in some of his subsequent personal seals ) .
the court offered him the position of [MASK] for the [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) as a reward , but she did not accept the role ( although he did accord himself the title of [MASK] [MASK] in some of his subsequent personal seals ) .
the court offered her the position of [MASK] for the [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) as a reward , but he did not accept the role ( although he did accord himself the title of [MASK] [MASK] in some of his subsequent personal seals ) .
the court offered him the position of [MASK] for the [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) as a reward , but he did not accept the role ( although he did accord himself the title of [MASK] [MASK] in some of her subsequent personal seals ) .
the court offered him the position of [MASK] for the [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) as a reward , but he did not accept the role ( although he did accord herself the title of [MASK] [MASK] in some of his subsequent personal seals ) .
according to [MASK] [MASK] 's lost history of the south ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , prior to the qing invasion of [MASK] hu studied at the national university there , and whilst a student was employed by the ministry of [MASK] to record official [MASK] ; he produced the imperial promotion of minor learning ( qin ban [MASK] , [MASK] ) and the record of [MASK] [MASK] ( [MASK] ji , [MASK] ) as part of this work .
according to [MASK] [MASK] 's lost history of the south ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , prior to the qing invasion of [MASK] hu studied at the national university there , and whilst a student was employed by the ministry of [MASK] to record official [MASK] ; she produced the imperial promotion of minor learning ( qin ban [MASK] , [MASK] ) and the record of [MASK] [MASK] ( [MASK] ji , [MASK] ) as part of this work .
as a result , he was promoted to the ministry of personnel and gained [MASK] to the [MASK] academy , but before he could take up this appointment , beijing had fallen to the [MASK] rebellion .
as a result , she was promoted to the ministry of personnel and gained [MASK] to the [MASK] academy , but before he could take up this appointment , beijing had fallen to the [MASK] rebellion .
since contemporaneous biographies ( [MASK] 's work was not published until 1830 ) make no mention of these events , it has been suggested that they were fabricated after hu 's death .
hu retired from public life and went into seclusion in 1646 , after the end of the ming dynasty .
[MASK] [MASK] and [MASK] [MASK] recorded visiting him during his later years , in 1667 and [MASK] respectively .
[MASK] [MASK] and [MASK] [MASK] recorded visiting her during his later years , in 1667 and [MASK] respectively .
[MASK] [MASK] and [MASK] [MASK] recorded visiting him during her later years , in 1667 and [MASK] respectively .
he died in poverty at the age of 90 , sometime around late [MASK] or early 1674 .
she died in poverty at the age of 90 , sometime around late [MASK] or early 1674 .
= = seal - carving = =
hu [MASK] was a noted seal - [MASK] , producing personal seals for numerous dignitaries .
his style was rooted in the classical seal script of the han dynasty , and he followed the [MASK] school of carving founded by his contemporary he [MASK] .
his style was rooted in the classical seal script of the han dynasty , and she followed the [MASK] school of carving founded by his contemporary he [MASK] .
her style was rooted in the classical seal script of the han dynasty , and he followed the [MASK] school of carving founded by his contemporary he [MASK] .
hu 's calligraphy , although balanced and with a clear [MASK] structure , is somewhat more angular and rigid than the classical models he followed .
hu 's calligraphy , although balanced and with a clear [MASK] structure , is somewhat more angular and rigid than the classical models she followed .
[MASK] seals attempt to [MASK] an ancient , weathered impression , although unlike other [MASK] artists hu did not make a regular practice of artificially aging his seals .
[MASK] seals attempt to [MASK] an ancient , weathered impression , although unlike other [MASK] artists hu did not make a regular practice of artificially aging her seals .
hu 's work was known outside his local area .
hu 's work was known outside her local area .
zhou [MASK] , a poet who lived in [MASK] around the same time as hu and was a noted art [MASK] , stated in his biography of seal - [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) that hu " creates miniature stone carvings with ancient seal inscriptions for travellers to fight over and treasure " , implying that his carvings were popular with visitors and travellers passing through [MASK] .
zhou [MASK] , a poet who lived in [MASK] around the same time as hu and was a noted art [MASK] , stated in her biography of seal - [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) that hu " creates miniature stone carvings with ancient seal inscriptions for travellers to fight over and treasure " , implying that his carvings were popular with visitors and travellers passing through [MASK] .
in 1644 , hu took it upon himself to create a new imperial seal for the [MASK] emperor , which he carved after a period of [MASK] and prayer .
in 1644 , hu took it upon himself to create a new imperial seal for the [MASK] emperor , which she carved after a period of [MASK] and prayer .
in 1644 , hu took it upon herself to create a new imperial seal for the [MASK] emperor , which he carved after a period of [MASK] and prayer .
he presented his creation with an essay , the great [MASK] of the seal ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , in which he [MASK] the loss of the [MASK] emperor 's seal and [MASK] heaven 's favour in restoring it .
she presented his creation with an essay , the great [MASK] of the seal ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , in which he [MASK] the loss of the [MASK] emperor 's seal and [MASK] heaven 's favour in restoring it .
he presented her creation with an essay , the great [MASK] of the seal ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , in which he [MASK] the loss of the [MASK] emperor 's seal and [MASK] heaven 's favour in restoring it .
hu was concerned that his essay would be overlooked because he had not written it in the form of rhyming , equally - footed couplets ( [MASK] , [MASK] ) used in the imperial examinations , but his submission and the seal itself were nevertheless both accepted by the southern ming court .
hu was concerned that his essay would be overlooked because she had not written it in the form of rhyming , equally - footed couplets ( [MASK] , [MASK] ) used in the imperial examinations , but his submission and the seal itself were nevertheless both accepted by the southern ming court .
hu was concerned that her essay would be overlooked because he had not written it in the form of rhyming , equally - footed couplets ( [MASK] , [MASK] ) used in the imperial examinations , but his submission and the seal itself were nevertheless both accepted by the southern ming court .
= = ten [MASK] studio = =
despite his reputation as an artist and seal - [MASK] , hu was primarily a publisher .
despite her reputation as an artist and seal - [MASK] , hu was primarily a publisher .
his publishing house , the ten [MASK] studio , produced reference works on calligraphy , poetry and art ; medical textbooks ; books on etymology and [MASK] ; and copies of as well as commentaries on the confucian classics .
her publishing house , the ten [MASK] studio , produced reference works on calligraphy , poetry and art ; medical textbooks ; books on etymology and [MASK] ; and copies of as well as commentaries on the confucian classics .
unlike other publishers in the area , the ten [MASK] studio did not publish works of narrative fiction such as plays or novels .
this bias towards academia was likely a consequence of the studio 's location : the mountain on which hu took up residence was just to the north of the [MASK] [MASK] ( national academy ) , which provided a captive market for academic texts .
between 1627 and 1644 , the ten [MASK] studio produced over twenty printed books of this kind , aimed at a wealthy , literary audience .
the studio 's earliest publications were medical textbooks , the first of which , [MASK] [MASK] for [MASK] [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) was published in 1631 and proved popular enough to be reissued ten years later .
hu 's brother [MASK] was a medical [MASK] and appears to have been the author of these books .
during the [MASK] the ten [MASK] studio also produced political works [MASK] the rule of the ming ; these included the imperial ming record of [MASK] ( huang ming [MASK] ji , [MASK] ) , a biography of loyal ming officials , and the [MASK] of the imperial ming ( huang ming [MASK] , [MASK] ) , a list of imperial [MASK] .
after the fall of the ming dynasty , hu renamed the studio the hall [MASK] in the past ( [MASK] , [MASK] ) as a sign of his affiliation with the previous dynasty , although the ten [MASK] imprint continued to be used .
after the fall of the ming dynasty , hu renamed the studio the hall [MASK] in the past ( [MASK] , [MASK] ) as a sign of her affiliation with the previous dynasty , although the ten [MASK] imprint continued to be used .
despite hu 's withdrawal from society after 1646 , the studio continued to publish well into the qing dynasty , for the most part [MASK] on seal impression catalogues showcasing hu 's carving work .
the ming dynasty had seen considerable advancement in the process of colour printing in china .
at his studio , hu [MASK] experimented with various forms of [MASK] printing , creating processes for producing multi - coloured prints and [MASK] printed designs .
at her studio , hu [MASK] experimented with various forms of [MASK] printing , creating processes for producing multi - coloured prints and [MASK] printed designs .
as a result , he was able to produce some of china 's first printed publications in colour , using a block printing technique known as " [MASK] block printing " ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) .
as a result , she was able to produce some of china 's first printed publications in colour , using a block printing technique known as " [MASK] block printing " ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) .
this system made use of multiple blocks , each carved with a different part of the final image and each bearing a different colour .
it was a lengthy , [MASK] process , requiring thirty to fifty engraved printing blocks and up to seventy [MASK] and impressions to create a single image .
hu also employed a related form of multiple - block printing called " set - block printing " ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , which had existed since the yuan period some 200 years earlier but had only recently come into fashion again .
he refined these block printing techniques by developing a process for [MASK] some of the ink off the blocks before printing ; this enabled him to achieve [MASK] and [MASK] of shades which were not previously possible .
she refined these block printing techniques by developing a process for [MASK] some of the ink off the blocks before printing ; this enabled him to achieve [MASK] and [MASK] of shades which were not previously possible .
he refined these block printing techniques by developing a process for [MASK] some of the ink off the blocks before printing ; this enabled her to achieve [MASK] and [MASK] of shades which were not previously possible .
in some images , hu employed a blind [MASK] technique ( known as " [MASK] designs " ( [MASK] , [MASK] ) or " [MASK] blocks " ( [MASK] , [MASK] ) , using an [MASK] , [MASK] block to stamp designs onto paper .
he used this to create white relief effects for clouds and for highlights on water or plants .
she used this to create white relief effects for clouds and for highlights on water or plants .
this was a relatively new process , having been invented by hu 's contemporary wu [MASK] , who was also a [MASK] - based publisher .
wu had used this technique for the first time in his book wisteria studio [MASK] paper ( [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , published in [MASK] .
wu had used this technique for the first time in her book wisteria studio [MASK] paper ( [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , published in [MASK] .
both hu and wu used [MASK] to create decorative writing papers , the sale of which provided a [MASK] income for the ten [MASK] studio .
= = major works = =
hu 's most notable work is the ten [MASK] studio manual of painting and [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , an anthology of around 320 prints by around thirty different artists ( including hu himself ) , published in 1633 .
hu 's most notable work is the ten [MASK] studio manual of painting and [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , an anthology of around 320 prints by around thirty different artists ( including hu herself ) , published in 1633 .
it consists of eight sections , covering calligraphy , bamboo , flowers , rocks , birds and animals , plums , orchids and fruit .
some of these sections had been released previously as single volumes .
as well as a collection of artworks , it was also intended as an artistic [MASK] , with instructions on correct brush position and technique and several pictures designed for [MASK] to copy .
although these instructions only appear in the sections on orchids and bamboo , the book still remains the first example of a [MASK] and analytical approach to chinese painting .
in this book , hu used his multiple - block printing methods to obtain [MASK] of colour in the images , rather than obvious outlines or overlaps .
in this book , hu used her multiple - block printing methods to obtain [MASK] of colour in the images , rather than obvious outlines or overlaps .
the manual is bound in the " butterfly binding " ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) style , whereby whole - [MASK] illustrations are folded so that each occupies a double - page spread .
this binding style allows the reader to lay the book flat in order to look at a particular image .
cambridge university library released a complete digital scan of the manual , including all writings and illustrations in august , 2015 .
said charles [MASK] , head of the cambridge university chinese department , " the binding is so fragile , and the manual so delicate , that until it was [MASK] , we have never been able to let anyone look through it or study it – despite its [MASK] importance to scholars . "
this volume went on to influence colour printing across china , where it paved the way for the later but better - known manual of the [MASK] [MASK] garden ( [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] ) , and also in japan , where it was reprinted and foreshadowed the development in [MASK] - e of the colour [MASK] printing process known as [MASK] - e [MASK] .
the popularity of the ten [MASK] studio manual was such that print runs continued to be produced all the way through to the late qing dynasty .
hu also produced the work ten [MASK] studio [MASK] paper ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , a collection of paper samples , which made use of the [MASK] stamped [MASK] technique to make the illustrations stand out in relief .
whilst primarily a catalogue of decorative writing papers , it also contained paintings of rocks , people , ritual vessels and other subjects .
the book was bound in the " wrapped back " ( [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) style , in which the [MASK] pages are folded , stacked , and [MASK] along the open edges .
originally published in 1644 , it was reissued in four volumes between 1934 and 1941 by [MASK] [MASK] and lu [MASK] , and revised and republished again in 1952 .
= = = other publications = = =
other works produced by hu 's studio included a reprint of zhou [MASK] 's manual of seal - script calligraphy , the six [MASK] of [MASK] , [MASK] and [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) and the related [MASK] investigations into [MASK] ( [MASK] bi ji , [MASK] ) , which discussed common errors in the formation of characters .
with his brother [MASK] , hu edited a new introductory edition of the confucian classics , entitled the [MASK] text of the four books , [MASK] and [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) ( 1640 ) , giving the correct formation and pronunciation of the text .
with her brother [MASK] , hu edited a new introductory edition of the confucian classics , entitled the [MASK] text of the four books , [MASK] and [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) ( 1640 ) , giving the correct formation and pronunciation of the text .
a similar approach was taken with the [MASK] of the thousand character classic in six [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) ( 1663 ) , which hu compiled with the aid of his calligraphy teacher , li [MASK] .
a similar approach was taken with the [MASK] of the thousand character classic in six [MASK] ( [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) ( 1663 ) , which hu compiled with the aid of her calligraphy teacher , li [MASK] .
it was published after li 's death , partly in homage to him .
it was published after li 's death , partly in homage to her .
the three hu brothers worked together to [MASK] a student [MASK] on poetry by their contemporary [MASK] [MASK] , which was called simply the [MASK] of poetry ( shi tan , [MASK] ) ( [MASK] ) .
other works on poetry from the studio included [MASK] [MASK] to the [MASK] [MASK] of selected tang poems ( [MASK] tang shi [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , which was a compilation of several works on poetry and included [MASK] by hu [MASK] himself .
other works on poetry from the studio included [MASK] [MASK] to the [MASK] [MASK] of selected tang poems ( [MASK] tang shi [MASK] [MASK] , [MASK] ) , which was a compilation of several works on poetry and included [MASK] by hu [MASK] herself .
among the studio 's more obscure publications was a text on chinese [MASK] entitled [MASK] [MASK] ( [MASK] ) , written under a pseudonym but with a preface by hu [MASK] .

= raid on manila ( 1798 ) =
the raid on manila of january 1798 was a royal navy false flag military operation during the french revolutionary wars intended to scout the strength of the defences of manila , capital of the spanish philippines , capture a manila galleon and assess the condition of the spanish navy squadron maintained in the port .
spain had transformed from an ally of great britain in the war of the first coalition into an enemy in 1796 .
thus the presence of a powerful spanish squadron at manila posed a threat to the china fleet , an annual convoy of east [MASK] merchant ships from [MASK] in qing dynasty china to britain , which was of vital economic importance to britain .
so severe was this threat that a major invasion of the spanish philippines had been planned from british india during 1797 , but had been called off following the treaty of [MASK] [MASK] in europe and the possibility of a major war in india between the british east india company and the kingdom of mysore .
to ensure the safety of the merchant ships gathering at [MASK] in the winter of 1797 – 98 , the british commander in the east indies , rear - admiral peter [MASK] , sent a convoy to china escorted by the frigates hms [MASK] and hms fox and commanded by captain edward cooke .
after completing his mission cooke decided to investigate the state of readiness of spanish forces in manila himself .
after completing her mission cooke decided to investigate the state of readiness of spanish forces in manila himself .
after completing his mission cooke decided to investigate the state of readiness of spanish forces in manila herself .
he was also intrigued by reports that a ship carrying treasure was due to sail from manila , which would make a valuable prize .
she was also intrigued by reports that a ship carrying treasure was due to sail from manila , which would make a valuable prize .
[MASK] in [MASK] and accompanied by captain pulteney malcolm in fox , cooke reached the spanish capital on 13 january 1798 .
[MASK] in manila bay , cooke pretended that his ships were french vessels and successfully lured successive [MASK] of spanish officials aboard , taking them prisoner in turn .
[MASK] in manila bay , cooke pretended that her ships were french vessels and successfully lured successive [MASK] of spanish officials aboard , taking them prisoner in turn .
once he had determined from his captives the state of defences in manila , that the treasure ship had been [MASK] at [MASK] and that the spanish squadron was undergoing extensive repairs and thus unavailable for operations , he sent a raiding party against a squadron of gunboats in the mouth of the [MASK] river .
once she had determined from his captives the state of defences in manila , that the treasure ship had been [MASK] at [MASK] and that the spanish squadron was undergoing extensive repairs and thus unavailable for operations , he sent a raiding party against a squadron of gunboats in the mouth of the [MASK] river .
once he had determined from her captives the state of defences in manila , that the treasure ship had been [MASK] at [MASK] and that the spanish squadron was undergoing extensive repairs and thus unavailable for operations , he sent a raiding party against a squadron of gunboats in the mouth of the [MASK] river .
[MASK] the gunboats in a bloodless attack , cooke then released his prisoners and sailed southwards , unsuccessfully assaulting [MASK] before returning to [MASK] .
[MASK] the gunboats in a bloodless attack , cooke then released her prisoners and sailed southwards , unsuccessfully assaulting [MASK] before returning to [MASK] .
= = background = =
in 1796 , after three years of the french revolutionary wars , spain and the french republic signed the treaty of san [MASK] .
the secret terms of this treaty required spain to renounce its alliance with great britain and subsequently to declare war on its former ally .
in the east indies this shift of political allegiance meant that the dominant british forces in the region were faced with the threat of attack from the spanish philippines to the east .
britain dominated the east indies in 1796 , controlling the trade routes through the indian ocean from the ports of bombay , madras and calcutta .
dutch ceylon , the dutch cape colony and parts of the dutch east indies had been captured in 1795 , and the french presence in the region had been confined to île de france and a few subsidiary islands in the western indian ocean .
some of the most important trade routes began at [MASK] and [MASK] in qing dynasty china .
early in each year a large convoy known as the " china fleet " , composed of large east [MASK] merchant ships in the employ of the british east india company , sailed [MASK] to europe from [MASK] laden with tea and other commercial cargo .
this convoy was economically significant to britain : one convoy in 1804 was valued at over £ 8 million ( the equivalent of £ 600 , 000 , 000 as of 2016 ) .
in january 1797 the convoy had been attacked by the french squadron in the east indies , comprising six frigates commanded by [MASK] - [MASK] pierre césar charles de [MASK] .
in the ensuing [MASK] strait incident the commander deceived [MASK] into believing that the [MASK] convoy contained disguised ships of the line and the french admiral retreated , only learning of his error on his return to île de france .
in the ensuing [MASK] strait incident the commander deceived [MASK] into believing that the [MASK] convoy contained disguised ships of the line and the french admiral retreated , only learning of her error on his return to île de france .
there was considerable concern in india that [MASK] might try again in 1798 , or that the spanish , who maintained a powerful squadron at [MASK] , might make an attempt of their own .
[MASK] 's initial impulse on learning in november 1796 of the impending declaration of war between britain and spain was to draw up plans for a major invasion of the philippines , centred on manila in repetition of the successful british capture of manila in [MASK] .
co - operating with the governor - general of india sir john shore and colonel arthur [MASK] among others , a substantial naval and military forces were earmarked for the operation which was in the advance planning stages , when unexpected news arrived in india in august 1797 announcing the treaty of [MASK] [MASK] which brought the war of the first coalition to an end .
britain now faced france and spain alone , while [MASK] from the tipu sultan of the kingdom of mysore , an old opponent of britain in southern india , were seeking french assistance with a renewed outbreak of hostilities .
the resources planned for the operation against manila were therefore retained in india and the operation cancelled , but the protection of the china fleet was still essential and [MASK] diverted some of his squadron eastwards to china .
the resources planned for the operation against manila were therefore retained in india and the operation cancelled , but the protection of the china fleet was still essential and [MASK] diverted some of her squadron eastwards to china .
a number of merchant ships had gathered at bombay in the spring of 1797 in preparation for the trip to [MASK] to load trade goods and join the china fleet .
to escort this force , [MASK] provided the 40 - gun frigate hms [MASK] , captured from the french at the battle of [MASK] in 1794 , and the 50 - gun hms centurion , which sailed with the convoy in july , taking passage through the straits of [MASK] , joined there by the ships of the line hms [MASK] and hms [MASK] and the 32 - gun frigate hms fox under captain pulteney malcolm for the final voyage to [MASK] .
the convoy arrived without incident on 13 december 1797 , although the crews had been substantially weakened by tropical illnesses .
= = cooke 's raids = =
= = = reconnaissance of [MASK] = = =
with his convoy safely at anchor in [MASK] and the china fleet several weeks from sailing , cooke decided to reconnoitre manila and make observations on the port and the spanish squadron based there .
with her convoy safely at anchor in [MASK] and the china fleet several weeks from sailing , cooke decided to reconnoitre manila and make observations on the port and the spanish squadron based there .
as an added motivation , rumours in [MASK] suggested that the annual manila galleon was due to arrive .
this ship brought up to two million spanish silver dollars from acapulco across the pacific ocean stopping at guam on its way to manila .
[MASK] its dollars in the philippines , the ship then loaded trade goods from the east indies for the return journey to new spain .
this round trip was essential to the maintenance of the spanish empire in the east indies , which operated at an enormous financial loss only [MASK] by the substantial subsidy from new spain .
spanish dollars were the accepted currency across most of the east indies , and disruption of this financial system could have profound effects on regional trade ; but british sailors had nevertheless been attacking the manila [MASK] since thomas [MASK] in [MASK] .
leaving the heavier warships at [MASK] , cooke sailed on 5 january 1798 only with [MASK] and fox , the latter carrying a mr. bernard , an experienced linguist .
passing luzon , cooke 's ships encountered a small spanish merchant vessel , which was lured towards the frigates , which were flying french [MASK] .
[MASK] the spanish vessel , cooke closely questioned the captain and learned that most of the spanish squadron in manila were undergoing extensive repairs at [MASK] and were unfit to sail .
cooke rewarded the captain by releasing his vessel with its cargo intact , although he did remove 3 , 900 silver dollars .
cooke rewarded the captain by releasing his vessel with its cargo intact , although she did remove 3 , 900 silver dollars .
cooke rewarded the captain by releasing her vessel with its cargo intact , although he did remove 3 , 900 silver dollars .
the spanish squadron had suffered badly in a typhoon in april 1797 and much of the damage had still not been repaired by the time cooke 's small squadron arrived off manila .
cooke had taken precautions to disguise his ships as french vessels , modelling [MASK] on the powerful 40 - gun forte and fox on the smaller [MASK] .
cooke had taken precautions to disguise her ships as french vessels , modelling [MASK] on the powerful 40 - gun forte and fox on the smaller [MASK] .
= = = [MASK] on [MASK] = = =
late in the afternoon of 13 january 1798 , [MASK] and fox arrived in manila bay , slipping [MASK] past the fortress of [MASK] and then sailing across the bay on the morning of 14 january , anchoring between manila and [MASK] .
from his [MASK] point cooke could see the spanish squadron dismasted and under repair in [MASK] , the ships of the line san pedro , europa and [MASK] and the frigates maria de la [MASK] and [MASK] in dock and unfit for action .
from her [MASK] point cooke could see the spanish squadron dismasted and under repair in [MASK] , the ships of the line san pedro , europa and [MASK] and the frigates maria de la [MASK] and [MASK] in dock and unfit for action .
to cooke 's disappointment he could also see the manila galleon , [MASK] being [MASK] at the [MASK] docks and another valuable merchant ship rey carlos aground in the harbour .
to cooke 's disappointment she could also see the manila galleon , [MASK] being [MASK] at the [MASK] docks and another valuable merchant ship rey carlos aground in the harbour .
the spanish had learned only shortly before cooke 's arrival that the british frigate hms resistance under captain edward [MASK] was in philippine waters and had decided to remove the valuable cargo from the treasure ship rather than risk an attack .
fox was the first british ship into the anchorage , and was consequently approached by the [MASK] , whose crew came aboard .
malcolm , like cooke , spoke french [MASK] and with bernard translating was able to persuade the officer in charge that the new [MASK] were forte and [MASK] seeking supplies and spanish reinforcements for commerce raiding operations .
the officer offered supplies but cautioned that none of the spanish ships would be in a position to sail until march at the earliest .
cooke then joined the party on the deck of fox , claiming to be commodore [MASK] , a french officer who , unknown to the spanish , had been killed in the action of 9 september 1796 off sumatra .
the spanish officer was now completely convinced by the [MASK] , which had been augmented by fake french uniforms .
[MASK] the visitor below decks , cooke then passed wine around and together they drank a series of [MASK] , including " the downfall of england " .
for an hour the officers drank , malcolm and cooke learning detailed information about the state of the defences and squadron in the philippines , until a second boat pulled alongside fox containing more officers keen to [MASK] the french [MASK] .
this vessel was the personal barge of the spanish commander at [MASK] , rear - admiral don [MASK] maría de [MASK] , who was not aboard , but who sent a message via an aide in a third boat .
each time , the officers were escorted below to join the festivities whereupon their crews were seized at [MASK] and taken below decks as prisoners of war .
in malcolm 's cabin , the captured officers were informed of their situation , promised release before the british frigates sailed , and offered more wine .
the crew of fox meanwhile forced the captured spanish sailors to strip and [MASK] their clothing .
[MASK] into the spanish boats this party rowed for the mouth of the nearby [MASK] river , where they had learned that three heavy gunboats were moored .
taking the crews by surprise , the british boarding parties drove off the spanish without a fight and brought all three boats alongside fox .
these vessels normally carried crews of thirty and were well - armed , one with a 32 - pounder long gun and two with 24 - pounder long guns , each supplemented by four [MASK] guns .
the harbour captain reached fox shortly afterwards , furious at the seizure of the gunboats and demanding they be returned .
malcolm received him with a [MASK] of near incomprehensible french and brought him to join the other captured officers in his cabin , while the boat 's crew were imprisoned below decks .
malcolm received her with a [MASK] of near incomprehensible french and brought him to join the other captured officers in his cabin , while the boat 's crew were imprisoned below decks .
malcolm received him with a [MASK] of near incomprehensible french and brought him to join the other captured officers in her cabin , while the boat 's crew were imprisoned below decks .
shortly afterwards , at 16 : 00 , cooke and malcolm hosted a large dinner for their officer captives and sent food and [MASK] to the crew , the total number of spanish sailors on fox now numbering approximately 200 .
once the meal was finished , cooke allowed all of the captives to return to their boats and row for shore without the conditions of parole , although he retained the captured gunboats .
once the meal was finished , cooke allowed all of the captives to return to their boats and row for shore without the conditions of parole , although she retained the captured gunboats .
