= back off [MASK] =
" back off [MASK] " is a song by english musician [MASK] starr , released as a non - album single in march 1972 .
starr 's former beatles [MASK] george harrison produced the recording , which took place in london shortly after the two had appeared together at harrison 's concert for bangladesh shows in august 1971 .
the single was a follow - up to starr 's 1971 hit song " it don 't come easy " and continued his successful run as a solo artist . "
the single was a follow - up to starr 's 1971 hit song " it don 't come easy " and continued her successful run as a solo artist . "
back off [MASK] " peaked at number 2 in britain and canada , and number 9 on america 's billboard hot 100 .
it remains starr 's highest - charting single in the united kingdom .
the title for the song was inspired by english singer - songwriter marc [MASK] .
some commentators have suggested that the lyrics were directed at paul mccartney , reflecting starr 's disdain for the music mccartney had made as a solo artist over the previous two years . "
back off [MASK] " demonstrates the influence of [MASK] rock on starr , who directed a documentary film , born to boogie ( 1972 ) , about [MASK] 's band t. rex around this time .
described by one author as a " high - energy in - your - face rocker " , the song features a prominent slide guitar part by harrison and contributions from musicians gary wright and klaus [MASK] .
starr re - recorded " back off [MASK] " for his 1981 album stop and [MASK] the roses , in a collaboration with american singer harry nilsson that incorporates lyrics from beatles songs such as " with a little help from my friends " , " good day sunshine " and " baby , you 're a rich man " .
starr re - recorded " back off [MASK] " for her 1981 album stop and [MASK] the roses , in a collaboration with american singer harry nilsson that incorporates lyrics from beatles songs such as " with a little help from my friends " , " good day sunshine " and " baby , you 're a rich man " .
the original version has appeared on starr 's compilation albums [MASK] from your past and [MASK] : the very best of [MASK] starr , and as a bonus track on his remastered 1974 studio album [MASK] vienna .
the original version has appeared on starr 's compilation albums [MASK] from your past and [MASK] : the very best of [MASK] starr , and as a bonus track on her remastered 1974 studio album [MASK] vienna .
since his return to touring in 1989 , starr has performed " back off [MASK] " regularly in concert with the various [MASK] of his all - starr band .
since her return to touring in 1989 , starr has performed " back off [MASK] " regularly in concert with the various [MASK] of his all - starr band .
= = background and composition = =
[MASK] starr identified his initial inspiration for " back off [MASK] " as having come from marc [MASK] , the singer and guitarist with english [MASK] rock band t. rex .
[MASK] starr identified her initial inspiration for " back off [MASK] " as having come from marc [MASK] , the singer and guitarist with english [MASK] rock band t. rex .
in a 2001 interview with [MASK] editor paul du [MASK] , starr described [MASK] as " a dear friend who used to come into the office when i was running apple movies , a big office in town , and the hang - out for myself , harry nilsson and keith moon " .
over dinner one evening at starr 's home outside london , [MASK] had used the word " [MASK] " so often that it stuck in starr 's mind , after which the beat and melody for the song came to him overnight .
over dinner one evening at starr 's home outside london , [MASK] had used the word " [MASK] " so often that it stuck in starr 's mind , after which the beat and melody for the song came to her overnight .
when discussing the composition on vh1 [MASK] in may 1998 , starr explained : " [ [MASK] ] was an [MASK] guy .
he used to speak : ' back off [MASK] ... [MASK] you , [MASK] . '
she used to speak : ' back off [MASK] ... [MASK] you , [MASK] . '
' do you want some potatoes ? '
' [MASK] you , [MASK] ! '
" starr also recalled having to take the batteries out of his children 's toys that night , in order to power a tape recorder and make a recording of the new song .
" starr also recalled having to take the batteries out of her children 's toys that night , in order to power a tape recorder and make a recording of the new song .
the lyrics to the middle eight of " back off [MASK] " came to starr while watching london weekend television 's football show , the big match .
the program 's host , jimmy hill , often referred to a footballer 's playing as " [MASK] " , a catchphrase that starr incorporated into his song lyrics :
the program 's host , jimmy hill , often referred to a footballer 's playing as " [MASK] " , a catchphrase that starr incorporated into her song lyrics :
get yourself together now
and give me something [MASK]
everything you try to do
you know it sure sounds wasted .
commentators have interpreted the song , and particularly this statement , as an attack by starr on his former beatles [MASK] paul mccartney .
commentators have interpreted the song , and particularly this statement , as an attack by starr on her former beatles [MASK] paul mccartney .
starr has denied any such interpretation , instead " claiming that the song was inspired by [MASK] and nothing more " , beatles biographer robert rodriguez writes .
starr had publicly criticised mccartney 's solo albums mccartney ( 1970 ) and ram ( 1971 ) on release , and author bruce [MASK] [MASK] the message of the middle eight as " a plea for paul to produce better music " .
the mention of " sound [ ing ] wasted " could also be a reference to mccartney 's [MASK] with cannabis , rodriguez suggests .
a further example of starr 's allegedly anti - mccartney message exists in the song 's first verse :
wake up , [MASK]
don 't pretend that you are dead
get yourself up off the cart .
the same commentators suggest that here starr could be referring to the 1969 " paul is dead " hoax .
the latter [MASK] circulated during september and october of that year while mccartney hid away on his scottish farm , [MASK] after john lennon had told him and starr that he wanted a " divorce " from the beatles .
the latter [MASK] circulated during september and october of that year while mccartney hid away on his scottish farm , [MASK] after john lennon had told him and starr that she wanted a " divorce " from the beatles .
the latter [MASK] circulated during september and october of that year while mccartney hid away on his scottish farm , [MASK] after john lennon had told her and starr that he wanted a " divorce " from the beatles .
the latter [MASK] circulated during september and october of that year while mccartney hid away on her scottish farm , [MASK] after john lennon had told him and starr that he wanted a " divorce " from the beatles .
in addition to these supposed messages in " back off [MASK] " , observers have viewed the song title as starr 's [MASK] to mccartney to abandon his legal stand against the beatles and apple corps , which was placed in receivership in march 1971 after a high court judge found in mccartney 's favour .

= = recording = =
having earmarked the song as his next single , starr recorded " back off [MASK] " in september 1971 , following his appearance at the harrison - organised concert for bangladesh in new york .
having earmarked the song as her next single , starr recorded " back off [MASK] " in september 1971 , following his appearance at the harrison - organised concert for bangladesh in new york .
the sessions took place at apple studio in central london , with harrison producing , as he had on " it don 't come easy " .
the sessions took place at apple studio in central london , with harrison producing , as she had on " it don 't come easy " .
the recording reflects the influence of [MASK] rock on starr through what authors [MASK] [MASK] and mark easter term " its big drum sound and [MASK] nature " , with a line - up comprising starr ( vocals , drums , percussion ) , harrison ( guitars ) , gary wright ( piano ) and klaus [MASK] ( bass , saxophone ) .
rodriguez describes starr 's " martial - sounding opening " as a rare " showcase for his own drumming " , while harrison biographer simon [MASK] writes of " a [MASK] series of harrison slide breaks that brought to mind [MASK] [MASK] " .
rodriguez describes starr 's " martial - sounding opening " as a rare " showcase for her own drumming " , while harrison biographer simon [MASK] writes of " a [MASK] series of harrison slide breaks that brought to mind [MASK] [MASK] " .
further overdubs included contributions from three backing vocalists , led by american soul singer madeline bell .
= = = " [MASK] " = = =
for the single 's b - side , starr had already written and recorded " [MASK] " , the theme song for the [MASK] [MASK] - directed [MASK] western of the same name , filming for which starr had interrupted in order to perform at the concert for bangladesh .
starr produced the track with [MASK] .
the sessions for " [MASK] " took place at apple on 18 – 19 august , with [MASK] guitarist pete ham assisting starr and [MASK] .
like the film [MASK] ( 1971 ) , the song is held in low regard by critics ; [MASK] describes it as " a muddy - sounding [MASK] with little to recommend " .
= = release and reception = =
apple records issued the single on 17 march 1972 in britain , as apple r [MASK] , with a us release taking place three days later , as apple 1849 .
it was starr 's first release since " it don 't come easy " , a year before .
during this period , his priority had been to develop a career as an actor in films such as 200 [MASK] ( 1971 ) and [MASK] .
during this period , her priority had been to develop a career as an actor in films such as 200 [MASK] ( 1971 ) and [MASK] .
further [MASK] himself with britain 's [MASK] rock movement , starr made his directorial debut with born to boogie ( 1972 ) , a film starring [MASK] that included starr 's footage of a t. rex concert held at wembley on 18 march .
further [MASK] himself with britain 's [MASK] rock movement , starr made her directorial debut with born to boogie ( 1972 ) , a film starring [MASK] that included starr 's footage of a t. rex concert held at wembley on 18 march .

with " back off [MASK] " , nme critic bob [MASK] noted starr 's success in establishing himself in the two years since the beatles ' break - up , and wrote that the single " confirmed that he and harrison , dark horses both , were the ones who had managed their solo careers more purposefully and [MASK] " compared with mccartney and lennon .

with " back off [MASK] " , nme critic bob [MASK] noted starr 's success in establishing herself in the two years since the beatles ' break - up , and wrote that the single " confirmed that he and harrison , dark horses both , were the ones who had managed their solo careers more purposefully and [MASK] " compared with mccartney and lennon .
the song was a hit in the us , reaching number 9 on the billboard hot 100 , and achieved starr 's best position on the uk singles chart , where it reached number 2 .
a promotional video for " back off [MASK] " was shot on 20 march at lennon 's tittenhurst park residence while starr was looking after the property .
the video , which shows starr walking around an outdoor structure and followed by a [MASK] - like monster , was directed by tom taylor and financed by [MASK] films .
a similar monster appeared on the single 's picture sleeve , holding a cigarette .
alan [MASK] writes of reviewers criticising " back off [MASK] " for being [MASK] , leading starr to respond in a 1973 interview : " play me a pop song that isn 't . "
on release , chris welch wrote in melody maker : " a number one hit could easily be in store for the [MASK] of rock drums .
there 's a touch of the marc [MASK] in this highly playable rhythmic [MASK] ...
it 's hypnotic and effective , ideal for [MASK] and liable to send us all mad by the end of the week . "

in a 1974 article for the nme , charles [MASK] murray highlighted " back off [MASK] " as a " great radio and [MASK] - box tune " .
among [MASK] biographers , simon [MASK] terms it " a rocking , soccer crowd chant that suited starr 's talents well " , and bruce [MASK] praises the track as a " high - energy in - your - face rocker propelled by [MASK] 's [MASK] drums and george 's [MASK] slide guitar " .
in the 2005 publication nme [MASK] : beatles – the solo years 1970 – 1980 , paul moody listed " back off [MASK] " first among starr 's " ten solo gems " and described it as " good time rock [MASK] to match the faces " .
guitar world editor damian [MASK] includes the song on his list of harrison 's ten best post - beatles " guitar [MASK] " , saying of the recording : " the main event is clearly harrison 's slightly wild , [MASK] – and very [MASK] – slide guitar solo , which includes an alternate melody line that 's even [MASK] than the melody [MASK] is singing . "

= = stop and [MASK] the roses version = =
starr recorded a new version of " back off [MASK] " for his 1981 album on [MASK] records , stop and [MASK] the roses .
starr recorded a new version of " back off [MASK] " for her 1981 album on [MASK] records , stop and [MASK] the roses .
the song was produced by starr 's friend , singer harry nilsson , and features a musical arrangement by van [MASK] parks .
similar to nilsson 's 1968 cover of the beatles ' " you can 't do that " , the remake incorporates lyrics from a number of the band 's songs – in this case , " with a little help from my friends " , " help ! "
, " lady madonna " , " good day sunshine " and " baby , you 're a rich man " , as well as starr 's " it don 't come easy " .
in a further reference to his past , the 1981 version of " back off [MASK] " opens with the same guitar riff that harrison had played on " it don 't come easy " ten years before .
in a further reference to her past , the 1981 version of " back off [MASK] " opens with the same guitar riff that harrison had played on " it don 't come easy " ten years before .
starr taped the basic track at [MASK] recording studios in los angeles on 4 november 1980 , with additional recording taking place on 1 – 5 december at nassau 's [MASK] point studios .
among the large cast of musicians supporting starr were nilsson ( vocals ) , jim [MASK] ( drums ) , jane [MASK] ( piano ) , dennis [MASK] and richie [MASK] ( guitars ) , and a four - piece horn section led by saxophonist jerry [MASK] .
starr [MASK] his vocals on 4 december , four days before the murder of john lennon , who had been due to record his contributions to stop and [MASK] the roses in january 1981 .
starr [MASK] her vocals on 4 december , four days before the murder of john lennon , who had been due to record his contributions to stop and [MASK] the roses in january 1981 .
[MASK] with his success as a solo artist in 1971 – 73 , the album continued starr 's run of commercial and critical failures since 1976 ; rodriguez writes that " [ m ] [MASK] people either love or hate the [MASK] " of " back off [MASK] " .

= = chart performance = =
= where the streets have no name =
" where the streets have no name " is a song by irish rock band u2 .
it is the opening track from their 1987 album the joshua tree and was released as the album 's third single in august 1987 .
the song 's hook is a repeating guitar [MASK] using a delay effect , played during the song 's introduction and again at the end .
lead vocalist bono wrote the lyrics in response to the notion that it is possible to identify a person 's religion and income based on the street on which they lived , particularly in belfast .
during the band 's difficulties recording the song , producer brian eno considered [MASK] the song 's tapes to have them start from scratch .
" where the streets have no name " was praised by critics and became a commercial success , peaking at number thirteen in the us , number fourteen in canada , number ten in the netherlands , and number four in the united kingdom .
the song has remained a staple of their live act since the song debuted in 1987 on the joshua tree tour .
the song was performed on a los angeles [MASK] for the filming of its music video , which won a grammy award for best performance music video .
= = writing and recording = =
the music for " where the streets have no name " originated from a demo that guitarist the edge composed the night before the group resumed the joshua tree sessions .
in an upstairs room at [MASK] house — his newly purchased home — the edge used a four - track tape machine to record an arrangement of keyboards , bass , guitar , and a drum machine .
in an upstairs room at [MASK] house — her newly purchased home — the edge used a four - track tape machine to record an arrangement of keyboards , bass , guitar , and a drum machine .
[MASK] that the album sessions were approaching the end and that the band were short on exceptional live songs , the edge wanted to " [MASK] up the ultimate u2 live - song " , so he imagined what he would like to hear at a future u2 show if he were a fan .
[MASK] that the album sessions were approaching the end and that the band were short on exceptional live songs , the edge wanted to " [MASK] up the ultimate u2 live - song " , so she imagined what he would like to hear at a future u2 show if he were a fan .
after finishing the rough mix , he felt he had come up with " the most amazing guitar part and song of [ his ] life " .
after finishing the rough mix , she felt he had come up with " the most amazing guitar part and song of [ his ] life " .
after finishing the rough mix , he felt he had come up with " the most amazing guitar part and song of [ her ] life " .
with no one in the house to share the demo with , the edge recalls dancing around and punching the air in celebration .
although the band liked the demo , it was difficult for them to record the song .
[MASK] adam clayton said , " at the time it sounded like a foreign language , whereas now we understand how it works " .
the arrangement , with two time signature shifts and frequent chord changes , was [MASK] many times , but the group struggled to get a performance they liked .
according to co - producer daniel lanois , " that was the science project song .
i remember having this massive schoolhouse [MASK] , as we call them .
i was holding a pointer , like a college professor , walking the band through the chord changes like a fucking [MASK] .
it was ridiculous . "
co - producer brian eno estimates that half of the album sessions were spent trying to record a suitable version of " where the streets have no name " .
the band worked on a single take for weeks , but as eno explained , that particular version had a lot of problems with it and the group continued trying to fix it up .
through all of their work , they had gradually replaced each instrument take until nothing remained from the original performance .
so much time had been spent on " [MASK] work " that eno thought it would be best to start from scratch .
his idea was to " stage an accident " and have the song 's tapes erased .
her idea was to " stage an accident " and have the song 's tapes erased .
he said that this was not to force abandonment of the song , but rather that it would be more effective to start again with a fresh performance .
she said that this was not to force abandonment of the song , but rather that it would be more effective to start again with a fresh performance .
at one point , eno had the tapes [MASK] up and ready to be recorded over , but this [MASK] never took place ; according to engineer flood , fellow engineer pat mccarthy returned to the control room and upon seeing eno ready to erase the tapes , dropped the [MASK] of tea he was carrying and physically restrained eno .
at one point , eno had the tapes [MASK] up and ready to be recorded over , but this [MASK] never took place ; according to engineer flood , fellow engineer pat mccarthy returned to the control room and upon seeing eno ready to erase the tapes , dropped the [MASK] of tea she was carrying and physically restrained eno .
the studio version of the song was compiled from several different takes .
it was one of several songs mixed by steve [MASK] in the final months of recording the joshua tree .
drummer larry mullen , jr. later said of the song , " it took so long to get that song right , it was difficult for us to make any sense of it .
it only became a truly great song through playing live .
on the record , musically , it 's not half the song it is live . "
= = composition = =
" where the streets have no name " is played at a tempo of 126 beats per minute .
the introduction and [MASK] are played in a 3 / 4 time signature , while the remainder of the song is in a common 4 / 4 signature .
the songs opens with an instrumental section , starting with [MASK] - like sustained [MASK] notes .
the guitar fades in after 42 seconds ; this part consists of a repeated " [MASK] " six - note [MASK] .
a " dotted eighth " delay effect is used to " play " each note in the [MASK] twice , thus creating a rich sound .
the bass and drums enter at 1 : 10 .
the introduction , following a i – iv – i – iv – vi – v – i chord progression , creates a " wall of sound " , as described by mark butler , against which the vocals emerge after nearly two minutes .
the guitar part played for the remainder of the song features the edge strumming [MASK] sixteenth notes .
the bass and drums continue in regular eighth and sixteenth notes , respectively , while bono 's vocal performance , in contrast , varies greatly in its [MASK] , ( " he [MASK] ; he [MASK] ; he [MASK] ; he [MASK] [MASK] ; he allows his voice to crack " ) as well as timing by his usage of [MASK] to slightly offset the notes he sings from the beat .
the bass and drums continue in regular eighth and sixteenth notes , respectively , while bono 's vocal performance , in contrast , varies greatly in its [MASK] , ( " she [MASK] ; he [MASK] ; he [MASK] ; he [MASK] [MASK] ; he allows his voice to crack " ) as well as timing by his usage of [MASK] to slightly offset the notes he sings from the beat .
the bass and drums continue in regular eighth and sixteenth notes , respectively , while bono 's vocal performance , in contrast , varies greatly in its [MASK] , ( " he [MASK] ; he [MASK] ; he [MASK] ; he [MASK] [MASK] ; he allows her voice to crack " ) as well as timing by his usage of [MASK] to slightly offset the notes he sings from the beat .
this development reaches a climax during the first chorus at the line " burning down love " ( a – g – f ♯ – d ) ; the melody progresses through a series of scale degrees that lead to the highest note in the song , the [MASK] at " burning " .
in later choruses , bono sings " blown by the wind " with the same melody , stretching the same note even longer .
after the third chorus , the song 's [MASK] is played , the instrumentation reverting to the same state as it was in the introduction , with a six - note guitar [MASK] played against sustained [MASK] notes .
= = lyrics = =
the lyrics were inspired by a story that bono heard about the streets of belfast , northern ireland , where a person 's religion and income are evident by the street they live on .
he contrasted this with the [MASK] he felt when visiting ethiopia , saying : " ... the guy in the song recognizes this contrast and thinks about a world where there aren 't such divisions , a place where the streets have no name .
she contrasted this with the [MASK] he felt when visiting ethiopia , saying : " ... the guy in the song recognizes this contrast and thinks about a world where there aren 't such divisions , a place where the streets have no name .
to me , that 's the way a great rock ' n ' roll concert should be : a place where everyone comes together ... maybe that 's the dream of all art : to break down the barriers and the divisions between people and touch upon the things that matter the most to us all . "
bono wrote the lyrics while on a humanitarian visit to ethiopia with his wife , ali hewson ; he first wrote them down on an [MASK] bag while staying in a village .
bono wrote the lyrics while on a humanitarian visit to ethiopia with his wife , ali hewson ; she first wrote them down on an [MASK] bag while staying in a village .
bono wrote the lyrics while on a humanitarian visit to ethiopia with her wife , ali hewson ; he first wrote them down on an [MASK] bag while staying in a village .
according to him , the song is ostensibly about " [MASK] , elevation , whatever you want to call it . "
according to her , the song is ostensibly about " [MASK] , elevation , whatever you want to call it . "
bono , who compared many of his lyrics prior to the joshua tree to " sketches " , said that " ' where the streets have no name ' is more like the u2 of old than any of the other songs on the lp , because it 's a sketch — i was just trying to sketch a location , maybe a spiritual location , maybe a romantic location .
bono , who compared many of her lyrics prior to the joshua tree to " sketches " , said that " ' where the streets have no name ' is more like the u2 of old than any of the other songs on the lp , because it 's a sketch — i was just trying to sketch a location , maybe a spiritual location , maybe a romantic location .
i was trying to sketch a feeling . "
the open - ended nature of the lyrics has led to many interpretations .
journalist michael campbell believed the lyrics send " a message of hope " and wish for a " world that is not divided by class , wealth , race , or any other arbitrary criterion " .
with regard to the place bono was referring to in the song , he said , " i 'm not sure , really , about that .
with regard to the place bono was referring to in the song , she said , " i 'm not sure , really , about that .
i used to think it was belfast ... " journalist niall stokes believes the title was influenced by bono 's and his wife ali 's visit to ethiopia as volunteer aid - workers .
i used to think it was belfast ... " journalist niall stokes believes the title was influenced by bono 's and her wife ali 's visit to ethiopia as volunteer aid - workers .
bono has expressed mixed opinions about the open - ended lyrics : " i can look at it now and recognize that [ the song ] has one of the most [MASK] couplets in the history of pop music .
but it also contains some of the biggest ideas .
in a curious way , that seems to work .
if you get any way heavy about these things , you don 't communicate .
but if you 're flip or [MASK] about it , then you do .
that 's one of the [MASK] i 've come to terms with . "
= = release = =
originally , the third single from the joshua tree was meant to be the song " red hill [MASK] town " , but " where the streets have no name " was released instead , in august 1987 .
the single was released on 7 - inch , 12 - inch , cassette and cd single formats .
three b - sides were featured on the single , including " race against time " , " silver and gold " , and " [MASK] thing " , except for the 7 - inch release , which only featured the latter two tracks .
the 12 - inch single featured " race against time " on side a of the record ( despite being a " b - side " ) , and the cassette single featured all four tracks on both sides of the tape .
although not as successful as the album 's first two singles , the song did chart well .
in the u.s. , the song peaked at number 13 on the billboard hot 100 and number 11 on the album rock tracks charts .
the song reached number four on the uk singles chart , and it topped the irish singles chart .
= = = music video = = =
the video begins with an aerial shot of a block in los angeles , and clips of radio broadcasts are heard with disc [MASK] stating that u2 is planning on performing a concert downtown and expecting crowds of 30 , 000 people .
police show up to the set and inform the band 's crew of the security issue that the film shoot is causing , due to the large number of people who are coming to watch the performance .
two minutes into the video , u2 are seen on the roof of a liquor store at the corner of 7th [MASK] and s. main st. , and perform " where the streets have no name " to a large crowd of people standing in the streets surrounding the building .
towards the end of the song , the police tell the crew that the performance is about to be shut down , and eventually police walk onto the roof while the crowd are [MASK] the police .
the video for " where the streets have no name " was directed by [MASK] avis and produced by michael [MASK] and ben [MASK] .
the band attracted over 1 , 000 people during the video 's filming , which took place on the [MASK] of a liquor store in downtown los angeles on 27 march 1987 .
the band 's performance on a [MASK] in a public place was a reference to the beatles ' final concert , as depicted in the film let it be .
during the shoot u2 played an eight - song set , which included four performances of " where the streets have no name " .
prior to filming , a week was spent reinforcing the roof of the liquor store to ensure it would not collapse if it were to be [MASK] by a group of fans .
a backup generator was put on the roof so the shooting could continue in the event that the authorities shut off the power on the primary generator , which happened during filming .
the depiction of the police attempting to shut down the video shoot due to safety concerns actually happened during filming , just as seen in the video .
[MASK] was almost arrested following a confrontation with the police .
according to avis , the events depicted in the video show what actually happened that day " almost in real time " , and that " getting [MASK] was an integral part of the plan . "
band manager paul mcguinness revealed in 2007 that much of the confrontation with the police was exaggerated ; the group were hoping to get shut down by the authorities in order to [MASK] the music video , but the police continually gave them extensions for shooting the video .
in the background of the video is a sign for the million dollar hotel , which was rebuilt to create some interest , in case no one showed up at the film shoot .
although the video is of a live performance , the audio used is from the studio - recorded version of the song .
the video won the grammy award for best performance music video at the 1989 grammy awards .
= = = b - sides = = =
" race against time " was released on the 12 - inch , cassette , and cd versions of the single .
the song developed from the band 's interest in urban funk , and was described by the edge as " a kind of afro - rhythmic piece " and " a study in rhythm . "
the bass riff in the song , inspired by the [MASK] , was played by the edge , but stemmed from some of clayton 's unused bass parts .
mullen 's drum part was recorded in a single take .
the song is primarily an instrumental piece but does contain some lyrics inspired by bono 's trip to ethiopia after live aid and his witnessing firsthand the famine in occurrence ; these lyrical references include bono singing in an ethiopian language and following it with the phrase " race against time " .
the song is primarily an instrumental piece but does contain some lyrics inspired by bono 's trip to ethiopia after live aid and her witnessing firsthand the famine in occurrence ; these lyrical references include bono singing in an ethiopian language and following it with the phrase " race against time " .
bono said of the song , " it reminds me of the desert .
the desert is so empty , but it [MASK] with a strange kind of [MASK] . "
john hutchinson of musician magazine described the song as having an " african flavour " and as being reminiscent of peter gabriel .
the track was used in the miami vice episode " child 's play " , and is the only one of the single 's b - sides that was never played live .
" silver and gold " was written in support of the artists united against [MASK] project , which protested the south african apartheid .
in 1985 , bono participated in steven van [MASK] 's anti - apartheid sun city project and spent time with keith richards and mick jagger of the rolling stones .
when richards and jagger played blues , bono was embarrassed by his lack of familiarity with the genre , as most of u2 's musical knowledge began with punk rock in their youth in the mid - 1970s .
when richards and jagger played blues , bono was embarrassed by her lack of familiarity with the genre , as most of u2 's musical knowledge began with punk rock in their youth in the mid - 1970s .
bono realised that u2 " had no tradition " , and he felt as if they " were from outer space " .
bono realised that u2 " had no tradition " , and she felt as if they " were from outer space " .
this inspired him to write the blues - influenced song " silver and gold " , which he recorded with richards and ronnie wood .
this inspired him to write the blues - influenced song " silver and gold " , which she recorded with richards and ronnie wood .
this inspired her to write the blues - influenced song " silver and gold " , which he recorded with richards and ronnie wood .
it was re - recorded by u2 for the " where the streets have no name " single while the band returned to dublin during in may 1987 during a break between the first and second legs of the joshua tree tour .
the song was described by musician as " tough and raw , with bono in [MASK] and confident voice , [MASK] by a [MASK] bass line , and with the edge demonstrating his newfound prowess in blues - based guitar . "
the song was described by musician as " tough and raw , with bono in [MASK] and confident voice , [MASK] by a [MASK] bass line , and with the edge demonstrating her newfound prowess in blues - based guitar . "
" silver and gold " was played live on the joshua tree tour several times , one performance of which was featured on the band 's 1988 album and [MASK] , rattle and hum .

the studio version was also included on the limited edition b - sides bonus disk of the band 's first compilation album , the best of 1980 – 1990 .

it was re - recorded with some lyrical alterations and released in 1998 as a single in its own right for the best of 1980 – 1990 .
hot press editor niall stokes stated that this track , along with " race against time " , is " an indicator of what u2 might have made instead of the joshua tree . "
= = critical reception = =
upon the release of the joshua tree , critics praised " where the streets have no name " .
steve [MASK] of the boston globe noted the " bell - like tones from the edge [MASK] [ e ] a search for heaven " and along with the subsequent track on the album , " i still haven 't found what i 'm looking for " , these songs showed how the group were " pilgrims still on a quest ; not preachers who claim to have found answers " .
the bergen record echoed these sentiments , saying the tracks demonstrated how the band was on a personal and spiritual quest .
rolling stone called it " assertive rock " in their review of the joshua tree .
the san diego union - tribune said of " where the streets have no name " , " the music charges , like someone fleeing for life " .
the washington post said the track is " a bit oblique lyrically , but the implications are clear in bono 's resolute delivery , dave ( the edge ) evan 's [MASK] guitar , adam clayton 's cathedral bass and larry mullen 's rolling thunder drums " .
nme lauded the song as the opening track by saying the album " starts by spitting furiously " .
the publication praised bono 's impassioned singing and the edge 's guitar playing , which transformed the instrument into " something more than an [MASK] abused piece of wood " .
the review commented that the " last ten seconds are [MASK] beautiful " .
the rocket wrote that the song builds a " wall of sound " that bono 's vocals cut through with a " [MASK] of [MASK] , as the lyrics [MASK] the need for personal spirituality " .
the reviewer compared the opening riff to [MASK] [MASK] ' " [MASK] " .
reviewing the joshua tree , stephen thomas erlewine of allmusic called the song an " epic opener " .
the service 's steve huey , in a review of the song , praised its " [MASK] , propulsive rhythmic drive and [MASK] chorus " , qualities he singled out for making it a fan favorite .

he called the song the " perfect album - opener " , [MASK] the " slow build of its arrangement toward a climactic peak " .

huey also called bono 's delivery " passionate and grandiose " and " his commitment to the material [MASK] " .

= = live performances = =
" where the streets have no name " made its concert debut on 2 april 1987 in [MASK] , arizona on the opening night of the joshua tree tour .
it has since been played at nearly every full - length concert that u2 has [MASK] , totaling over 700 performances as of 2011 .
the song is widely regarded as one of the group 's most popular live songs .
bono said of it , " we can be in the middle of the worst gig in our lives , but when we go into that song , everything changes .
the audience is on its feet , singing along with every word .
it 's like god suddenly walks through the room . "
on the joshua tree tour , " where the streets have no name " was most often used to open concerts .
fans and critics responded favourably to the song in a live setting .
the san diego union - tribune wrote that , " from the [MASK] sonic opening strains of [ the song ] , this audience was up , [MASK] and [MASK] . "
nme wrote that the song is one such occasion where " the power afforded their songs is scary " , noting that during the song 's opening , " the arena [MASK] " .
in other reviews , the song was called : " [MASK] " , " [MASK] " , and " powerful " .
out of the 109 shows during the joshua tree tour , " streets " was played at all except 12 of the concerts .
during the [MASK] tour which took place in 1989 and the beginning of 1990 , " streets " was only left out of the set list at one of the 47 concerts .
the song was performed at every show on the 1992 – 1993 zoo tv tour .
concerts from this tour were elaborate [MASK] [MASK] that bono performed as a variety of characters , but for the end of the main set , the group reverted to playing classics , including " where the streets have no name " , straight .
some of these performances of the song were accompanied by footage of the group in the desert from the joshua tree 's photo shoot .
the video was [MASK] up for humorous effect — nme described the effect as giving it a " silly , charlie [MASK] quality " — and bono often acknowledged his younger self on the video screens .
the video was [MASK] up for humorous effect — nme described the effect as giving it a " silly , charlie [MASK] quality " — and bono often acknowledged her younger self on the video screens .
this video would make a return during performances on the 2010 and 2011 legs of the u2 360 ° tour .
some of the zoo tv performances of the song had a more electronic dance music arrangement that bore a resemblance to the pet shop boys ' synthpop cover of the song ( titled " where the streets have no name ( i can 't take my eyes off you ) " ) .
bono parodied this by occasionally adopting the deadpan vocal style used in the pet shop boys ' cover .
critics welcomed the song in the group 's setlist : the independent said the song " [MASK] instant euphoria , as u2 do what they 're best at , slipping into epic rock mode , playing music made for the arena " .
in two other local newspaper reviews , critics praised the song 's inclusion in a sequence of greatest hits .
for the popmart tour of 1997 – 1998 , u2 returned to the electronic dance arrangement they occasionally played on the zoo tv tour .
the set 's massive video screen displayed a video that hot press described as an " astonishing , 2001 - style trip into the heart of a [MASK] , psychedelic tunnel that sucks the audience in towards a horizontal [MASK] " .
near the end of the song , peace [MASK] were shown on the screen and bright beams of light flanking the set 's golden arch were projected upwards .
hot press said the effect transformed the stadium into a " ufo landing site " .
shortly before the third leg of the [MASK] tour , the september 11 attacks occurred in new york city and washington d.c. during the band 's first show in new york city following the attacks , the band performed " where the streets have no name " , and when the stage lights illuminated the audience , the band saw tears streaming down the faces of many fans .
the experience was one inspiration for the song " city of [MASK] lights " .
the band paid tribute to the 9 / 11 victims during their performance of the song at the super bowl [MASK] halftime show on 3 february 2002 .
the performance featured the names of the september 11 victims projected onto a large white banner behind the band .
u2 's appearance was later ranked number 1 on sports illustrated 's list of " top 10 super bowl [MASK] [MASK] " .
for the vertigo tour , the group originally considered dropping the song from their [MASK] , but mullen and clayton successfully argued against this .
all 131 of the vertigo tour concerts featured a performance of the song , which were accompanied by the stage 's led video [MASK] displaying african flags .
on the tour 's opening night , this reminded bono that he had originally written the lyrics in an ethiopian village .
on the tour 's opening night , this reminded bono that she had originally written the lyrics in an ethiopian village .
he thought this visual accompaniment made the song come full circle , saying , " and here it was , nearly twenty years later , coming back to africa , all the stuff about [MASK] lands and [MASK] making sense for the first time . "
she thought this visual accompaniment made the song come full circle , saying , " and here it was , nearly twenty years later , coming back to africa , all the stuff about [MASK] lands and [MASK] making sense for the first time . "
the song was also played at the preview screening of the band 's concert film u2 3d at the 2007 cannes film festival .
at the glastonbury festival 2010 , the edge accompanied rock band [MASK] for a live cover version of the track , later playing it with u2 while headlining glastonbury in 2011 .
live performances of " where the streets have no name " appear in the concert video releases rattle and hum , zoo tv : live from sydney , and popmart : live from mexico city , as well as the respective audio releases of the latter two concerts , zoo tv live and hasta la vista baby !
u2 live from mexico city .
a second version from the popmart tour was featured on please : [MASK] live ep , and later on the u.s. " please " single .
a live recording from boston during the [MASK] tour was featured in the concert film [MASK] 2001 : live from boston , and on the " walk on " and " electrical storm " singles .
the concert video and album u2 go home : live from [MASK] castle , ireland featured another performance from the [MASK] tour , and later performances were featured in the concert films vertigo 2005 : live from chicago and u2 3d ( vertigo tour ) , and u2 360 ° at the rose bowl ( u2 360 ° tour ) .
the 2004 digital album , live from the point depot , contains a performance from the [MASK] tour , only available as part of the complete u2 digital box set .
= = legacy = =
in 2002 , q magazine named " where the streets have no name " the [MASK] " most exciting tune ever " .
the following year , q ranked the song at number [MASK] in a special edition titled " [MASK] best songs ever " .
three years later , the magazine 's readers voted the track the 43rd - greatest song in history .
rolling stone ranked the song at number 28 on its list of the " 100 greatest guitar songs of all time . "
in a 2010 poll by fan site [MASK] u2 , approximately 29 % of 4 , 800 [MASK] named " where the streets have no name " as their favourite song from the joshua tree , ranking it as the most popular song from the album .
in 2010 , american sports network espn used the track , among other u2 songs , in commercials for the 2010 fifa world cup , with the south african [MASK] gospel choir adding vocals to the song .
the advertisement , titled " [MASK] island " , portrays south african political prisoners during the apartheid era forming a soccer team .
there are plans to bring a recording of the [MASK] - supported performance to retail .
composer john [MASK] used the introductory guitar theme in his 2009 piece for wind ensemble , aurora [MASK] .
composer john [MASK] used the introductory guitar theme in her 2009 piece for wind ensemble , aurora [MASK] .
the song 's introduction was used by the vancouver canucks hockey team at the start each of their home games , when the players take to the ice .
the baltimore [MASK] also use the song as they enter m & t bank stadium before home games .
the marquette golden eagles men 's basketball team uses this song in their entrance video before all home games at the [MASK] harris bradley center .
the song is also used by the wisconsin [MASK] football team for their entrance video at camp randall stadium prior to all home games .
the kansas [MASK] men 's basketball team uses the song during their starting [MASK] at allen [MASK] .

= [MASK] [MASK] reaction =
the [MASK] [MASK] reaction ( often referred to as simply the [MASK] [MASK] ) is a chemical reaction used in organic chemistry for the synthesis of [MASK] .
the reaction is typically divided into classical and modern variants , depending on the reagents and substrates employed .
it was originally discovered by ivan [MASK] [MASK] ( 1906 – 1957 ) in 1941 while studying the [MASK] of [MASK] vinyl [MASK] .
as originally described , the [MASK] [MASK] involves the activation of a [MASK] [MASK] using a stoichiometric lewis acid or [MASK] acid promoter .
the key step of the reaction mechanism involves a [MASK] [MASK] - [MASK] ring closure which forms the [MASK] product ( see [MASK] below ) .
as the reaction has been developed , variants involving substrates other than [MASK] [MASK] and [MASK] other than lewis acids have been subsumed under the name [MASK] [MASK] provided that they follow a similar [MASK] pathway .
the success of the [MASK] [MASK] as a tool in organic synthesis stems from the utility and [MASK] of [MASK] as both motifs in natural products ( including [MASK] , the [MASK] , and a [MASK] of [MASK] ) and as useful synthetic [MASK] for total synthesis .
the reaction has been used in several total syntheses and several reviews have been published .
= = [MASK] = =
the mechanism of the classical [MASK] [MASK] reaction was first demonstrated experimentally by [MASK] to be an [MASK] [MASK] and is outlined below .
[MASK] of the [MASK] by the acid catalyst generates a [MASK] cation which undergoes a [MASK] allowed [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] as dictated by the woodward - hoffman rules .
this generates an [MASK] cation which undergoes an elimination reaction to lose a β - hydrogen .
subsequent [MASK] of the [MASK] produces the [MASK] product .
as noted above , variants that deviate from this template are known ; what [MASK] a [MASK] [MASK] in particular is the generation of the [MASK] cation followed by [MASK] ring closure to an [MASK] cation .
in order to achieve this transformation , the molecule must be in the s - trans / s - trans conformation , placing the vinyl groups in an appropriate orientation .
the [MASK] of the system to enter this conformation dramatically influences reaction rate , with α - substituted substrates having an increased population of the [MASK] [MASK] due to [MASK] strain .
[MASK] of an electron [MASK] α - [MASK] by the catalyst can likewise increase the reaction rate by enforcing this conformation .
similarly , β - substitution directed inward [MASK] the s - trans conformation so severely that e - z [MASK] has been shown to occur in advance of [MASK] on a wide range of substrates , yielding the trans [MASK] regardless of initial configuration .
in this way , the [MASK] [MASK] is a rare example of a [MASK] [MASK] reaction , whereas most [MASK] are [MASK] .
the example below uses [MASK] hydride to trap the [MASK] cation so that no elimination occurs .
( see [MASK] [MASK] below )
along this same vein , [MASK] vinyl [MASK] of the type studied extensively by marcus [MASK] of the university of hawaii show dramatic rate acceleration due to the removal of β - [MASK] , [MASK] a large amount of [MASK] strain in the s - [MASK] [MASK] .
= = classical [MASK] [MASK] = =
though [MASK] following the general template above had been observed prior to [MASK] 's involvement , it was his study of the [MASK] of [MASK] vinyl [MASK] that marked the first major examination of this process .
though [MASK] following the general template above had been observed prior to [MASK] 's involvement , it was her study of the [MASK] of [MASK] vinyl [MASK] that marked the first major examination of this process .
[MASK] correctly reasoned that the [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] in situ to form a [MASK] [MASK] before ring closure to the [MASK] product .
the reaction shown below involves an [MASK] [MASK] reaction to generate the [MASK] [MASK] .
research involving the reaction was relatively quiet in subsequent years , until in the mid - 1980s when several syntheses employing the [MASK] [MASK] were published .
[MASK] below are key steps in the syntheses of [MASK] and nor - [MASK] , the latter of which is thought to proceed via an unusual [MASK] - [MASK] [MASK] that generates the [MASK] [MASK] .
= = = [MASK] = = =
the classical version of the [MASK] [MASK] suffers from several drawbacks which modern variants attempt to [MASK] .
the first two are not evident from the mechanism alone , but are indicative of the barriers to [MASK] ; the last three stem from selectivity issues relating to elimination and [MASK] of the intermediate .
strong lewis or [MASK] acids are typically required for the reaction ( e.g.
[MASK] , [MASK] , [MASK] ) .
these [MASK] are not compatible with sensitive functional groups , limiting the substrate scope .
despite the [MASK] possibility for catalysis , multiple equivalents of the promoter are often required in order to effect the reaction .
this limits the atom economy of the reaction .
the elimination step is not [MASK] ; if multiple β - [MASK] are available for elimination , various products are often observed as mixtures .
this is highly undesirable from an efficiency standpoint as [MASK] separation is typically required .
[MASK] destroys a potential [MASK] , decreasing the potential usefulness of the reaction .
[MASK] of the [MASK] is sometimes not [MASK] , meaning that products can be formed as mixtures of [MASK] .
= = modern variants = =
the shortcomings noted above limit the usefulness of the [MASK] [MASK] reaction in its canonical form .
however , modifications to the reaction focused on [MASK] its issues continue to be an active area of academic research .
in particular , the research has focused on a few key areas : rendering the reaction catalytic in the promoter , [MASK] the reaction with more mild [MASK] to improve functional group tolerance , directing the [MASK] of the elimination step , and improving the overall [MASK] .
these have been successful to varying degrees .
additionally , modifications focused on altering the progress of the reaction , either by generating the [MASK] cation in an unorthodox fashion or by having the [MASK] cation " intercepted " in various ways .
furthermore , enantioselective variants of various kinds have been developed .
the sheer volume of literature on the subject prevents a comprehensive examination of this field ; key examples are given below .
= = = [MASK] - directed [MASK] = = =
the earliest efforts to improve the selectivity of the [MASK] [MASK] took advantage of the β - silicon effect in order to direct the [MASK] of the elimination step .
this chemistry was developed most extensively by professor scott denmark of the university of illinois , [MASK] - [MASK] in the mid - 1980s and utilizes stoichiometric amounts of iron [MASK] to promote the reaction .
with [MASK] products , the [MASK] [MASK] was selected for to varying degrees .
the silicon - directed [MASK] [MASK] reaction was subsequently employed in the synthesis of the natural product [MASK] , shown below .
the [MASK] takes place before elimination of the [MASK] alcohol [MASK] , so that the resulting [MASK] of the newly formed ring arises from approach of the [MASK] [MASK] anti to the [MASK] .
= = = [MASK] = = =
drawing on the [MASK] effects compiled over various trials of the reaction , professor alison frontier of the university of rochester developed a paradigm for " polarized " [MASK] [MASK] in which electron [MASK] and electron withdrawing groups are used to improve the overall selectivity of the reaction .
creation of an effective vinyl [MASK] and vinyl [MASK] in the substrate allows catalytic activation with copper [MASK] and [MASK] elimination .
in addition , the electron withdrawing group increases the [MASK] of the α - proton , allowing selective formation of the trans - α - [MASK] via [MASK] .
it is often possible to achieve catalytic activation using a [MASK] or withdrawing group alone , although the efficiency of the reaction ( yield , reaction time , etc . )
is typically lower .
= = = alternative cation generation = = =
by extension , any [MASK] cation regardless of its origin is capable of undergoing a [MASK] [MASK] .
there have been a large number of examples published where the [MASK] cation is arrived at by a variety of [MASK] .
one such example involves the silver [MASK] [MASK] ring opening of [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] .
the silver salt facilitates loss of chloride via precipitation of [MASK] silver chloride .
in the total synthesis of [MASK] , [MASK] of a vinyl [MASK] [MASK] likewise generates a [MASK] cation via ring opening of the resultant [MASK] .
= = = [MASK] [MASK] = = =
once the [MASK] has occurred , an [MASK] cation is formed .
as discussed extensively above , the typical course for this intermediate is elimination followed by [MASK] [MASK] .
however , these two steps can be interrupted by various [MASK] and [MASK] , respectively .
[MASK] cation trapping has been developed extensively by [MASK] g. west of the university of alberta and his review covers the field .
[MASK] cation trapping has been developed extensively by [MASK] g. west of the university of alberta and her review covers the field .
the [MASK] cation can be trapped with [MASK] and carbon [MASK] and can also undergo [MASK] [MASK] with various [MASK] partners .
[MASK] below is a cascade reaction in which successive cation trapping generates a [MASK] core in one step with complete diastereoselectivity .
[MASK] trapping with various [MASK] is [MASK] less common .
in one study , the [MASK] [MASK] is paired with a michael reaction using an [MASK] catalyst to initiate nucleophilic [MASK] addition of the [MASK] to β - [MASK] .
in this tandem reaction the [MASK] catalyst is required for both [MASK] : it acts as the lewis acid in the [MASK] [MASK] and in the next step the [MASK] group of [MASK] first coordinates to [MASK] in a ligand exchange with the [MASK] [MASK] oxygen atom before the actual michael addition takes place to the opposite face of the r - group .
= = = [MASK] variants = = =
the development of an enantioselective [MASK] [MASK] is a desirable addition to the repertoire of [MASK] [MASK] reactions .
to that end , several variations have been developed utilizing [MASK] [MASK] and [MASK] [MASK] .
[MASK] [MASK] are also known , in which extant [MASK] direct the [MASK] .
almost all of the attempts are based on the idea of [MASK] ; selecting one direction for the vinyl groups to " [MASK] " in turn sets the [MASK] as shown below .
[MASK] - directed [MASK] [MASK] can exhibit induced diastereoselectivity in this way .
in the example below , the [MASK] - group acts to direct the [MASK] by preventing the distant [MASK] from rotating " towards " it via unfavorable [MASK] interaction .
in this way the silicon acts as a [MASK] auxiliary .
( the starting material is not [MASK] but the retention of enantiomeric excess suggests that the auxiliary directs the [MASK] . )
[MASK] 's [MASK] substrates can exhibit axial to [MASK] [MASK] transfer if [MASK] [MASK] are used .
the example below generates a [MASK] [MASK] in 64 % yield and 95 % enantiomeric excess .
[MASK] has additionally developed a camphor - based auxiliary for [MASK] [MASK] that was employed in the first asymmetric synthesis of [MASK] .
the key step employs an unusual mixture of [MASK] - 2 - [MASK] and [MASK] as solvent .
the first [MASK] lewis acid promoted asymmetric [MASK] [MASK] was reported by [MASK] aggarwal and utilized copper ( ii ) [MASK] ligand complexes with up to 98 % ee .
the enantiomeric excess was unaffected by use of 50 [MASK] % of the copper complex but the yield was significantly decreased .
= = related reactions = =
[MASK] of the [MASK] [MASK] are generally also subsumed under the same name .
for example , an α - β , γ - [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] can undergo a similar [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] that is typically referred to as an [MASK] - [MASK] [MASK] reaction .
other such extensions have been given similar names , including [MASK] - [MASK] [MASK] and [MASK] [MASK] [MASK] .
= = = [MASK] - [MASK] reaction = = =
because they [MASK] the [MASK] cation , β - electron [MASK] [MASK] often severely impede [MASK] [MASK] .
building from this , several [MASK] ring openings of β - [MASK] [MASK] have been reported .
these are typically referred to as retro - [MASK] [MASK] reactions .
= = = [MASK] - [MASK] reaction = = =
[MASK] [MASK] of the [MASK] [MASK] reaction ( known as [MASK] - [MASK] [MASK] reactions ) have few instances ; there is one example of a [MASK] [MASK] - [MASK] [MASK] reported ( shown below ) , and several [MASK] - [MASK] - [MASK] reactions in the literature .
even these tend to suffer from poor [MASK] , poor yields , or narrow scope .
the difficulty stems from the relative over - stabilization of the [MASK] cation by electron donation , [MASK] [MASK] .
= [MASK] [MASK] =
[MASK] [MASK] is a 2011 american black comedy film directed by seth gordon , written by michael [MASK] , john francis [MASK] and jonathan goldstein , based on a story by [MASK] .
it stars jason bateman , charlie day , jason sudeikis , jennifer aniston , colin farrell , kevin spacey , and jamie [MASK] .
the plot follows three friends , played by bateman , day , and sudeikis , who decide to murder their respective overbearing , abusive bosses , portrayed by spacey , aniston and farrell .
[MASK] 's script was bought by new line cinema in 2005 and the film spent six years in various states of pre - production , with a variety of actors attached to different roles .
by 2010 , goldstein and [MASK] had rewritten the script , and the film finally went into production .
the film premiered in los angeles on june 30 , 2011 , and received a wide release on july 8 , 2011 .
the film exceeded financial expectations , [MASK] over $ 28 million in the first three days , making it the number two film in the united states during its opening weekend , and going on to become the highest - grossing black comedy film of all time in [MASK] dollars , breaking the record previously set by the war of the roses in 1990 .
the film grossed over $ [MASK] million worldwide during its theatrical run .
the film opened to positive critical reception , with several critics praising the ensemble cast , with each lead being singled out for their performances across reviews .
the plot received a more mixed response ; some reviewers felt that its dark , humorous premise was explored well , while others felt the jokes were racist , [MASK] , and [MASK] .
a sequel , [MASK] [MASK] 2 , was released on november 26 , 2014 .

= = = development = = =
[MASK] 's script for [MASK] [MASK] was sold at auction to new line cinema by [MASK] 's production company rat entertainment in 2005 for a six - figure amount .
[MASK] initially was interested in directing , but became occupied with directing the comedy tower [MASK] .
frank [MASK] and david [MASK] were in talks to direct .
jonathan goldstein and john francis [MASK] rewrote the script in 2010 , and the project went into production with seth gordon directing .
= = = design = = =
production designer shepherd [MASK] specifically set out to create distinctly different environments for the three employees and their respective bosses ' homes and offices .
nick and [MASK] 's workplace is the " [MASK] " bullpen , which was designed to " enhance the discomfort and anxiety of lower - level employees clustered in the center of the room where every movement is monitored by the boss from his corner office . "
nick and [MASK] 's workplace is the " [MASK] " bullpen , which was designed to " enhance the discomfort and anxiety of lower - level employees clustered in the center of the room where every movement is monitored by the boss from her corner office . "
the design team met with financial [MASK] and management companies to learn about the architecture of their office layouts to visually represent the experience of starting from a low - ranking position in a [MASK] and aspiring to an office .
costume designer carol ramsey worked with [MASK] and set [MASK] jan [MASK] to match [MASK] 's suit to that of the surrounding " cold grey and blue " color palette of his office .
costume designer carol ramsey worked with [MASK] and set [MASK] jan [MASK] to match [MASK] 's suit to that of the surrounding " cold grey and blue " color palette of her office .

[MASK] 's home was described as " equally lacking in warmth " as the office but more lavishly decorated and " for show " , including an intentionally oversized portrait of her with his " trophy wife " .
